Ella se dedica a vender alimentos naturistas desde hace 6 años, comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio por que los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos. Ella ya habia pedido créditos anteriormente y comenta que con este nuevo prestamo se a beneficiado mucho ya que puede comprar por mayoreo y así obtiene mejores precios aumentando sus ganancias. Su deseo de ella es que algún día pueda poner un local para vender sus productos y tener por lo menos 2 empleadas de su misma comunidad. La señora Maria del Carmen quiere ofrecerle a sus hijos una carrera, ya que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios porque muy chica se caso y tuvo que ayudar a sus padres a la economia de su hogar, lo cual lo hizo con mucho gusto, pero quiere un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Ella se reunio con las demás integrantes y formarón un equipo de futboll en la colonia y representan dignamente su localidad desde hace algunos años, lo cual les trae mucha satisfaccion personal.
texts.en:
This group is called Paloma (Dove). It is located in the state of México and consists of 13 members. Among them is Señora Maria del Carmen P. H., who is 35 years old. She has been married for 16 years and has 5 children, 2 girls and 3 boys, who are all in school. She sells natural foods and has been doing this for 6 years. She comments that she decided to begin her business because her husband's income many times wasn't enough to cover their necessities and those of their children. She had already applied for loans in the past and comments that with this new loan she will benefit a lot, since she can buy wholesale and thus obtain better prices, increasing her earnings. 

Her dream is that some day she can set up a shop where she can sell her products and have at least two employees from the her community. Señora Maria del Carmen wants to be able to give her children careers, since she was not able to finish her schooling because she married very young and had to help her parents with the household economics. She did this with great pleasure, but she wants a better future for her children. She joined with the other members of the group and formed a soccer team in their district, and they have represented their town with dignity for several years, which brought them great personal satisfaction.

loans.use: Buy natural foods

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland and Alma S. own My Culinary Solution, a staffing agency connecting culinary professionals to companies in need of their talents.  They provide their clients trained personnel ranging from dishwashers to professional chefs, be it for a few hours or several months.  Roland and Alma maintain a database of professionals registered with My Culinary Solution, which they use to evaluate suitable personnel for their clients.  

Outside of My Culinary Solution, Roland is the operating manager for all food venues at a Houston-area college.  He oversees everything from specially catered events to student dining options.  Roland has extensive experience in the food-service industry.  After starting in the food industry as a dishwasher, Roland went on to become a chef before moving into operations management.  Roland’s extensive industry experience provides him the insight and expertise necessary to facilitate good matches between clients and employees.

Roland and Alma prepared themselves for small business ownership by taking business start-up courses at a local university.   Alma handles the My Culinary Solution’s day-to-day operations, with the help of a bilingual assistant and sales representative.  She says her biggest challenge at the moment is raising awareness of My Culinary Solution and the services it offers.  As Alma explains, many people have not heard of this kind of business.  

Money for this loan is being used for advertising through local media outlets, as well as for helping meet initial payroll expenses.  In addition to advertising through newspapers, Alma is growing the business by contacting culinary training institutions to connect with soon-to-graduate students in need of work.  

They believe My Culinary Solution offers a service that has the potential to take off in a big way, and hope to someday expand the business beyond the Houston area.  But those are dreams for down the road.  With the business still in its early stages, Roland works up to 16 hour days between his full-time job and My Culinary Solution.  Small business ownership is a challenge that excites them, and they are wholly dedicated to making My Culinary Solution a sustainable business.

loans.use: Advertising and meeting the intial payroll

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a mother of one daughter and three sons, Maha and her husband Awny, who appears in the picture here, as Maha is a religious woman, have a small business raising bees and producing honey for sale. Maha and her husband needed more bee cells to increase the production. Maha took a loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Maha and her family live in Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip, which is known for its high population.

loans.use: To purchase bee's cells

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es: Amancio, es un hombre trabajador de 44 años; que junto a su esposa Rina y sus 6 hijos conforman una hermosa familia. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. La perseverancia es la principal virtud que tiene, trabaja durante la noche desde hace 5 meses en una empresa privada, que se dedica a la realización de una hidroeléctrica. Aportando de esa manera un dinero extra a su hogar. “Cuando me dedicaba solamente a la agricultura, tenía ingresos escasos”, afirma.  Amancio, tiene 30 años sembrando lechuga, papa y una variedad de hortalizas. Todas las mañanas se dedica a su cuidado y fertilización, pues trabaja sin descanso, para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y verlos convertidos en personas capaces y profesionales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder negociar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pues ahí; ve reflejado la recompensa de un arduo trabajo.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente feliz de poder pertenecer a una asociación responsable y comprometida. Amancio, dentro de muy pronto cosechará lechuga, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, que oscila entre los S/. 600 soles cada uno, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos de cultivo que muy pronto cosechará, asimismo desea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Amancio, is a 44 year old worker; who with his wife Rina and their 6 children form a lovely family. They live together in their own home, located in the village of Pongo. Perserverance is his key virtue, he has been working during the night for the last 5 months for a private company, whose business is in the hydroelectric field. He brings in extra money for his household by this means. “When I only work in agriculture, I only have limited income”, he states.  Amancio, has for 30 years grown lettuce, potato and a variety of vegetables. Every morning is focused on their care and fertilization, as he works without rest, to be able to get his children ahead and see them grow into capable and professional people. What he likes the most about his work is to be able to trade his harvests at the wholesaler market in the city, as there; he sees the reward for his hard work.  He belongs to the “Paraíso al progreso” communal bank, and this is the third loan he has had with MFP, and where he feels happy to be able to belong to a responsible and committed association. Amancio, will very shortly be harvesting his lettuce, and with the loan he is thinking of buying 2 bags of pea seeds, which cost about S/. 600 soles each, which he will scatter on his farm land which will soon be harvested. He also wants to buy several sacks of organic fertilzer.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of pea seeds, and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert C. and his wife, Cece, produce “The Wedding and Quinceañera Planner,” a book offering checklists in English and Spanish that help ease the stress of ceremony planning.  It includes tips and tools for handling a variety of tasks, from ordering flowers to creating registries, even offering a final wedding day checklist for the maid of honor.

Albert explains that the planner isn’t meant to cover every contingency, but serve as a point of reference.  “If this were a complete list, then this would be a cookie-cutter event, and you’d sign up for a color and a date, and we’d crank you through.  But it’s not supposed to do that.  This is supposed to be your great day.  You’ve never done this before, so you need a starting point. This is your starting point.”

Publishing the book is a team effort. Albert handles advertisement sales and the book’s distribution.  Cece does editing and advertisement design.  All of the firms that advertise in “The Wedding and Quinceñeara Planner” distribute copies of the book to their customers.  Cece and Albert print an updated copy of “The Wedding and Quinceañera Planner” every 6 months.

Albert and Cece provide the “The Wedding and Quiceañera Planner” free to customers because they generate revenue through advertisements.  Unfortunately, this year some of the advertisers were late with their payments.  “We had been expanding until about a year ago, when we had a few advertisers decide not to renew their contracts. This fall, we had more that decided not to renew, and I had a hard time collecting the money.”  Because publishing requires up-front payment, this put them in a bind. “We decided we needed to do something to get the books printed so we’d have them to hand out at the wedding fair.  We went to the bank and didn’t quite meet their criteria, but she recommended ACCION to us.”

The loan provided Albert and Cece the funds needed to publish the planner in time for the semi-annual wedding fair, their biggest business event.  Without this loan, Albert and Cece would have had to refund what advertising revenues they had collected and would not have been able to publish the book.  Albert and Cece advise other business owners to “Keep an eye on your receivables.  Don’t expect it (money) to automatically flow in.”

Albert and Cece believe in the long-term potential of their business as much as they believe in the product they offer.  Albert says that business is picking up again, and that he and Cece are continuing to receive positive feedback from customers.  “One couple told me, ‘I bought a formal planner, but it hasn’t been nearly as informative as your book’… That’s rewarding.  Knowing that a couple is sampling from your publication and they’re on the right feet.”

Albert and Cece started this business six years ago, after family friends started a similar business in another city.  They saw that Corpus Christi didn’t have an equivalent service, and decided to create one based on their friends’ recommendation.  Albert and Cece and their five children are supported by this business.  To learn more about Albert and Cece’s business, visit their website http://www.coastalbendweddings.com/.

loans.use: To publish a catalog/book for wedding and quinceañera planning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y reside con su familia en el caserío El  Pueblito, que se encuentra en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, ella siembra maracuyá y mango en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta cercano a su domicilio. Natividad ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos familiares con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad. 

Natividad desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de mango y maracuyá, con esta acción ella espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Natividad es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Natividad is 55 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the community of El  Pueblito, which is located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has done farming work for many years. She plants passion fruit and mangos on a small plot of land she has close to her house. Natividad helps her husband pay for the family expenses with the income she receives from this activity.   

Natividad wants to acquire fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her mango and passion fruit crops. By doing this, she hopes to obtain a good harvest. That it why she saw the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

Natividad is a very calm and responsible person. Her greatest wish is to grow as a businesswoman and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: To acquire fertilizer and pesticide for her crops.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre soltera, ella tiene 42 años de edad y reside junto a sus tres hijos en el caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan, que se encuentra en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Paula se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Adicionalmente ella cría en su domicilio aves de corral a las cuales alimenta y cuando alcanza un nivel adecuado las vende a sus vecinos. Paula se vale de los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad para solventar la economía de su familia.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de carrito sanguchero para poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de platos de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Paula is a single mother. She is 42 years old and lives with her three children in the community of Santa Rosa de Curvan, located in a rural area of Tambogrande, an agricultural area in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Paula works in the preparation and sale of food. She makes the food in her house to later sell to the general public. The business is popular with customers because of the good seasoning she uses to make the food. She also raises poultry in her house. She feeds them, and when they are big enough, she sells them to her neighbors. Paula depends on the income she makes from this activity to pay for her family's budget.   

Paula wants to grow her business by buying a sandwich cart to be able to offer her customers a variety of dishes and thus increase her sales. That is why she has decided that it is in her interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy a sandwich cart

loans.name: La Garita Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LA GARITA" ya que la mayoría de los integrantes son de la misma colonia con este nombre. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Atlacomulco estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito. Secundina G. R. es una de las integrante del grupo.Tiene 35 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, se dedica al hogar y atiende su negocio, tiene en total 3 hijos los cuales son varones. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar a sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela todos los dias por la mañana, despues se va a trabajar. Su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años tuvo la necesidad de buscar una alternativa para poder apoyar la economia de su hogar. Solicita el prestamo para poder invertir e implementar otros productos a su tienda ya que sus clientes le solicitando carnes frias. La señora Secundina se siente muy satisfecha y agusto ya que le dan la posibilllidad de hacer crecer su negocio. La señora comenta que tiene planes de seguir invirtiendo para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Garita" after the colony by the same name which most of the group members belong to. The group are located in the community of Atlacomulco in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of ten members and this is the first time they have requested a loan. Secundina G. R. is one of the group members. She is 35 years old and studied until Grade 6 in primary school. She attends to home duties, her business and her three sons. Secundina wakes up very early every day to get her children ready and take them to school, and later she goes to work. 

Secundina started her business four years ago as she was looking for an alternative to support her family financially. She is applying for this loan to invest in products for her store as her customers are requesting cold meats. 

Secundina feels very happy and satisfied with the possibility of expanding her business. She has said that she has plans to continue investing in her business to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cold meats

loans.name: America I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama América 1, y está ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un crédito. Rocío Ríos Hernández es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 27 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es comerciante y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo que inicio desde hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para poder surtir pedidos y capitalizar su negocio. Sus clientes nos comentan que la conocieron por ser muy luchona y porque hacia su promoción del producto casa por casa, por ese motivo decidieron comprar sus productos con ella, al solicitar el préstamo se siente muy feliz por el apoyo, con entusiasmo ella invierte en sus catálogos. También espera en un futuro poder vender más y capitalizar su negocio para poder ser distribuidora de productos por catalogo y darle la oportunidad a más personas de poder emprender su propio negocio y así ayudar a su comunidad. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Nancy G..
texts.en:
This group is called America 1 and is located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico. The group is made up of eight members and this is the second time that they are applying for a loan. 

Rocío Ríos Hernández is the treasurer of the group. She is 27 years of age and studied until Year 9 of secondary school. She is a merchant and has a five year old son. 

Rocio has worked selling shoes from a catalogue for five years. She is requesting a loan to supply shoes that her customers have ordered and capitalise on her business. Her customers tell us that they decided to buy products from Rocio because she sells them from door-to-door and because she has a fighting spirit. 

Rocio feels very happy with Kiva's support and she is enthusiastic about investing in her catalogues. She also hopes to be able to sell more products in the future and capitalise on her business so she can be a distributor of catalogue products and give other people the opportunity to start their own business and help their community. 

The woman that cannot be seen clearly in the photo is Nancy G..

loans.use: To supply shoes that her customers have ordered and capitalise on her business

loans.name: Munhuu

texts.en:
Munhuu, 37, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Their home is located on land that they own. Her older daughter attends a local secondary school and her younger son goes to kindergarten. Munhuu was born in Gobi-Altai province, in southwest Mongolia, where she finished high school. Then she obtained her bachelor's degree in biology and finance management at the National University of Mongolia in 2007 and 2011 respectively.

She started to operate a public transportation business with her husband in 2007. They have their own microbus, which her husband drives while she is a conductor. Now their business has become more stable and their daily profit is 50,000 MNT. Munhuu is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT as they need money to buy a new microbus.

loans.use: To buy a new microbus

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa, 51, is married and lives with his wife, two children and two nephews in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own, on the outskirts of the city. His two children who are 25 and 30 are currently unemployed and his two nephews go to kindergarten. His wife helps him with the business. They have a decent standard of living. 

In 1997, Nyamdavaa began operating a food store near his home which is located in a crowded district on the outskirts of the city. Now he has a special license to operate his shop. His daily gross income is 500,000 MNT and his monthly profit is between 600,000-1,000,000 MNT. The food he sells in his shop is purchased from local markets. He was able to build his home with the profits from his business. He is a business-minded, intelligent person who says, " Life is full of good surprises if you truly enjoy them." He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more food to sell at his store.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor, 54, is married and lives with her husband, daughter and two nephews in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband is retired and receives a pension of 105,000 MNT and her daughter works as a salesperson at a bakery shop where she is paid 230,000 MNT monthly. Her two nephews attend a local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. 

Dolgor used to operate a food shop between 2004 and 2006 before she started her current business. Since 2007, she makes handmade items for gers, Mongolian nomadic housing tents, such as ropes used like a belt to keep the ger stable. She purchases the necessary production materials from the local market and sells them back as ropes, belts and ties used for building a ger. Her monthly profit is 200,000-300,000 MNT. She wants to enlarge her workshop and expand her business. She is a hardworking and brave person who says, "I would like to enlarge my workshop and expand my business." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more material to make items for gers and, also, to enlarge her current workshop.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Oyumaasuren

texts.en: Oyumaasuren, 36, is widowed and lives with her three children in Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her older two daughters attend a local secondary school and her youngest son goes to kindergarten. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her husband passed away in 2010 so she is responsible for taking care of her family. She began operating a hair salon in Uliastai city, the center of Zavhan province, in 1998. She participates in contests organized by local hairdressers and most often wins a prize. As an experienced hairdresser who has been operating a hair salon for more than 12 years, she also trains students at a vocational school. Oyumaasuren is popular in her area and she has many regular customers.  She is a sociable, responsible and honest person who cares for her children's future. Oyumaasuren is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy necessary tools and items for her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy tools and other items for her salon

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven members. They are located in Pouthi Mitt village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Thuy K. was born in 1961 and she has been selected by the other members to be the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. La Lonh, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use for growing corn and potato. As well as farming, Mrs. Thuy K. also earns a living by breeding pigs. She would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. 

This couple has two children: one is a laborer and one is a pig breeder.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Eight people form this village bank loan. They live in Kaoh Reah Kraom village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Ton P. was born 1973. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She is single and lives with her mother. She is a teacher at the local school where she receives a small salary to cover her living costs. She also owns a plot of land for growing papaya. 
To support her papaya farming, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing papayas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing papayas.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam B. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Miriam owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, sugar, beverages & toothpaste. Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren, 53, is married and lives with his wife and son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on land they own on the outskirts of the city. His wife and son, 26, are both unemployed. Batsuren began his transportation service business in 1992. He owns a truck which he uses to transport shipments from one place to another. He has been transporting shipments from Ulaanbaatar to Umnogobi, the southernmost province of Mongolia, since 1992. He makes one shipment per month. For one shipment he is paid 2,500,000 MNT from which he spends 1,200,000 MNT on gasoline, 200,000 MNT on spare parts and maintenance, and 110,000 MNT on food. His net monthly income is about 1,000,000 MNT.

In addition to his transportation business, he operates a brick-making business in his backyard. Batsuren is an honest and responsible person who is planning to expand his business, especially the brick-making. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy necessary spare parts and to cover the maintenance costs for his truck. He also plans to use the money to buy sand to make more bricks.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en:
Grecelda B. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Grecelda owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. She decided to change her business from making snacks to dealing in ready-to-wear products because she finds it more profitable.

In 2010, Grecelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. Grecelda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon S. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Marlon owns & operates a general store where he sells medicine to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his eighth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. They are located in Kaoh Reah Kraom village, in Kandal province.

Mrs. Sot S. was born 1981. She is a married woman and she is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She is a vegetable seller who is able to earn a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sun Virith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice and papayas for a living. In order to support her husband's farming, Mrs. Sot S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice and papayas.

This couple has three children two are attending the local school. Their youngest child is 4 years old.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for supporting her husband's agriculture business of growing rice and papayas.

loans.name: Eiralyn

texts.en:
Eiralyn R. is from the village of Lapasa Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Eiralyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Eiralyn owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Eiralyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eiralyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eiralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Eiralyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eiralyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Batsumberel

texts.en: Batsumberel, 45, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His older daughter graduated from college and now works for a company as an office manager. His younger daughter currently attends University. His son got married and has started his own life. Batsumberel worked for a small company as a manager and his wife used to operate a hair salon in a building they own, located near their house. Now they use the same building as a grocery store that they opened in 2010. His wife is responsible for sales and he makes purchases from other stores. Batsumberel is a hardworking and business minded person who says, " Our house is located by a busy road and it is an advantage for us to operate our food shop. If we can keep our shop full of a variety of goods, we have the possibility to increase our working capital". He is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to purchase more food and groceries for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more food and groceries

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory S. is from the city of Embargo Ozamiz City. He is 40 years old. Nory is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nory owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Nory has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nory joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nory is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nory from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Jeana is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail business, buying and selling dried fish and squid in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jeana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and squid to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is from the village of Margos Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 27 years old and married. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a tricycle transport service. She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en:
This group loan include of four members. They are located in Chanlak village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Sman C. was born in 1963, and she is a group leader. She has been selected as the group leader by the other group members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows vegetables. To support this farming, she needs funds. So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing her vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Chheng, is a fisherman who is able to earn a little income to support his family. He also helps in his wife's farming.

This couple has eight children: three are farmers, four are students who help in their parents' businesses. The youngest child is 4 years old and not in school yet.

loans.name: Enh-Amgalan

texts.en:
Enh-Amgalan, 53, is married and lives with his wife and a daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard in the outskirts of the city. 

In 2002 he started driving a microbus within the city, which transported passengers from one place to another. However, he was not allowed to continue to operate his business because his microbus was outdated and did not meet the quality standards for public transportation. 

He currently operates a taxi service business using his daughter's car. He is a modest and intelligent man who wishes to buy a new microbus to restart the public transportation business. 

Enh-Amagalan is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy spare parts and cover the maintenance costs for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Bataa

texts.en:
Bataa, 48, is married and lives with his wife and two young children in the  Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past nine years. His older son goes to college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, and his wife is his co-worker. 

In 2001 he began selling home appliances with his wife. In the beginning they sold their merchandise at a rented stall, but now they have their own kiosk which they bought in 2004, due to the success of their business. They are working hard to expand their current business and increase their working capital. 

Bataa says, "My ultimate wish is for my children to get a higher education and become knowledgeable in the future." He is a sociable and hardworking person. Bataa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) to purchase more items to sell at his kiosk.

loans.use: to expand store inventory

Mrs. Cheng S. was born in 1980 and is a married woman. She is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She stays at home and takes care of her two children. Her husband, Mr. Mok Simon, is a teacher at a private schoO. where he can earn a little salary to support his family.

Now the house where they live has flooded, so Mrs. Cheng S. would like to ask for a loan to buy soil to fill in her land. 

This couple has two children: one is attending a local schoO. and the younger one is only 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy soil for filling in her land

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta G., a married woman who lives in Brgy. Mantija, Danao City, Cebu, earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband, Nonelon G., 46, works as an OFW to earn his living. They have four children who are between 3 and 17 years old.

Julieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,400, thereby uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 with which she intends to buy stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements and expansion of her business. Julieta G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team."

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin T. was born in 1963, and she is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. She and her husband are fishermen who are  able to earn a small income to support their family. With their fishing, they face some problems, because they don’t have enough fishing gear. So, Mrs. Vin T. would like to ask for a loan to purchase fish nets and some other equipment for her fishing. 

This couple has four children who are all fishermen. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fish nets and some more fishing supplies

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son R. has been in the farming business for a long time in Kompong Cham province. She and her husband help each other grow rice, in both the rainy season and the dry season. In average, this family make an income of $3.25 per day which they use to support their family expenses. This couple is blessed with five children. Two are married, and  live in their own houses. The remaining three are single; two of them are employed in various jobs. Son R. would like to plant rice crop in the dry season but she doesn’t have sufficient capital. In order to deal with this issue, Son R. is asking for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, seeds for planting, and to pay for plowing expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds for planting, and to pay for plowing expenses.

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Burul S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. She is 45 and married to an electrician. Together they have raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter and the son live separately from the family and the second daughter studies at school. 

In order to earn money, Burul breeds cattle. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. Now she earns 2,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. 

In the future she plans to enlarge a shed to keep more cattle there.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Shuru's Group

texts.en:
Shuru S., 57, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok, a small town near Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). Together with her husband she has raised six children. All are married and live with their families. 

Shuru and her husband are pensioners and in order to earn money to meet their personal needs, they breed cattle. The couple also sells milk for making additional money. With the money received from the loan, Shuru wants to purchase cattle for breeding.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nhin

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Nhin K., age 58, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Nhin K. is a married woman who is devoted to her six children. Three are married and have started new homes. The remaining three are single and employed in different occupations for earning daily profit.

She and her husband have helped each other to cultivate rice on their own farmland since 1979.  

One of their sons is going to marry next month, but Nhin K. has a problem with finances, and it may affect the whole wedding day of her son. That is why Nhin K. has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To assist in paying for her son's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Ishenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Ishenbubu I. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 48 and married. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons who are both students. 

In order to earn money, the family breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price after fattening. They started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 KGS. With money received from the loan, Ishenbubu wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. 

In the future she wants to build a house in Bishkek for her sons.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Du's Group

texts.en:
Du T. L. is 51 years old and has two children. One of them is attending a training course on driving. 

Du T. L. is a farmer. She grows rice, corn and vegetables and raises pigs for meat. This business has been run for a long time. It helps her to have food for her family and the sale of the products help them have cash to pay for their daily needs. 

Being a client of our credit program since 2006, she has been a good group leader. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy  food for pigs.

Huyen T. N. is 29 years old. She has a hair salon shop at home. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more hair care products.

loans.use: To buy  food for pigs

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen G. M. de 37 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, un hombre muy trabajador el cual se dedica a la pesca artesanal y así mismo trabaja como albañil. María se dedica a la elaboración de tostadas de  yuca y plátanos las cuales prepara en su casa de habitación y posteriormente sale a vender de forma ambulante por los diferentes parques de San Juan Opico, lo que le permite aportar a su hogar. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para hacer algunas mejoras a su hogar como arreglar el piso y techar una parte de su casa la cual carece de techo. Todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de brindarle un mejor hogar a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad.
texts.en:
37-year old María del Carmen G. M. lives in San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad with her husband, a very hardworking fisherman who also works in construction. 

María makes yucca and banana tostadas (fried tortillas) in her home and then sells them in the local parks. In this way she earns money to pay for household expenses. 

María is seeking a loan to make improvements to her house such as  fixing the floor and putting a roof on the part of the house that doesn’t have one. She is very keen to do all of this so that she can provide her four children with a better home.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make tostadas

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira A. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 58 years old and married to a farmer. Together they have raised three sons and two daughters. 

Damira works in the hospital, and in order to earn additional money she and her husband breed cattle. They have been doing it since 1996. Reselling cattle after fattening, they earn an additional $107 per month. With money received from the loan, Damira wants to purchase more cattle to fatten and sell. In the future she dreams of purchasing a house in Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Airk

texts.en:
From Kompong Tom province, Airk M. is a 59-year-old woman, married to Rouy Reng, age 65, and they are local farmers. This old couple lives with three of their employed children who always contribute their profits to Airk M. every month to use for the family’s needs. 

One of them is a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. He always uses his existing bicycle as a way to reach the place where he buys the used goods, and it is really hard for him when he needs to travel far.  

To improve this situation, Airk M. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL, to buy a motorcycle for her son to use on longer trips.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to use on longer trips for buying used goods.

loans.name: Elba Esperanza

texts.es: Elba Esperanza F. 50 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 18 años de edad, por quienes trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante. Elba se dedica a la elaboración de queso y crema, la cual vende de forma ambulante, y así mismo elabora pupusas las cuales comercializa en su hogar. Elba es una madre muy responsable y emprendedora quien tiene como principal meta darle lo mejor a sus hijos, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando: frijoles, maíz, chicharrón y arroz para elaborar las pupusas y así mismo para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de queso. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Elba Esperanza F. is 50 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, in La Libertad department.  She is a single mother with two children aged 10 and 18 and she works very hard to get her children ahead in life.  Elba's business is making cheese and cream which she sells as an itinerant street vendor.  She also makes pupusas which she sells from her home.

Elba is a very responsible and enterprising mother whose main goal in life is to provide her children with the best.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business.  She will use the money to buy beans, corn, chopped pork and rice to make her pupusas and also raw materials for making cheese.  She does all this as she wishes to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making cheese and cream

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok H. (pictured above) is 30 years old, and her husband, Mr. Thy Neang, who is 27 years old, live about seven kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have one daughter who is in school. 

Sok is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a drinking water deliveryman. He buys drinking water and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require drinking water. He bought a van for transporting the water, but he does not have enough money to buy more drinking water to sell.

Sok requests a loan to pay for purchasing more drinking water to resell.

loans.use: To purchase a van for her husband to carry drinking water for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials to repair his home

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sorin Van, have been married since 1996 and have two sons and two daughters. The children are all in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phally and his wife produce rice wine and raise pigs at home. Mrs. Sorin Van is a silk weaver as well. The couple requests a loan of $1,000 to continue their businesses.

loans.use: To produce rice wine and raising pigs.

loans.name: Beddy Noé

texts.es: Beddy Noé L. L.  de 37 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapán,  ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo le ayuda a su esposo con el negocio, así también vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Beddy es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja elaborando bolsones y carteras hechas de lina y otros tipos de telas más, los cuales posteriormente vende en su casa y así mismo los comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes sectores del sentro de San Pedro Perulapán y otros pueblos más del departamento de Cuscatlán. Beddy solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de bolsones, de esta forma el espera mejorar su negocio aumentando su producción y así mismo sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Beddy Noé L. L. is 37 years old.  He lives in San Pedro Perulapán, which is in the Cuscatlán department.  He lives with his wife, who devotes herself to the household chores and helps him with the business.  He also lives with his two minor children.  The children go to school.

Beddy is a very responsible person.  He works making bags and purses from linen and other types of fabric.  He later sells them at his house.  He also sells them in an itinerant manner in different areas in the San Pedro Perulapán center and other villages in the Cuscatlán department.

Beddy is requesting a loan from Integral to be able to buy raw material to make large bags.  This way he hopes to improve his business by increasing his production.  At the same time, he will increase his earnings.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make bags to sell

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a business lady who runs a grocery store.  She has been engaged in the business for ten years.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business.  She dreams of opening other outlets for her business in the future.  Being a married lady with two children in school, she works hard to provide for her family.  

She had previously serviced a loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to boost her business.  She has requested another loan of 40,000 KES to add to her stock of fruits.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo R. M., vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y junto a quienes reside en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Alfredo es un padre de familia muy responsable y un esposo muy ejemplar, ya que se destaca por siempre trabajar muy duro con el fin de poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia, la cual es su mayor inspiración para luchar en la vida. Alfredo se dedica a elaborar y vender confeti, el cual esta hecho de papel de colores y se utiliza en diferentes celebraciones y fiestas. Él solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de papel, y así mismo bolsas plásticas y diferentes colores de añelida para tenir el papel. El confeti Alfredo lo comercializa con tiendas y piñaterias, contando con clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Alfredo R. M. lives with his wife and their two children, ages 16 and 18.  The children go to school.  They live in the Cuscatlán department.  Alfredo is a very responsible father and an exemplary husband.

It is notable that he always works very hard in order to be able to give his family all of the best.  That is his greatest inspiration as he struggles in his life.

Alfredo makes and sells confetti.  The confetti is made from colored paper, and it is used for different celebrations and fiestas.

He is requesting a loan because he wishes to be able to buy a greater quantity of paper.  He will also buy plastic bags and different colors of aniline to dye the paper.  Alfredo sells the confetti to stores and piñata businesses.  He has fixed customers.

loans.use: To buy paper and aniline to make confetti

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch T., 46, makes and sells rattan cupboards. She is a married mother with three children, one of whom is married and lives separately while T. other two live at home and work at a variety of jobs.. Since 2008, Ouch T. and her husband have used their own house as a point of sales. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then sells them door-to-door at retail prices across T. province. They always spend at least one or two weeks selling their products. Ouch T. now runs her business very well because she sells her items at reasonable prices. In order to better satisfy her customers' needs, Ouch T. seeks a loan to purchase more rattan to make cupboard for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more rattan to make cupboards

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en: Rufus is a member of Vision group in Faulu Kenya. He joined the group as a businessman who runs a barber shop. Rufus' business is located in the Kibera slums hence most of his customers are low-income earners. He started the business after leaving his previous job as a shopkeeper. Rufus hopes to establish more barber shops in other locations in five years. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a shaving machine, TV and VCD player.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine, TV and VCD player.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en: Rodgers is 25 years old and single. He owns vans which he uses for his transport business, in which he employs four people. Rodgers is an active member of Comrades group in Faulu Kenya and he pays his weekly dues faithfully. For this reason, the members of his group have guaranteed him a loan of 30,000 KES. He will use the money to repair one of his vans. Rodgers hopes to own more vans in the future.

loans.use: to repair his van

loans.name: Shafi

texts.en: Shafi is a 34-year-old married man with five children living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for four years. His hardship is debtors who take long to pay. His vision is to have a wholesale business and to build a better house. Shafi intends to use this loan to buy Omo (detergent), basins and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy Omo, basins and sodas

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 47-year-old married man, with six children living in an owned house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his wish is to build a permanent house for the family. Stephen has been growing maize for a living for fifteen years and he is still successful. His hardships include price fluctuations and diseases. His dream is to have at least ten acres of land. Stephen needs the loan to prepare land for planting maize.

loans.use: to prepare the land for maize planting

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 23-year-old married woman with three children. She has been running a cafeteria for one year and employs two people. She also distributes bread for extra income. Gladys previously operated a grocery shop. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business. Gladys hopes to develop her business and open a hotel in five years. She needs 20,000 Kes to buy baking flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy baking flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Linda Buwere Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: M. Sarah is a 31-year-old hardworking and enterprising businesswoman who has been operating a used clothing sales business in Nasuti-Mukono for 6 years. The happily married mother of two says her business's clientele consists mostly of local residents. With the improving prospects after getting this loan, M. Sarah is anticipating the growth of her business, which currently generates 65,000 UGX weekly. M. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more bales of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothing

loans.name: Mukama Aliba Ayaggadde-Mukono Group

texts.en:
K. Persis is a 56-year-old mother of 8. She is happily married and has been in the charcoal sales business for the past decade in Nabuti-Mukono. Most households in Uganda, especially the low income ones, use charcoal to cook their meals.

Persis says she began this business to earn a living. Prior to establishing it, she was at her wits' end given that she was a housewife with no source of livelihood. The business now generates her 200,000 UGX monthly. She also has a rental business that brings her extra income. Persis, who belongs to Mukama Aliba Ayaggadde group, says she is going to use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 31-year-old married man with three children. He has been running a tailoring business for seven years and employs one person. David is also employed in a security firm. He runs his business in the Kibera slums in Nairobi and hopes to move it to the town centre in the future. David joined Faulu Kenya so that he could access financial resources easily. He has requested his first loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya. He plans to use it to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Savath

texts.en:
Mrs. Savath C. and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Hoal, have been married since 1990 and have 4 children - 3 sons and 1 daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savath and her husband are farmers. Savath also weaves silk when she is not working on the farm. The family has no transportation for commuting, so Savath is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan P. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chenda Chum, live in a village along National Road Number One, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mr. Chenda Chum is a construction worker and drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

Kan stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business and her children’s salaries. 

The family asked for a Kiva loan to finish their house-building. They now are in the process of building a concrete brick room under their wooden house. So, Kan requests a loan of $1,200 to finish the building.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeun N. (pictured above) is 55 years old. She has five children: four sons and one daughter. Three are married and other two assist their parents in the business. The family lives about seven kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Chamroeun N. is a soup vendor. Her husband assists his wife in the business. Chamroeun is asking for her first loan of $600 to pour concrete for her house foundation.

loans.use: To pour concrete for her house foundation

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao M. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Norng Chea, got married in 2000 and have three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sreymao is a weaver. Her husband has been a weaver for a month, a skill he learned from his wife. Sreymao is asking for a loan of $1,000 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for weaving business

loans.name: Charles Deya

texts.en:
Charles has been extracting stones to sell in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 52 years old, married to Rose Atieno, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 26,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy tools and buy another extraction site.

In future, Charles hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport stones to different places.

loans.use: To buy tools and buy another extraction site

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy T. N. is 26 years old with 2 children who are at  primary school. She  manages a shop that provides a motorbike repair service.  Since her husband is a excellent repairman,  her shop is always crowded with customers. She can earn 3,000,000 VND profit per  month. A client of our program  for 6 years, she has  had no difficulty in making weekly or monthly repayments. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy more  motorbike parts to make her repair service better.

loans.use: to buy more  motorbike parts to make her repair service better

loans.name: Elie

texts.fr: Elie N. est Pasteur dans une Eglise locale de Rubavu, province de l’ouest, il est âgée de 46 ans, il a 8 enfants, entre 22 et 4 ans, il est né en RDC, son niveau d’éducation est  universitaire, il a un diplôme de niveau A0  en sociologie. Il a une très bonne expérience de remboursement des prêts car, le prêt qu’il sollicite est le cinquième, il va payer le minerval et va acheter le matériel scolaire de l’année académique 2011, pour ses enfants. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de continuer de payer le crédit à temps, pour solliciter d’autres et pouvoir aider ses enfants à terminer leurs études. Dans l’avenir il veut avoir un restaurant moderne et une ferme d’élevage.
texts.en:
Elie N. is a pastor at a local church in Rubavu, a district in Western Province, Rwanda. He is 46 years old and has eight children, between the age of 4 and 22. He was born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. He attended university, and holds a level A0 diploma in sociology.

He has a good track record of repaying his loans, and he is now seeking his fifth loan, to pay his children's tuition and buy them school supplies for academic year 2011.

His strategy for growth is to continue repaying the loan on time, so that he can seek other ones and help his children complete their studies. In the future, he wants to own a modern restaurant and a livestock farm.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
Sattar A. is from Imishli. He is 37 years old. Sattar is married and the father of one son aged 13. All his life Sattar was engaged in tilling the land. But when his family grew, expenses grew, too. That is why Sattar decided to start up a cattle-breeding business ten years ago. Nowadays to make a living, Sattar raises cows for breeding and there are eight cows in his farm now. He sells dairy products in the local bazaar. 

In January 2011, Sattar joined AqroInvest and requested a loan of 1800 AZN which was used to purchase livestock feed and three more cows. This is his first loan taken out through AqroInvest and Kiva. Sattar dreams of buying land and building his own farm in the future. He is very thankful to all for their support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and three cows

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. is 32 years old. She is living with her family in Xuancanh commune.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing  rice and corn with high productivity. Additionally, she raises 5 pigs for meat. Her hard-working manner gives her a stabL. income to manage her family life. Ms. Phuong joined our program in 2006. She has been a good group leader. Her loan sizes increase year after year and are used effectively in expanding her farming. Currently, she needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

Mai T. H. is 45 years old. She is raising 100 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

Than T. D. is 50 years old. She is raising 100 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to improve the chickens’ house.

Hoa T. N. is 37 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

Loan T.  L. is 45 years old. She is running a shop that sell construction materials. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Thanh T. D. is 48 years old. She is raising 300 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs

loans.name: Rosset

texts.en: Rosett is a 21-year-old married woman with two children living in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has a retail shop which she has operated for 2 years amidst challenges of limited capital. Her vision is to own a wholesale shop. Rosett needs the loan to purchase sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt and rice to sell

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar A. is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his wife and son in the Saatli, province of Azerbaijan. They are a very hard-working family.  Eldar is always engaged in farming. His wife does the household work and takes care of their school-aged son. They do their best to give him a good education. Now their son goes to the local school. 

The main source of income for the family comes from a cattle-breeding business. After successfully repaying his previous loan, Eldar requested a new loan in amount of 1,500 AZN, which was used to purchase livestock feed and to buy three more cows. Currently, the income of his family has increased to 300 AZN per month.

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Pashan

texts.en: Pashan is currently in the business of selling perfumes. She is 38 years old, married to a policeman, and has one child, who attends school. Pashan took out a loan to stock more perfumes to sell. With the extra profits from her business, Pashan hopes to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to stock more perfumes

loans.name: Vang's Group

texts.en:
Vang T. P. is 55 years old and has two married children. Being a farmer, her main activities focus on growing rice and vegetables and raising pigs. Her agricultural products are used both to feed the family and to earn money. Ms Vang became a SEDA client in 2006 and has been a good group leader during her participation in the program. This year, she hopes to have a bigger loan size (7,194,000 VND ) than last year (5,014,000 VND) to buy more pigs to raise.

Ly T. P. is 46 years old. She raises 300 chickens for eggs. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Khanh T. D. is 38 years old, with two children who attend high school. She raises 200 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Chin T. T. is 35 years old, with 2 children. She grows rice and vegetables in a paddy of 3,600 square meters. She wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve the quality of her products.

Quy T. H. is 48 years old. She raises 200 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Claverina

texts.en:
Claverina S. is from the village of Sta Lucia, Quirino, Isabela. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Claverina owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Claverina has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Claverina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claverina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase breeding livestock. Claverina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Claverina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Arastun

texts.en:
Arastun K. lives in the Imishli district. He is a 30-year-old married man who has one son and one daughter, ages 5 and 2. Arastun has been engaged in a cattle-breeding business for over 4 years. In the past he was the main helper of his father, who is a farmer. Arastun was married in 2004 and decided to start his own business at that time.
