He requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN to purchase three more cows to raise and sell. This is his first loan through AqroInvest and Kiva. Arastun is very thankful because the income from this loan allowed him to increase the monthly income of his family up to 300 AZN. He plans to purchase at least ten more dairy cows in the next three years.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang S., who was born in 1959, lives in Si Sla village in Takeo Province. She is a noodle seller in her local village, where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Horn Sor, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where he grows rice, which he sells to support his family. In the rice field, it is the growing season, so they need some money to be able to sow a good crop. To improve their rice production, Mrs. Neang S. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to plow the field in the coming dry season. Mrs. Neang S. is the mother of four children: one of them is a seamstress in a garment factory, another one is a construction worker, and the others are farmers. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: From the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia, Mao L. is 33 years old and has been selling fresh fish in her village for two years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen, and resales them for profit. She is married, but she divorced from her husband many years ago. Mao L. has five children, three of whom are single and two are married. To improve her business, Mao L. would like a loan to buy fresh fish in large amounts in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in large amounts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and salt to sell

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em M. was born in 1976 and lives in Si Sla village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice, which she sells to support her family. She also sells Khmer cakes. In the rice field, she has a problem because the soil is infertile. To improve rice production, Mrs. Em M. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Chorm Horng, is a water seller for some villagers to earn some profit to support his family. Through these activities, they support five children, four of whom are attending a local public school. Mrs. Em M.'s husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Unsi

texts.en: S. is currently in the business of selling maize grain and sorghum. She is 40 years old, married to a driver, and has 6 children who all attend school. S. borrowed a loan to stock more sacks of maize and sorghum to sell. In the future, S. hopes to buy land and construct a house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more maize and sorghum

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en:
Shaiq Q. is 37-year-old man living in Saatli with his family. He is blessed with two sons. Shaiq's wife takes care of the children and helps him run the business.

Shaiq has an established grocery store, which he has operated for five years. This business is the only source of income for the family. Shaiq is a diligent man and has plans and dreams for the future. He requested this loan of 1,700 AZN fromf AqroInvest and Kiva to increase his inventory and enlarge the store.

loans.use: to increase inventory and to enlarge the store

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a beauty salon owner from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip.  Ayda is married and taking care of her parents; neither of her parents is capable of working due to their age and poor health. Ayda started this business four years ago and now she has a good number of customers.

Ayda took a loan from FATEN to purchase creams, equipment and supplies and repair the salon--painting the walls and using the free space she has to offer more services.

Ayda appears in the picture in her salon.

loans.use: Purchase beauty salon equipment and supplies and repair the store

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn K. was born in 1974, and lives in Chvea Village, Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yiev, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to support their family. Beside their farming, they have a lot of free time, so they want to breed a cow. To start this new business, Mrs. Chorn K. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She has four children: two of them are employed in garment factories, another one is duck breeder, and the last is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en:
Ilkin Q. is a 28-year-old man. He is married and has two school-aged sons. Ilkin has owned and managed a grocery store for the last four years. His store is located at the front of his house and his wife actively helps him in his business.  They are very hard-working people who dream of giving a good education to their children. By expanding the business, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

 Ilkin feels happy because this is the first loan he has taken out from AqroInvest and Kiva. He requested the loan amount of 1500 AZN to renovate his store and expand his inventory. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his sons.

loans.use: to renovate the grocery store and expand his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cassava flour, cooking oil and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp.  Abdallah has a musical band that performs at weddings, graduation parties, and formal and informal events. Abdallah, who appears in the picture here, is the father of one daughter and one son.

Abdallah took a loan from FATEN to purchase musical instruments and costumes for his band. The band is quite well known In Jabalia refuge camp and the Gaza Strip.

Abdallah is a National Palestinian Authority employee.

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments and costumes for his band

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is currently in the business of selling maize and sorghum. She is 30 years old, a widow, with three children, and two of them go to school. Eva requested a loan to stock more bags of maize and sorghum. With extra profits from her business, Eva hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: stock more bags of maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Bram

texts.en: Mrs. Bram T. is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband are fishers who are able to earn a little income to support their family. One of the problems they have in their business is not having fishing equipment. Thus, Mrs. Bram T. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat. Mrs. Bram T. is the mother of two children, who are both attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a young mother of two daughters and one son. Ilham and her husband Muhammad have a small farm raising goats and sheep for sale. Jabalia refugee camp which is known for its high population secures them a good number of clients, both individuals and butcheries.

Ilham took a loan from FATEN to purchase more livestock and feed to enlarge the business and increase the returns. They depend on the farm as it is their primary and only source of income.

Ilham's husband appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. 

In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: Purchase more goats and enlarge the business

loans.name: Luk

texts.en:
Mrs. Luk T. was born in 1963, and she is a villager who lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kong Thet, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice to sell to support their family. 

In order to do this farming, Mrs. Luk T. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline for growing rice. Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also a construction worker where he can receive a small salary to support his family. 

This couple has six children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline for growing rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Helping his brother repair the house

loans.name: Kyogaya Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: 48-year-old I. Anna is happily married with five kids and she is affiliated with Kyogaya Women's group-Jinja. She has been operating her decade-long poultry and cattle sales business in Wabulenga, a growing business melting pot on the outskirts of Jinja Town. These have been her first business enterprises and it is from here that she has built up her business experience. Through diligence and determination, she has made significant headway in her business transactions. Weekly this business generates shillings 80,000 and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more young chicks.

loans.use: The purchase of young chicks

loans.name: Riziki Mpya Group

texts.fr: Chibalonza M.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Riziki Mpya, âgée de 30 ans, divorcée, mère de 2 enfants respectivement âgés de 12 et 6 ans. Elle vit actuellement seule pour des raisons intimes.  Chibalonza M.  est  vendeuse de souliers usagers (ketch).  Elle s’installe au long de la rue.  Elle a commence son business de son fonds propre de valeur de 50$ issu des revenus de la commission de vente de souliers dans laquelle, elle aurait facilité la transaction. Plus tard, elle  bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Il ya 13 ans qu’elle est en action. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (35 paires de souliers).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, voir ses enfants  étudier confortablement et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. La cliente Chibalonza M.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Riziki Mpya est constitué de 24 membres.
texts.en:
Chibalonza M. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Riziki Mpya group. She is 30 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 6. She currently lives alone for personal reasons. Chibalonza M. sells used shoes, called "ketch", after finding a spot along the street.

She started her business with her own funds, 50$, that she got from commissions on shoe sales transactions she facilitated. Later on, she benefited from a $50 loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Hekima. She's been running her business for 13 years, and she will use her loan to get new supplies (35 pairs of shoes).

She ambitions to expand her business, see her children study comfortably, and buy them a land lot. Chibalonza M. thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. The Riziki Mpya counts 24 members.

loans.use: To buy 35 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mr. Sum S. was born in 1954, and he is a villager who lives in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow rice. He faces a problem because the rice field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, he would like to ask for loan to dig a well for his crop. Beside being a farmer, he is also a fisherman while his wife, Mrs. Chhoem Sophy, is a Khmer noodle seller. With their various jobs, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are construction workers. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To dig a well for crops

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene sells beans and sorghum.  He is 30 years old, married and has five children who are between one and fourteen years old. Two of his children go to school. His wife works together with him. 

Damascene has been selling beans and sorghum for five years. His loan will be used to buy more beans and sorghum. He hopes to use his profits to buy a cow and his dream is to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: Buying beans and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of 3 school-aged children. He is an experienced furniture maker; he has owned a furniture making shop for almost twenty years. He is the main income provider of his family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory. This will be his second Kiva loan and he is very thankful for the results. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business operation. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 45 years old, married and has nine children. All her children attend school. Florence sells fruits, she has been selling them for three years. Her husband is a farmer. Florence will use the loan to purchase fresh milk, donuts, cooking oil, juice, and sugar to sell. With her profits she plans to expand her business and provide food for the family. She dreams of having a mini-supermarket in the future.

loans.use: Buying milk, donuts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en: Goreth is 29 years old, married and has twins who are two years and five months. Goreth sells lotions and petroleum jelly, which she has done for five years. Her husband works as a businessman. Goreth will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With her profits she plans to expand her business. Goreth plans to build a house, make savings and she would like to have a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak S. is a 41-year-old woman, married to Chea Sothea, age 46, and they both appear in the picture here. To earn a living, Chak S. and her husband have been planting various crops on their own farmland. This couple usually generates a profit of approximately $4 per day to ensure their family with a comfortable life. They have given birth to two teenage children who work as blacksmiths. Recently, Chak S.’s house became not comfortable because it needed to mend a few parts. Her house is getting old now, and she has never repaired, except for one time since she has been living there. Because of this reason, Chak S. would like to request a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 32 years old, married and has six children who are in the range of one and twelve years old.  Currently, five of her children attend school. Joyce sells a variety of items in her store such as soap, salt, etc. She has been with this store for two years. Her husband helps her in the business. Joyce will use the loan to buy more soaps, salt, and rice to sell. Joyce's profits will be used to expanded her store. Joyce also plans to reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and hence make more profits.

loans.use: Buying soap, salt, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Given a green thumb, Josefina D. V., 57, aims to make best use of her skills and be a blessing to her family and community. Josefina did not manage to reach high school; nevertheless, the dedication she gave to agriculture yielded a personal success which she can be proud of. Josefina is married to Maximo, a farmer, and they have one child, who now works and has a family. 

Josefina has a farm where she grows ornamental plants and fruits like bananas and pineapples. This farm is located near their house, so Josefina can easily manage it. Josefina has been running this business for around ten years now, and she sees that more years of growth will be added to her business. Monthly, Josefina earns around Php 11,500.

To help her continue operation of her ornamental farm, she would like to request for a Php20,000 loan. She does so to further help her grow her farm. She intends to use the loan money to buy fertilizers, a crop growth regulator called ethrel, and plastic and wire for the physical maintenance of the farm. She believes that the loan will truly benefit her business, and eventually her family and community.

Frequent typhoons that hit the country also affected Josefina's farm. But despite these storms in her life, she is still determined to see her farm yield many fruits and become more profitable in the years to come. Just as she delights in seeing her plants and crops grow, she will be ever delighted to see her grandchildren grow in all aspects of their lives and become good members of society.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of agricultural supplies for her farm

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence owns a shop selling various items such as matches and candles and also owns a bar. She is 22 years old, married and has three children. The youngest is seven months old while the eldest is five years old. Her husband helps her run the business. Laurence has had a bar and store for two years. 

This loan will be used to buy more cooking oil, soap, sugar and salt to sell. Laurence hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay school fees and buy animals for rearing. In the future, she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying cooking oil, soap, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mrs. Net P. was born in 1946, and she is a villager who lives in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. She is a Khmer cheese seller in the market where she can earn a small income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy more Khmer cheese for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. 

She is a widow with one child who is a sugar seller and also helps out with her mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cheese to sell

loans.name: John Irungu

texts.en:
John has been running his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 30 years old, married to Ann Wanjiru, and they have one child.

John was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy rice, flour, sugar in bulk to later sell in small quantities.

In the future, John would like to grow his shop to a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, sugar in bulk to sell in small quantities

loans.name: Abau

texts.en: Abau is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 30 years old, a widow with one child who goes to school. Abau requested a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, Abau hopes to buy a plot of land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
In the province of Battambang, Choeun N. has been selling different kinds of vegetables at the market for years and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Choeun N. has been married for a long time and has seven children. Three of her children are married and four are single. Most of her children work at different jobs, while her husband assists her in delivering vegetables to the market. 

In order to earn additional income and make the business more successful, Choeun N. is asking for a loan to increase the capital of her vegetable sales business.

loans.use: To grow the capital for her vegetable sales

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan W., 49 years old, is married and has four children. He works as a driver who earns an average income of Rp. 70 000 .- per day. He took out a loan of Rp.3000.000 .- to be used for car maintenance because the route he drives is very long every day, approximately 240 km. This  requires a good car to give  the passengers a safe and comfortable ride. 

I Wayan W. plans to save from his profits which will be used for the future of his son. I Wayan W. lives with his wife. Two of their children are still in school now. 

I Wayan W. spends Rp. 50 000.- per day for family needs. To help with the family income, his wife sells bananas and coconuts  at the market. This is his first loan at KSU MUK.

loans.use: used for car maintenance

loans.name: Peter Kuria

texts.en:
Peter has been in the pool/snooker business for the last three  years.  He is 47 years old, married to Leah Wanjiru, and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this  loan amount to open a retail shop which his wife will run.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow both businesses to increase his income.

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Francis Kahura

texts.en:
Francis has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 60 years old, married to Hannah Wanjeri, and they have five children.

Francis was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for labour.

In the future, Francis hopes to venture into dairy farming to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for labour

loans.name: Edzel

texts.en:
Even in bounty there is still room for dreaming. Edzel L., 47, proves this to be so. Edzel reached only high school, but his educational background does not give any hint of how successful he is at present. Edzel is married to Evelyn, and together they parent two children, one of whom is in college, while the other one is not yet of school age. Together, they live in Calucob, Silang, Cavite.

Edzel owns a sari-sari (variety) store which he has been running for two years now. This caters to the immediate needs of his fellow community members. Aside from a store that is in good business condition, he also rents out an apartment to boarders and has a tricycle which is being operated daily. With these businesses, Edzel earns roughly Php 10,000 every month.

To help him continue the operation of his businesses, he would like to request a Php 28,000 loan. With the loan money, he plans to buy more goods for his store, such as soft drinks, canned goods, and snacks sold retail. He believes he will be able to increase his income by expanding the inventory of his store.

Edzel has his own share of difficulties, but he is confident to say that he is not overwhelmed by them. He looks forward to being able to renovate their house by putting tiles on their floor. Also, it is his desire for his sari-sari store to grow and eventually become a grocery, which can meet the needs of his community better than a small store. Most importantly, far beyond the bounty is his yearning to see his children finish schooling and surpass the success that he has achieved. 

As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he also can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he receives.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of additional goods for his store

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang T. N. is 42 years old and has two children who are in high school. She is a very hard-working farmer who supports her family by growing rice, beans and corn on 3,600 square meters of land. She joined Seda in 2007 and has made effective use of several loans, all of which she paid back on time. She plans to use her portion of this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. 

Hoa T. P. is 44 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She makes a living by growing rice and raising chickens so she can sell their eggs. She will use her portion of this loan to buy chicken feed and build a structure where she can house her livestock.

Khuyen T. T. is 43 years old and has three children. She makes a living growing rice and vegetables and also runs a small shop. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her store.

Kim T. N. is 41 years old and makes a living running a shop where she sells fresh fruit. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her shop.   

Hanh T. N. is 47 years old and makes a living selling scrap metal. She will use her portion of this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand five small businesses

loans.name: Moses Njogu

texts.en:
Moses has been selling milk in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  He is 35 years old, married to Esther Muthoni, and they have four children.

Moses was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy a new motorbike for use in his milk distribution business.

In the future, Moses hopes to grow his milk sale business and be a leading supplier of milk in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for use in milk distribution

loans.name: Hao's Group

texts.en:
Hao T. N. is 45 years old and has two children. She worked as a farmer for years, but after getting her first loan from our organization opened a small business where she makes bags. This has greatly increased her income and allowed her to repay her loans on time. She is applying for this new loan to expand her business by buying more materials to turn into bags. 

L. T. D. is 53 years old and has four children.  She makes a living by raising livestock and growing rice, vegetables and potatoes on 4500 square meters. of land. She is applying for this loan to buy feed for her chickens.

Tat T. L. is 39 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She makes a living by growing rice and raising pigs. She will use her portion of this loan to create a shelter for her animals. 

Thuong T. D. is 49 years old and makes a living selling scrap metal. She will use her portion of this loan to expand her business. 

Dan T. V. is 40 years old and makes a living running a  grocery store. She is applying for a loan to expand her shop.

loans.use: to expand five small businesses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 53 years old and is a single mother of three children.

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to lease land for farming and to buy fertilizer and seeds.

In the future, Grace plans to venture into dairy farming to increase her income.

loans.use: To lease land for farming and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine M. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Elle est divorcé, née a Rubavu -Rwanda, et elle a 9 enfants entre 11  ans et 37 ans, et 2 personnes en charge.  4 de ses enfants vont à l’école, et son niveau éducationnel est primaire.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de deux sacs de riz 40l d’huile deux sacs de sel, deux sacs de sucre pour sa boutique,  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter  son business, est allé à l’extérieur du pays pour amener une grande quantité à bas prix.  Elle voudrait augmenter la clientèle, avoir un bon foyer, et satisfaire les besoins de son foyer.  Elle voudrait aussi éduquer ses enfants jusqu'à l’université.
texts.en:
Madeleine M. is a merchant and has been a customer of Kiva's partner, Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. (ABC) since 2009. She was born in Rubavu, Rwanda. She's divorced and has 9 children, aged 11 to 37, and two persons in her care. Four of her children attend school, and she only has primary education.

She will use her loan to buy two sacks of rice, 40 liters of oil, two sacks of salt, and two sacks of sugar for her shop. Her strategy for growing her business is to travel out of the country to bring back large quantities at low cost. She would like to increase her clientele, have a nice home, and provide for her household. She would also like her children to go to the university.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of rice, 40 liters of oil, 2 sacks of salt, and 2 sacks of sugar

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda makes a living selling household goods such as soap. She is 29 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer and pay for labour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife. He is a skilled construction worker. He is especially talented at completing gypsum board projects. He has been working for the past 7 years in this occupation. He started working independently in his own shop in 2007. He works hard to satisfy alone the needs of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an air compressor for his work. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his business and work with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor for his work

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. is 42 years old and has three children. She makes a living by growing rice and vegetables. She also raises pigs for saL. in a local market. She has repaid several previous loans on time and is applying for this new one to improve the building in which she shelters her pigs.

MinhT. D. is 54 years old and runs a grocery store in the Trung Thon market. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her shop.  

Tam T. L. is 41 years old and runs a small restaurant where she serves breakfast. She will use her portion of this loan to buy new tables. 

Be T.  V. is 37 years old and makes a living raising pigs. She will use her portion of this loan to buy food for them. 

Tien T. N. is 46 years old and makes a living selling scrap steel. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her business

loans.use: to expand five small businesses

loans.name: Adjélévi

texts.fr: Madame Adjélévi est veuve et âgée de 54 ans. Elle a 4 enfants en charge. Elle   est née à Lomé et habite  Abobokomé. Elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois pour s’occuper aux besoins de ses enfants.   Elle est dans son deuxième cycle de prêt.  Elle s’approvisionne à Notsè et revend à Abobokomé à Lomé. Elle a commencé ces activités en 2003. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Madam Adjélévi A. D. is a 54-year-old widow in charge of 4 children. She was born in Lomé and lives in Abobokomé. She started selling charcoal in 2003 to be able to take care of her children. She is in her second loan cycle. She gets her supplies in Nostè and sells the charcoal in Abobokomé in Lomé. She is applying for loan with WAGES to buy 20 charcoal bags.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun K. makes a living at home weaving mats and her husband makes a living selling beds in a market in Kompong Tom province. They have three children, all of whom are grown and living on their own. Her business is strong, and she is applying for this loan to buy more materials to turn into mats. She will also use a portion of this loan to do some repairs to her house.

loans.use: To buy materials for a mat-making business

loans.name: Widow And Needy Group-Jinja

texts.en: K. David, 36, operates a bricklaying and sales business in Mpumudde-Jinja. It is a business this happy-go-lucky and married father of three says he began going by the dictates of his heart. He also has a taxi business which he says is pivotal in his profit maximization efforts. His clientele base cuts across but it is mostly school builders and businesspeople who are regular clients. Weekly, this business generates him shillings 80,000 and he says with this loan, he is going to pay more laborers who he is going to recruit to work at his bricklaying site. David belongs to Widow and Needy group-Jinja.

loans.use: The salaries of the laborers he is going to hire to work at his bricklaying site

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyet T. C. is 28 years old with two children who are at primary school. Being a farmer, her main activities focus on growing rice, and some vegetables to support her family demand and to sell a part to add more money to cover her daily expenditure. Being a client of our credit program since 2006, she is a good borrower. Now, Ms Tuyet hopes to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy more food for pigs.

Loan T. N. is 26 years old. She is growing orange trees in paddies of 3,600 square meters. She needs to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

Nga T. N. is 24 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thinh T. N. is 25 years old. She is raising 100 chickens and growing bananas. She needs to have a loan to buy food for chickens.

Hong T. D. is 36 years old. She is raising duck for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: To buy more food for pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
David has been operating his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 31 years old, married to Joyce Wanjiru, and they have two children.

David was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan amount to stock his shop with flour, sugar and rice.

In the future, David hopes to add farming as a source of income.

loans.use: To stock his shop with flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D., 51, agrees that once a person has a family, he or she is rich; that is why she values her family much. Julieta reached college before getting married to Aristardo, a businessman. At present, they work hand-in-hand in making their business grow and become sufficient enough to support their daily living. Julieta uses her learning from CCT* as a Community Partner to boost her business. Together, they lived in Tanza, Cavite.

Being a fruits vendor is Julieta's main occupation. She has a commercial space in the public market of their community, where daily she sells fresh fruits to household people who go to the market to buy some real food. Other than fruits, she also sells barley products. This business she operates without any employees working for her, and monthly she earns roughly Php 12,000.

To help her grow her business, Julieta applies for a Php 8,000 loan. She will use the money to buy more quantities of fruits for sale, specifically bananas and mangoes. She also plans to buy supplementary materials like salt and plastic.

Julieta admits having lots of competitors in the market that have the same products she has. Also, the death of her mother led them to use part of the capital to pay medical expenses. But Julieta believes that she can surpass these challenges and make her business grow. She plans to have a commercial space for a fruit stand in a shopping mall, where more people can serve as prospective customers. Julieta desires to make her business really profitable, because by it she can assure a bright future for her family, her utmost treasure.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchasing of additional quantities of fruits for sale

loans.name: Agnetta Achieng

texts.en:
Agnetta has been selling fish in Naivasha town since 1996.  She is 48 years old, married to Joseph O., and they have two children.

Agnetta was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy new fishing nets.

In the future, Agnetta hopes to grow her business and become a leading supplier of fish in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Nephat Ngigi

texts.en:
Nephat has been working in the quarry business for the last 11 years.  He is 39 years old, married to Lydia Wangare, and they have five children.

Nephat was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to  buy another extraction site.

In the future, Nephat hopes to own several extraction sites in the area.

loans.use: To buy an extraction site

loans.name: Peter Juma

texts.en:
Peter has been working in his quarry for 11 years.  He is 51 years old, married to Rosemary Achieng, and they have three children.

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy tools and pay for manpower.

In the future, Peter hopes to buy his own lorry to transport the stones to different places.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for manpower

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 41-year-old married man with seven children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children up to university. He has been in the transport sector for six years and the business has helped him educate his children. His major challenge is the high cost of fuel and his dream is to venture into the beekeeping sector. Joseph needs the loan to set up a beekeeping project.

loans.use: Setting up a beekeeping project

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is currently in a business of selling groundnuts paste. She is 40 years old, widowed with eight children and seven of them go to school. Angelina borrowed a loan to stock more groundnuts paste to sell. In the future, Angelina hopes to construct a house with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more groundnuts paste to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 31-year-old hardworking man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 10 years, he has been in the transport sector and with the income generated, he has been able to buy a second car and his dream is to own a lorry. Samuel needs the loan to buy tires for efficiency of his taxi.

loans.use: Buying tires

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has owned an agricultural tools and equipment shop since 2000. With his business income, he is able to cover his family expenses. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with punctual payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by increasing his inventory. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: David Ochieng

texts.en:
David has been extracting stones to sell in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He is 36 years old, married to Carolyne Achieng, and they have three children.

David was introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan amount to buy another extraction site.

In the future, David hopes to own several extraction sites in the area.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site

loans.name: Simon Mwangi

texts.en:
Simon has been selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 35 years old, married to Grace Wangui, and they have two children.

Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Simon hopes to be supplying fruits and vegetables to the local market in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 26-year-old hardworking married man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of building his own house in the next three years. He has been into motorcycle riding for three years and the business is very profitable. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: Buying land

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Just as she deals with each piece of her product carefully, Linda N. deals with her life thoughtfully. Linda was able to finish her first year in college. Now at 51, she makes sure that she will finish to the end every task she lays her hands on with excellence. She is married to a cook named Rolando, and together they raise three children in GMA, Cavite.

Linda's task at hand is a business in coin bank making. She picks out quality materials, hires around eight employees who will work for her on a piece rate, and keeps an eye for excellence to produce crafts that customers would brand as quality and worth buying. Linda has been for 10 years in this kind of business and is still counting. As of now, the business is still residential. Monthly, she earns around Php 10,000.

To help her grow her business, Linda decides to ask for a loan of Php 50,000. This will be used purely for business: for improving the process of craft making, purchasing only the quality materials, and making sure the business stays profitable. Linda says the loan will really help her keep the coin bank making in good shape.

Linda speaks of the rainy season as a challenge to her business, as well as the school opening, since she has to use part of the business money for her children's tuition fees. No matter what the challenges are, however, she is ever determined to thoughtfully figure out how to make the finances flow smoothly in her business. She desires to have her own coin bank factory, and just like any ordinary person, she prays for good health and a good life for each member of her dear family.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase of quality materials for the crafting of coin banks

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a 28-year-old hardworking man, married to a nursing aid living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 15 years, he has been growing maize and tomatoes which have facilitated him in paying school fees for his children. His major challenge is price fluctuation and his vision is to supply the region sustainably. Hannington needs the loan to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.use: Preparation of land for maize planting

loans.name: James Gathii

texts.en:
James has been selling diesel in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 35 years old, married to Hannah Wanja, and they have two children.  

James was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan amount to buy more fuel to sell.

In the future, James hopes to grow his diesel shop to a petrol station offering different types of services.

loans.use: To buy more fuel to sell

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila N. is a widow. For 27 years, she worked as a shop assistant and in 2004, she organized her own business in Ijevan city.

Lyudmila runs a café and food shop at the same place. Lyudmila’s café is situated in the neighbourhood of Yerevan State University’s Ijevan brunch, so a major part of her café’s visitors are students. Thanks to her business, Lyudmila is able to support herself.

Lyudmila intends to develop her business and she asks for a 370,000 AMD loan to buy coffee, tea, chocolate, etc. and necessary tableware for her café. This is Lyudmila’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: To buy coffee, tea, chocolate, etc. and necessary tableware for her café

loans.name: Umujima

texts.en: H. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is 42 years old, a widow with no children. H. borrowed a loan to stock more clothes to sell. With extra profits from her business, H. hopes to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Elmurat

texts.ru: Шомуратов Элмурат проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 51 год. Он женат, имеет троих детей. Дети учатся. Сам Элмурат более 15 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает детские игрушки, семечки и кукурузы. Вместе с ним работает его жена, она помогает ему в торговле. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Elmurat S. lives in the Gissar Region. He is 51 years old. He is married, with three children. The children study. Elmurat has been a vendor at the local market for over 15 years. He sells toys, sunflower seeds and corn. His wife works together with him and helps him to sell their wares. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales volume. He would like to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Michael K.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Islamic Welfare Union (I.W.U) Primary School, in Blama, near Kenema city. This school was founded in September 1972 by the Islamic Welfare Mission to improve the educational standard of children in the community. This school is currently staffed with 10 teachers and has an enrollment of 150 pupils.

This is the first loan that teachers of the I.W.U Primary School have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, and with the help of this loan, these teachers are in a strong position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries can not let them do.

Michael K. S. is the leader of the group. He is age thirty-one. He was born in Blama village. Michael is married to a businesswoman and they have one child who is attending primary school. Michael has been a teacher for ten years now and a businessman for four years. With his share of this loan, he will buy bags of rice, onions and salt for sale.

loans.use: Buys bags of rice, onions and salt for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced construction worker who has been specialized for almost 4 years in completing woodwork projects. He works on local projects upon request of the clients. He cooperates with his wife who works in a cloth store to earn the family income.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more wood for his newest project so he can improve his business. In the future, he is willing to take on bigger projects so he can earn superior income.

loans.use: improve his business

loans.name: Karago Basubuzi Group

texts.en: Esteri is a thirty-five-year-old, married woman with five children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of educating her children. She is a market vendor and has been in business for five years and it is still profitable. Her major challenge is the distance from one market to the other and her dream is setting up a retail shop in town. She is a member of Karago Basubuzi group where each member guarantees the other. Esteri needs the loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing food items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: K. is currently in the business of selling goods like Omo and soap in a shop. She is 35 years old, married,  with 6 children and 3 of them go to school.  In the future K. hopes to buy land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more goods like Omo (detergent) and soap to sell

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Pin M. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Kompong Tom province. She and her spouse work from home making cupboards which they also sell. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple has seven children, five of whom are single; the other two are married. Two of them are employed in various careers and have a proper salary. 

At the present time, Pin M. faces a problem: her house is too small and it is not easy to live in. To remedy this, Pin M. would like to request a loan to be used to expand the size of her house.

loans.use: To expand the size of her house

loans.name: Florah  Mumbi

texts.en:
Florah Mumbi M. is a single mother of two children.  They live in Lodwar town. Florah buys new clothes in bulk and sells at retail.  She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of seventeen thousand shillings.

This will be Florah's second loan from KADET LTD.  She has repaid her previous loan successfully.   She will use the entire loan to buy more new clothes to sell. With the additional income she earns, she is going to expand her business by buying more stock of new clothes. 

In the future, Florah wants to be a successful business lady in Lodwar and able to support her family by providing them with basic needs.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Meiponyo

texts.en:
Meiponyo O. K.  is 36 years old. He married and supports nine people. Meiponyo is a farmer.  He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last ten years, earning good income.

Meiponyo learned about KADET LTD from credit officers doing their marketing. This will be his first loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farming  supplies. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Meiponyo's dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Samuel Street Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Samuel Street” group. They are small-scale businesspeople who are based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fanta F.. Fanta is age thirty-six; she was born in a village called Manjoroh but she is currently in Makeni together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a doctor and her children are attending secondary schools. For twenty-one years now, Fanta has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth for clothing). With her share of this loan, Fanta is going to buy body lotions and body sprays in order to diversify her business.

loans.use: Buy body lotions and body sprays in order to diversify her business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Chea Y., 47, who currently lives in Kompong Tom province. Chea Y. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband works as a local fisherman. They have four children, three of whom are single and one is married. 

It is the time for planting the dry-season rice field but she can't grow her crop on her farmland because of insufficient money. In order to deal with this problem, Chea Y. is asking for a Kiva loan to rent a plow to plow her farmland and to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To rent a plow to plow her farmland and buy fertilizers, gasoline, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Mary Nataana

texts.en:
Mary Nataana E. T. is 44 years old. She is married and is a mother of four school-going children.  Mary is a farmer and has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Mary learned about KADET LTD from other women in her area of residence who are already registered with KADET. This will be her third loan, which she is planning to spend to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Mary's dream is to buy a plot and build rental houses, and to ensure that her children live a better life.  She is a punctilious woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man. He lives with one parent and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 12 years. In 2002, he opened his own car repair shop. In parallel, he has worked in the national police department since 2006. In Lebanon, it’s frequent to have multiple jobs to be capable of handling heavy expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his mechanic's tools so he can serve more customers and earn higher profits. He is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts. His income is needed to help support his family.

loans.use: to renew his mechanic's tools

loans.name: Wailasa Women's Group A-Jinja

texts.en:
28-year-old I. Eric has been in the liquor sales business for the past 10 years in Wandago-Jinja. Weekly this business generates shillings 100,000. Eric who is happily married with three kids says he inherited this business from his late father. 

Eric is requesting this loan to buy more drums for distilling more quantities of crude liquor. Eric belongs to Wailasa Women's group-Jinja. He says in this way he will be able to make more sales and thus more profit.

loans.use: The purchase of drums for distilling more quantities of crude liquor

loans.name: Honest Debt Must Be Paid Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariatu was born in Makeni city 31 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children who are attending primary schools. For 5 years now, Mariatu has been selling used clothes.

This is not the first loan that Mariatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mariatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business, she will buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Emmertha

texts.en:
Emmertha is 31 years old and is married with two children, 6 and 8 years old. Emmertha's husband is a driver. For that reason, Emmertha works hard in order to provide everything necessary for her family. Emmertha owns a small business selling various products such as juice, soap, bread, pens and so on. 

Her business is well-organized. Emmertha is seasoned in her business because she has twelve years of experience. She employs two people from her community. The hours of her shop are from 6am until 10pm every day. 

Emmertha has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products for her shop. Emmertha hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To expand by buying more food like cooking oil, bread, etc

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Султанов Илхомжон житель Гиссарского района. Ему 22 года. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Мама работает бухгалтером в одной коммерческой организации. Сам Илхомжон имеет средне – специальное образование, шафер. По специальности не работает. Занимается животноводство и одновременно торговлей. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи их на мясо. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ilhomjon S. lives in the Gissar Region. He is 22 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his parents. His wife is a homemaker. His mother works as a bookkeeper in a commercial company. Ilhomjon has a technical education: he is a driver. He does not work in his field. He raises and sells livestock. He mainly raises cattle to resell for meat. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Hen T. is an older village woman and a widow; her husband died of senility some years ago. She lives with one daughter who is employed as a garment worker at a factory and receives a formal salary every month. Her daughter always contributes, together with Hen T., in monthly sharing in order to cover the family expenses. Her daughter complains that it is very hard for her to travel to her work place because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. To encourage her child, Hen T. would like to apply for a loan to buy a used motorbike for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her daughter to ride to work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, charcoal, etc. at wholesale to add to current inventory

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a taxi driver living and working in Rafah in Gaza Strip. Muhammad has been driving a taxi for nine years now in the city of Rafah. He is the father of one daughter and three sons. Muhammad wants to pay his car license renewal fees and make a few repairs on the car to keep it in good shape.

Muhammad appears in the picture here in front of his house.

loans.use: For license renewal fees and car repair

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one young child. In 2007, he started running his own business; he works as a hairdresser receiving clients at his beauty salon. He has worked in this domain for the past 15 years. His income is important to help with the household expenses. He has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and he has been a reliable client paying on his scheduled dates. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new hairdressing tools and a vaporization machine so he can offer his clients better and more comfortable services.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools and a vaporization machine

loans.name: Donathilla

texts.en:
Donathilla is 26 years old and is married with two children between the ages 5 and 7 years.  She has owned a butcher shop for the past 8 years.  Her business is well-organized and open from 6am until 6pm every day.

Donathilla has requested a loan to increase her working capital and purchase more meat.  She plans to use any profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buys slippers/flip-flops at wholesale to increase inventory

loans.name: Youk

texts.en:
Youk T. is a 53 year-old woman who earns her daily living by selling rice in Kompong Tom province.  Usually Youk T. can earn a profit of approximately $2.25 each day to use for daily expenses. 
Youk T. divorced for her husband of many years .She has five single children, three of whom are working as sewing workers and construction workers. Monthly they always share their gross profit with Youk T.. 
Unluckily, her daughter's existing motorbike broke during operation, and she spent much money to mend it often. In order to solve this problem, Youk T. will take out her loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 26 years and is single.  He sells clothing; mainly men's clothes. He has been in this business for about four years and is open from 7am until 5pm every day. His business is well-organized and he employs one other person. 

Daniel has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding a variety of styles, such as men’s and women’s clothing.

With this loan, Daniel  has a vision of growing his business to the extent that he can even start wholesaling. If he starts wholesaling, he hopes to earn more profits than before which, in turn, will be used for further reinvestment in his business.

loans.use: To add a variety of clothing styles

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: B. S. est entrepreneur,leader du groupe d’affaire Z., âgée de 44 ans,mariée,mère de 9 enfants.Son conjoint  est chômeur,sans emploi.B. S. est vendeuse de poissons fretins (localement appelé Sambaza)et arachides. Elle s’installe au marché sectoriel Nyabushongo, parfois  à son domicile et  au long de la rue surtout le soir pendant les heures de pointe.  Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle  bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Il ya 10 ans qu’elle est en action.Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouveaux produits(3 bassins de poissons fretins,50 kg d’arachides).En plus,elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et les nourrir confortablement. La cliente B. S.  remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclus de banque classique.Le groupe Z. est constitué de 17 membres.
texts.en: B. S. is an entrepreneur, leader of the business group Z..  She is 44 years old, married, and mother of 9 children.  Her husband is unemployed.  B. S. is a seller of fish fry (locally called Sambaza) and peanuts.  She sets up shop at the regional market Nyabushongo, sometimes at her home, and at the side of the road, especially in the evening during rush hour.  She started her business with funds received from her husband.  Later, she received a loan of $50 from IMF Hekima.  It has been 10 years that she's been in business.  This new loan will allow her to stock new products (3 pools of fish fry and 50 kg of peanuts).  In addition, she aims to grow her business, put her children in school and feed them comfortably.  B. S. thanks Hekima for their work devoted to poor women excluded by traditional banks. The Z. group consists of 17 members.

loans.use: 3 pools of fish fry, 50 kg of peanuts

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 26 years old and is married, with three children between the ages 4 and 8 years old. She sells bedding in her shop. Her business is well-organized and open from 8am until 5pm every day.   She has been working in this business for 3 years.

This is Aimee's first loan from Vision Finance Company and she plans to use it to purchase more bedding to sell.  Any profits she makes will be used to continue to grow her shop.

loans.use: To buy more bedspreads for her shop

loans.name: Katanya Development Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Kantanya Development” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org., in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each one in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Hawa T.. Hawa was born in Makom village, 32 years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader, and her children are attending primary school. Hawa has been a small business woman for 4 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy items like soaps, sardines, candles, etc. in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys items like soaps, sardines, candles, etc. in larger quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has a mixed farm in the county of Nyamira in Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last seventeen years and employs one farmhand. He sells his tea through Kenya Tea Development Authority and milk to the local market. He also earns income from his tailoring business in the same region.

He has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve his  family's livelihood. His primary challenges have been lack of enough farm inputs, especially fertilizers, and pests and diseases which affect his production.

Stephen is 34 years old and married, with 4 children whose ages range between 2 and 12 years old. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, 33, is married, with 5 children whose ages range between 1 and 11 years. Three of the children are currently attending school. He has been in the farming business for four years now and sells his beans, maize and tea to the local market. He is also employed in a local school and earns about 4000Kes monthly. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. In future, he would like to save some money to enable him to start a hotel business. Price fluctuations and lack of enough market for his products have been his major setbacks.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Go Try” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each one in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu K..  Salamatu was born in Makeni city.  She is 35 years old. Salamatu is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman, and 2 of her children are attending primary school.  One is in secondary school.  Salamatu has been selling biscuits, soaps, mints, chewing gum, and gara clothes (locally dyed clothes) for 5 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to expand the size and quality of her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity.

loans.use: Buys biscuits, soaps, mints, chewing gum, and gara clothes in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Юсупов Файзулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Файзулло имеет средне - специальное образование, механизатор. По специальности проработал 15 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. Он в основном продает рыбу. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Fayzullo Y. lives in the Gissar Region. 48 years of age. Married, with four children. His wife is a homemaker. Fayzullo has a technical education; he is an agricultural machinery operator. He has worked in this area for 15 years. Currently he is a vendor at the central market of his region. He mostly sells fish. He has been in this line of business for 10 years. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and employs two farmhands. Her mixed farm, which is located in the county of Nyamira in western Kenya, produces tea, maize, milk and sorghum, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her cereals store in the same region.

Callen is 41 years old and married with 8 children.

She has requested a loan of 45,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her expand her farming business. She would like to have at least 3 dairy cows in the next 5 years. Lack of proper markets and animal diseases have been her biggest challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pay Fine Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Pay Fine” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Jattu T. is the leader of this group. Jattu is 40 years old and married, with 2 children who are in college. Jattu sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes). She has been doing this business for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, Jattu will invest in her business by buying materials for making gara lappers – inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc., in order to produce a larger quantity of gara lappers for sale.

loans.use: To buy materials for making gara lappers – inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc., in order to produce a larger quantity to of gara lappers for sale

loans.name: Katim Ole

texts.en:
Katim Ole S.  is 27 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last six years.

Katim learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend on farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children.

Katim's hope and dream is to excel in farming and to construct more rental houses. He is a hardworking man and with the right resources he can do great things.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Dariya

texts.en:
Dariya is 63 years old and widowed. She sells children's clothing at Trayan market in Ivano-Frankovsk town. She has been in this business for 11 years, and is able to attract many customers through affordable prices and a large variety of clothing.

Dariya is retired but she does not want to stay at home. She wants to continue working and help her grandchildren. So she travels 30 miles by bus to get to the market where she has her business. This business is the only source of income for Dariya. 

Dariya would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase spring children's clothing - coats and pants. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 48, is a married mother of 3 children aged 14 to 24. She is a farmer from the county of Murang'a, in central Kenya, and has been in the farming business for 2 years now. She employs 2 to 3 casual laborers and sells her products at the local market. She also earns income from the sale of rice at the market.

Jane has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase farming supplies. She says that this will increase her production and earn her more income. The proceeds from this loan will enable her to educate her younger siblings and expand her business. She would like to increase the acreage of her farm and start her own brand of rice in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Susan Enole

texts.en:
Susan Enole O. is 40 years old.  She is married and is a mother of nine children. Susan is a farmer and has been farming her own piece of land for the last three years.

Susan learned about KADET LTD from other women in her area of residence who are already registered with KADET. This will be her third loan, which she is planning to spend on fertilizers and bags of wheat for planting.  She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. 

Susan hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Her dream is to educate her children to university level and expand her farming.  She is an assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and bags of wheat for planting

loans.name: Paatita  Ole

texts.en:
Paatita Ole N. is 41 years old.  He is married to Nashuru and is the father of six children.  Paatita is a farmer and has been farming for four years in Narok county. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for crop farming.

Paatita learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staffs in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting and to hire manpower to prepare the land.

Paatita hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. Paatita is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: To buy  fertilizers and seeds for planting, and hire labor

loans.name: Bibihaticha

texts.ru: Самадова Бибихатича проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст, 35 лет. Вдова, имеет троих детей. Образование - среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Арендует торговую точку, где продает рыбу. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Bibihaticha S. lives in the Gissar district.  She is 35 years old, a widow and has three children.  She has a secondary education and works at the district's central market.  Bibihaticha leases a retail stand, where she sells fish.  She has been in this business for over 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Leah Enole

texts.en:
Leah Enole M. is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. Leah has been practising farming in Narok county for about four years on her own farm and she earns a good income.

Leah learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to use to buy seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small scale to commercial. Leah's dream is to build a rental premises and to live a better life. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas has been practicing mixed farming for three years now and employs 3 casual laborers. He is 41 years old and married with 4 school-aged children, three of whom are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase farm supplies. He says that this loan will improve his production level since he will have all the necessary supplies for his farm. He would like to own a van in the future that will assist him in transporting his products to the market.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two daughters, aged 11 and 13 years. She runs a teenage clothing sales business at two different markets of Ivano-Frankivsk: Central Marketplace and Novgorodskyi Market. She launched her venture 9 years ago through lending assistance for start-ups. Her monthly income, which is the main source of income for the family, currently amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 17,500 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of merchandise. She is planning to continue expanding her trade and to open a new vending location in the future. Profits generated will be used to finish construction of her private house, which is still in progress.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in the business of selling oil. She is 36 years old and single. She borrowed a loan to stock more ice cream to sell. In the future, Joice hopes to expand her business with extra profits.

loans.use: stock more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Karisisi Enole

texts.en:
Karisisi Enole K. is 33 years old and married with six children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Karisisi learned about KADET from a registered women's group with KADET. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to use to buy seed and to weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to advance the farming and buy more cows. Karisisi's dream is to buy a plot of land and educate her children. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy seed and to weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana is 31 years old and married with one child who is 4 months old.  He is a farmer from the county of Kitale, in western Kenya, where he has been farming for five years now. His main products are eggs, beans and maize, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business and a small shop that he operates in the same region.
