Yohana recently repaid a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES, and has requested a new loan of 60,000 KES to expand his poultry farming operation. The extra income obtained from this project will help him improve his family's living conditions. He would like to start large-scale poultry farming in the next five years. He says that his major challenge has been the high cost of poultry feed.

loans.use: to expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Mumbi Enole

texts.en:
Mumbi Enole N. is 41 years old and married with seven children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Mumbi learned about KADET from a women's group registered with KADET. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to use to buy seed and to weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to advance the farm and buy more livestock. Mumbi's dream is to have a better life and educate her children to higher levels. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy seed and to weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm

loans.name: Rumpene

texts.en:
Rumpene O. N. is 28 years old, married and the father of two children. He has been farming for the last six years and earns a good profit. His farm is in a productive area with good climatic conditions, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Rumpene learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to prepare his land for wheat farming. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. Rumpene is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for planting wheat

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert M. was born in 1963, in Gandzakar village, an area of Ijevan. From 1984 till 1990, he worked as a driver, and in 1990 he participated in the Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict, after which he decided to continue serving in the army.  
Simultaneously with his serving, Robert is engaged in animal breeding. Robert’s wife and his two sons help him to raise cows, calves and pigs. Thanks to their joint efforts they take care of the major part of their family’s needs. 

Robert needs 600.000 Armenian drams loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.
This is Robert’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon, and he has never delayed his loans’ repayments.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Jane Wambui

texts.en:
Jane Wambui G. is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last three years and yields a good income.

Jane came to know about KADET LTD through other women who are  already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan, having successfully repaid the previous ones well and on time. Jane plans  to spend the entire amount to buy farm supplies. Jane hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small scale to commercial. Her dream is to educate her children to higher level education and expand her farming activity. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, 45, is a married mother of 8 children whose ages range between 7 and 20. Seven of the children are currently attending school. She has been farming for the last twenty years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans which are all sold locally. She also owns two motorcycles that provide transport services to the locals.

Rita has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after she successfully repaid her third loan. She has requested this loan of 90,000Kes to expand her poultry project. The profits from this loan will assist her in meeting the basic needs of her family. Her biggest challenge has been the high cost of poultry feed. In future, she would like to practice poultry farming on a large scale and also venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Madame Ayawa  est née à Baguida et habite quartier  Avépozo. Elle a 44 ans et est mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait la vente de produits de beauté, Bazin et couche pour bébé. Elle a débuté cette activité en 2003 et achète ces marchandises au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite, elle revend à la devanture de  son domicile. Elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt  pour acheter un lot de produits de beauté,  3 douzaines de Bazins, et 5 douzaines de couches pour bébé.
texts.en: Madame T. was born in Baguida and lives in the  Avépozo district. She is 44 years old and the mother of two children.  She sells cosmetics, Bazin (damask fabric) and baby diapers. She started this business in 2003 and buys her merchandise at the Lomé Grand Market.    She then sells her merchandise in the storefront of her home. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a supply of cosmetics, 3 dozen Bazins, and 5 dozen diapers.

loans.use: To buy Bazins, cosmetics and baby diapers

loans.name: Missiagbeto

texts.fr: Monsieur Missiagbe est marié et a 2 enfants à sa charge.  Il exerce la vente de chaussures pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa famille.  Il achète les chaussures au grand marché de Lomé et compte dans cette activité 12 ans déjà. Il habite  quartier  Adamavo  où il redistribue ces marchandises à côté   de l’Eglise catholique. Il  demande un prêt pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire plus de client.
texts.en: Mr. Missiagbe is married and has two children in his care. He runs a shoe sale business, which allows him to meet the needs of his family. He buys the shoes at the big market in Lomé and he has been in this business for twelve years. He lives in the neighborhood of Adamavo, where he also sells his shoes next to the Catholic Church. He requests a loan to restock and be able to respond to an increasing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 35 years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk, maize and beans the local market. He also depends on his pension pay to care for the basic needs of his family.

Joseph is 72 years old and married, with 10 children who are all adults.

He has requested a loan of 30,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children who are in college, and also to afford a better life. He hopes that in the next five years, he will have expanded his farming in terms of the number of chickens he will own.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu, who is 34 years old and single, cares for one dependent. For the past five years he has worked hard in his small shop selling products such as cooking oil, water, juice, notebooks, cosmetics products, etc. His business, which is packed with things, operates from 6 am until 10 pm everyday, and he employs one other person.

Jean de Dieu has now requested a loan in order to purchase more products for his shop, an expansion that will allow him to earn more money to invest in his business and to offer family support. With the extra income, he expects to save some money and he hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, who is 27 and cares for one child, has operated a business selling spare car parts for the past two years. Employing one person to help her, her shop is open from 6:30 am to 9 pm every day of the week. Alice will use her loan to purchase more spare parts for the store and plans to reinvest all of her profits into her shop.

Alice thanks Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy more car spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine, a 31-year-old mother of four children, works with her husband in their plumbing supplies business selling spare parts.  They employ one person and are open from 7 am to 6:30 pm every day of the week.  Sandrine has had this business for two years and plans to use this loan to purchase more spare parts to sell.  Any profits will be similarly reinvested to ensure future success.

loans.use: To purchase more plumbing spare parts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
40-year-old Joseph M. is married with six children who all attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for twenty years in a town called Kitale in western Kenya. His farm produces maize, milk and beans which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand his poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children. His major challenges have been poultry diseases and fluctuation in the market prices of his products. He plans to venture into keeping exotic birds in the future.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 37 years old and owns a laundry company. Augustin is married and does not have children of his own, but he has two dependents. Augustin's well-organized shop has been open for 3 years and employs 10 people, opening at 5AM every day except Sunday.

Augustin is requesting a loan to purchase additional equipment for his employees. With the additional profits he hopes to receive from this, he intends to continue to expand his laundry business.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for his employees

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 28 and not yet married, and he cares for one of his relatives. Jean Pierre has a well-organized shop where he performs secretarial services. Two years ago, Jean Pierre got into this business due to his interest in it. Jean Pierre's shop is open from 7AM until 8PM daily except for Sunday and it employs one other person. With the requested loan, Jean Pierre intends to purchase an additional computer and printer. Jean Pierre will save any additional profits he earns from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase an additional computer and a printer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells shoes.  She is 28 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband also works in commerce.  Esther has had her store for 4 years and employs one other person to help her manage.  Her store is packed with shoes and open between 7am and 8pm.

Esther will use the requested loan to purchase more shoes in a bid to improve her profits.  She plans to continue to reinvest into her store to ensure it is running well.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 41 years old and married with 5 children.  Her husband is a businessman.  Jeannette owns a well-organized store in Nyabugogo.  She has had this store for 10 years and employs 2 people. Her business is open from 7:30am until 5pm every day.

Jeannette will use the requested loan to purchase more clothing to sell.  With any profits she makes from the sale of her new stock, she plans to save for the future of her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has owned her plumbing parts business for 5 years, allowing her to support her six children single handedly. Christine employs one other person and keeps the shop open from 7am until 6pm every day.
 
This is Christine's first loan which she will use to buy new spare parts, rather than used parts, to sell at her shop. With the additional profits she hopes to reap after the loan, Christine would like to hire additional employees and to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy new parts to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 45 years old and cares for two of her relatives who are 5 and 6 years old. Christine has a well-organized store that sells useful daily groceries such as flour, cooking oil, tomato paste and dried fish.  She has plenty of experience having owned her store for 16 years.  She employs one other person to help with the running of the store.

Christine is planning to use her loan to purchase sugar, flour and rice to sell.  She will use the profits to pay for school fees for the two relatives she cares for on her own.  She hopes that her business will allow her to satisfy the needs of those she cares for.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Gisele Kayumba

texts.en:
Gisele is 38 and is married with 3 children who are aged between 5 and 11 years old. Marie has been running a store that sells wedding clothing for the past 4 years. The store is open from 8am until 6pm during the week and employs one other person.

Gisele will use her loan to purchase some more stock for her shop and also to help start a new clothing business. All her profits will go back into investing in this new business.

loans.use: To purchase more wedding clothing to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 29, single and provides for other members of his family. He runs a clothing store and employs one other person. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock for his store and to continue to expand his range. He would like to use his profits to re-invest in his business. Once this is stable he would like to use the rest for savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 30 years old, married and has 2 children aged 3 and 5. Her husband is a businessman and Francoise owns a small store selling a variety of grocery items. She employs 2 people and is open from 6am until 10pm everyday.  

Francoise will use her loan to purchase more grocery products to sell and to buy a new place of business. She will use the profits she makes to first buy some land and then to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more products and buy a new store

loans.name: Candide

texts.en:
Candide is 42, married and mother to five children between aged 2 and 15. Jovial and hard-working, Candide and her husband also support 5 additional relatives between aged 10 and 17. Candide's husband is a driver
.
Candide runs a business raising cattle, working every day of the week. She has run this business for 20 years. With her loan, she plans on buying additional cattle, additional equipment and paying her one employee. This is Candide's first loan. With any additional profits realized after her loan, she hopes to expand her business by diversifying into raising chickens and, in the longer-term, build her own home.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle, equipment, and to pay her employee

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata T. est une femme divorcée  de 55 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. La vente de pain a été sa principale préoccupation. C’est en 2003 qu’elle s’est reconverti vers la commerce de thioubs. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Elle est très passionnée par son activité surtout pendant les périodes d’achat et de revente de marchandises. Elle st sociétaire au guichet de Yoff depuis novembre 2005 et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs qui est prévu pour l’achat de thioubs pour les besoins de son commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer ses gains et de mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata T., age 55, is divorced and lives in the city of Yoff. Her main business was selling bread, until 2003 when she switched to selling "thioubs" (dyed fabrics). She chose this business in order to earn a living and provide for herself. She's very passionate about her job, especially during buying and reselling times.

She's been a member of the Yoff branch since November of 2005 and already benefited from a previous loan. She's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000, to buy "thioubs" for her business. This loan will enable her to increase her profits and to provide for herself more effectively.

loans.use: To buy "thioubs" (dyed fabrics)

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr: Alphonse T. est un commerçant en  province de l’ouest(Rubavu), il est âgée de 36 ans, il a 3 enfants, entre 8 et 2 ans, il est né au Burundi, son niveau d’éducation est  primaire. Il a une expérience de remboursement des prêts car, le prêt qu’il sollicite est le trantième prêt, il va acheter la moto taxi pour renforcer son business , mais il est détaillant de pomme de terre, riz, ciment et autres. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de diversifier les produits vendus pour profiter d’avantage, et pouvoir aider ses enfants à terminer leurs études. Dans l’avenir il veut devenir grossiste.
texts.en: Alphonse T. is a merchant in the Western Province (Rubavu), He is 36 years old and has 3 children between 2 and 8 years of age, He was born in Burundi and was educated at the elementary school level.  As this is the third loan that he is requesting, he has experience in loan repayment. He will buy a motorbike, but he is a retailer of potatoes, rice, cement and other items. His strategy to expand his business is to diversify the products sold so as to increase his profit, and to be able to help his children finish their studies. In the future he wants to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine runs a supermarket. She is 28, married and has 2 children who are 6 and 3 years old. She also cares for one dependant who is one of her relatives. Currently her husband isn't working. Vestine has a well-organized stall which she has owned for 1 year. She employs one person to help her and she is open from 8am until 5pm.

Vestine will use this loan to purchase more vegetables to sell and she hopes to make some good profits. She plans to use the profits to continue buying more vegetables to expand her supermarket and build her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and to expand her supermarket.

loans.name: Kaadija Enole

texts.en:
Kaadija Enole K., a 35-year-old married mother of seven children, has been farming her own piece of land for the last four years. Kaadija Enole learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan with which she is planning to buy fertilizer and three bags of wheat and maize. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

An assiduous woman determined to achieve her goals, Kaadija dreams of buying a good house and expanding her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and three bags of wheat and maize.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 28 years old, married and has 3 children who all go to school. She will use the loan to stock more bread to sell. With the extra profits from the business, Lina hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: El Hadj Moussa

texts.fr: El Hadj Moussa Sané est un yoffois de 36 ans. Il est topographe de métier depuis 2006. Auparavant Il exerçait l’activité de commerce. Il a choisi son métier de topographe par passion. L’activité de commerce aussi l’intéresse beaucoup. Le but  recherché est la réalisation de bénéfices qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2009. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 70 000 frs destiné à l’achat de parfums, lait, crème  et autres produits de beauté divers pour femmes. Son objectif est de développer son commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
El Hadj Moussa Sané, age 36, lives in Yuff. He's been a professional topographer since 2006. Before that, he was a merchant. He chose to be become a topographer out of passion. He is also very interested in running a business. His goal is to turn a profit in order to provide for his own needs.

He's been a member of the Yuff credit union since August 2009. He already repaid a previous loan, and he is now seeking a loan of XOF 70'000, to be used to buy perfumes, lotions, and other kinds of women's cosmetics. His goal is to bolster his business, increase his profits, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 25 years old and has owned his general store for 4 years. He employs 2 people and is open between 6am and 11 pm. His store is relatively new and well-organised.

Jean Damascene will use his loan to purchase more products for his store. He would like to use any profits to start building a house.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his general store

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne M. habite à Yoff Tonghor. Il est marié et évolue dans le secteur de la pêche depuis 1997. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par passion. Il est aussi né d’une famille de pêcheur et l’a hérité de son grand père. Son objectif est de réaliser des bénéfices à travers l’activité qu’il exerce. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2004.  Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de réparer sa pirogue qui est tombée panne et assurer l’entretien de cette dernière. Monsieur M. souhaite  accroitre ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne M. is married and lives in Yoff Tonghor. Since 1997, he's been a fisherman. He chose this job out of passion. Being from a family of fishermen, he inherited this passion from his grandfather. His goal is to run a profitable business.

He's been a member of the Yoff credit union since 2004. He's seeking a loan of XOF 150'000 to repair his pirogue that is broken down, and to ensure its maintenance. Mr. M. would like to increase his income and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To repair his pirogue

loans.name: Angel

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 a 16 ans,trois de ses enfants vont a l'école, pour palier aux difficultés de sa famille elle va entreprendre en 2000 une activité sur la vente de la layette comme des couches, brassières, pulls, biberons et tous ce dont les femmes enceintes ont besoin pour la naissance de leur nouveau nés.
Elle a eu a rembourser sans trop de difficultés et a eu des épargnes considérables. 
Avec ce second prêt elle tient a renforcer le stock de ses marchandises et compléter ce dont qui lui manque.
 Elle a des ventes de 20000 a 35000frs par jour,elle tient a aller plus  loin avec son activité et être une femme de renommée dans son business, a la longue elle veut aller a l'étranger et avec ses bénéfices amener ses enfants a faire des grandes études.
texts.en:
Angel A., age 40, is a merchant. She's married and the mother of four children, aged between 2 and 16. Three of her children attend school. In 2000, in order to overcome the difficulties faced by her family, she started a business selling layettes, diapers, brassieres, sweaters, feeding bottles, and everything pregnant women need for the birth of their child.

She was able to repay her first loan without problems, and managed to put away a large sum. With this second loan, she wants to bolster and complete her stock of supplies. Her daily sales amount to XOF 20'000 to 30'000, and she wants to progress with her business and become renowned in her field of activity. In the future, she would like to use her profits to go abroad and get her children to pursue advanced studies.

loans.use: To buy dozens of diapers, brassieres, sweaters, feeding bottles

loans.name: Nolkisaruni Enole

texts.en:
Nolkisaruni Enole T., a 40-year-old married mother of 10 children, has been farming on her own piece of land for the last four years. She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan with which she is planning to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house.

Nolkisaruni, a conscientious lady determined to achieve her objectives, dreams of being a prominent wheat farmer and ensuring a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino y a la producción de leche; también es profesora. Vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Sullcata. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de dos vacas lecheras de mediana calidad para mejorar sus ingresos por venta de leche. Ella está casada y tiene cinco hijos, todos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Maribel's business is pig raising and milk production.  She is also a teacher.   She lives in her own home, in the town of Sulicata.  This is her main source of income with which she supports herself.

Maribel's loan will be used to buy two average-quality dairy cows to improve the income she makes from her milk sales.  She is married and has five dependent children.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows to improve her milk production

loans.name: Nolatuesha Ene

texts.en:
Nolatuesha Ene T., a 40-year-old widowed mother of seven children, has been farming on her own piece of land for the last ten years. She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan with which she will buy fertilizer and bags of wheat and maize. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

An assiduous woman whois determined to achieve her goals, Nolatuesha dreams of educating her children and expanding her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and bags of wheat and maize.

loans.name: Charity Wanjiku

texts.en:
Charity Wanjiku M. is a 45-year-old, married woman. Her husband is Adrew Njau and together they are blessed with four children. They live in Lodwar. Charity runs a shop for selling new clothes. She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of 15,500 KES. She has never borrowed from any MFI before.


This will be Charity's first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy new clothes to sell. She will reinvest her profits back into the business. In the future, she wants to be financially stable and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 29 ans, elle se lance dans la vente des chaussures en 1980 pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Avec le premier , elle a acheté des culottes , habits, sandales et chaussures pour enfants , ses ventes étaient  de 20000frs a 45.000frs par jour.Elle a eu a faire des ventes considérables avec beaucoup plus de bénéfices , elle a épargne, c'est pour cela qu'elle a pense prendre le deuxième prêt pour renforcer et élargir son activité.
Tres entreprenante, elle veut ouvrir des stands de ventes dans des différents endroits et recruter des jeunes femmes a la longue qui vont travailler pour elle.
texts.en:
Yolande N., age 46, is a merchant. She's married and the mother of six children, aged 4 to 29. In 1980, she started selling shoes to provide for her family. She used her first loan to buy panties, clothes, sandals, and children's shoes. Her daily sales amount to XOF 20'000 to 40'000. She had considerable sales and increased profits and savings.

She's seeking a second loan to bolster and expand her business. A real entrepreneur, she wants to open selling booths at various locations in the future, and recruit young women to work for her.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes, panties, and sandals

loans.name: Lucy Magaly

texts.es:
Lucy es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad,  reside junto a sus esposo e hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lucy cuenta con un pequeño negocio instalado en el mercado del distrito de Olmos. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Además ofrece la venta de plásticos sandalias y otros artículos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su negocio ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 35-year-old mother of a family who resides with her husband and children in the district of Olmos, a highly commercial area amidst an agricultural zone in the province of Lambayeque, located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Lucy operates a small business installed in the district market of Olmos. Here she offers her customers diverse products of daily consumption, including groceries. She also offers plastic sandals and other articles. The business has been well received due to the quality of the products she offers and her good attention to customers. With the income this activity provides she is able to sustain her family.

The recent demand her business has experienced has made her consider expanding it, acquiring more products. For this purpose, Lucy has found it convenient to request a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols, with which she intends to satisfy the demand of he customers.

loans.use: TO ACQUIRE MORE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Mwino Akuwa Group A-Jinja

texts.en: 40-year-old T. Wallen has operated his poultry sales business for one year. He operates this business from home and, weekly, this enterprise brings him shillings 90,000. Wallen says he started out with a rental business. Capital from the rental business, which he still operates, enabled him to get a foothold. He says that determination is what has gotten him this far. Wallen is happily married with 6 kids and he says that he will use this loan to pay for the completion costs on his rental structures

loans.use: to pay for completion costs on his rental structures

loans.name: Alicio

texts.en:
Alicio P. is 30 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the area of Arasty in Carapeguá, Paraguay.

Alicio started out working as a mason's assistant when he was 14 years old. After six years, he had saved enough money to start a small motorcycle shop. Today he is self-employed, thanks to that investment. 

The shop is provides a good opportunity for growth because most people living in the area own motorcycles. Alicio is requesting this loan so that he can purchase an air compressor he needs in his work.

loans.use: Purchase of an air compressor and other fixed assets for his motorcycle shop.

loans.name: Colere Jack

texts.fr:
jeune commerçante de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfant,il se lance dans le commerce des ventes des habits homme il y a 7 ans, comme il n'avait pas pu continuer ses etudes a cause des moyens avec la somme de 50000frs.
 A l'octroi de son premier prêt il renforce avec l'achat des marinières,body et des maillots de corps.Il a eu a faire des ventes considérables et a beaucoup epargne.

Pour le second prêt , il  veut refaire la même chose en changeant de stratégie de vente, aller acheter aux grossistes qui reviennent de Kinshasa ou de Cotonou .
Tres pragmatique , il veut devenir un homme d'affaire de renommé nationale et avec les benefices il veut se marier dans peu de temps et fonder une famille.
texts.en:
This is a young merchant, aged 25, who is single and without children. With 50,000 francs, he started a business selling men's clothing seven years ago, since he was not able to continue in his studies due to a lack of means. 

With his first loan awarded to him, he bolstered his business by buying long-sleeve T-shirts, bodysuits, and jerseys. He had to make significant sales and to save a lot of money. For the second loan, he wants to do the same thing but change his sales strategy and go to wholesalers from Kinshasa or from Cotonou to buy goods. 

A very pragmatic man, he wants to become a renowned businessman nationally.  Using the profits, he wants to get married soon and start a family.

loans.use: Buying jeans, jumpsuits, T-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Sofia; ella tiene 43 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 4 Hijos; La socia  tiene un negocio D. tienda D. venta D. libros, ella tiene un puesto D. venta D. libros en forma ambulatoria, ella venD. libros, cuentos y libros D. aprendizaje, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. libros.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar libros al por mayor.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. golosinas, venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. libros y tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
These people are members of the "AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES” (Enterprising Friends) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Ana Sofia is 43 years old, single, and has 4 children.  Her business is selling books.  She has a mobile stall from which she sells books, both fiction and non-fiction.  She would like to expand and improve her book business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy books wholesale.

The other members of the group sell candy, beauty products, books and groceries.

Ana Sofia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy books wholesale

loans.name: Benoit

texts.en:
Benoit K. is 61 years old. He cares for two dependents, who are both students. 

Benoit has a clean and well-organized fabric store which he has owned for 10 years. He works by himself in his shop from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM during the week.

Benoit will use his loan to purchase more of the traditional African fabrics which are popular for dressmaking in Rwanda. He wants to use any profit he makes to build a new store for his fabric business.

loans.use: To purchase more traditional African fabric for resell.

loans.name: Tedo Koko

texts.fr: Madame Tedo est née en  1954 à Anfoin.  Elle  habite quartier  Adamavo. Elle a perdu son mari et pour arriver à s’occuper de ses 2  enfants, elle fait le commerce  de céréales. Elle a débuté en  1985 cette activité  et s’approvisionne à    Tsévié, Tabligbo et Afagnan.  Elle revend  les  céréales  derrière l’Eglise Catholique d’Adamavo.   Elle  sollicite  un crédit pour acheter  10 sacs  de  Maïs  et  5 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Mrs. Tedo was born in Anfoin in 1954. She lives in the Adamavo district. She has lost her husband, and, to be able to support her two children, she sells cereals. She launched this business in 1985 and stocks up in Tsévié, Tabligbo and Afagnan. She resells her cereals behind the Catholic church of Adamavo. She is seeking a loan to purchase 10 bags of corn and five bags of beans.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and beans

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside a su esposo y su hijo en el caserío Chacupe bajo, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Rosa se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la artesanía, ella elabora sombreros desde hace más de diez años, sus ventas las realiza mensualmente en el mercado de Monsefu a los agricultores de diferentes zonas, adicionalmente ella se dedica a la crianza de animales cuando tienen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado los vende en los mercados de la zona.

Ella desea adquirir materia prima como la palma y otros que utiliza para la elaboración de sombreros. Esta acción la ayudará a tener mayores márgenes de ganancia ya que los comprara al contado y no al crédito. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, married and lives with her husband and her son in the Chacupe village, a rural area that is the center of agriculture in the district of La Victoria. It is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

Rosa works doing traditional craft work. She has been making hats for more than 10 years. Her monthly sales are achieved through selling in the Monsefu market to farmers from different areas. Additionally, she raises animals and when they are appropriately developed she sells them in the markets. 

She wants to purchase raw materials such as palm and others to make hats. This action will help her to have higher profit margins since she purchases them with cash and not credit. Because of this, she finds it necessary to request a loan of 400 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa is a pretty quiet and responsible person. Her greatest desire is to be able to grow her business and advance her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: N.  Agnès  est   commerçante en province de l’ ouest (Rutsiro ) elle a 49 ans, elle est marié ,elle a 7 enfants, entre 25 et 11,ans  6 de ces enfants vont à l’ école , elle est née au Rwanda,  son  niveau d’étude est primaire . Elle a une expérience  de remboursement des prêts  car le cycle actuel de  prêt  qu’elle   sollicite est  quatrième, ave ce prêt, elle va acheter 2 sacs du riz ,20l d’huile, acheter  les chaises  et autres  pour a son restaurant.    Sa stratégie pour la croissance  de l’affaire de développer  son    business de restaurant en augmenter  la capacité et pour aider ses enfants à terminer ses études et pour le bien être de sa famille dans le temps à venir.
texts.en: Agnès N. is an entrepreneur from the West province (Rutsiro). She is 49 years old, married, and has seven children between 25 and 11 years of age. Six of her children are in school. She is born in Rwanda and has received primary education. She has experience repaying her loan as she is now on her fourths cycle. With this new loan, she will buy two bags of rice, 20 liters of oil, chairs and other items for her restaurant. Her business strategy is to keep her restaurant going by increasing its capacity. She would like to help her children finish their studies and ensure the future well-being of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing two bags of rice, 20 l of oil, chairs, etc

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es: La Señora Maria tiene una tienda D. Barrio en una zona periurbana D. la ciudad, el mes D. noviembre perdió a su esposo quien trabaja en la ciudad D. La Paz por esta razón ella tuvo que viajar a esa ciudad para encargarse del tramite D. su difunto esposo, la perdida D. su difunto esposo fue un golpe para ella pero esta saliendo adelante, ella tiene una tienda en su domicilio con la cual genera ingresos para su la manutención D. su familia cuenta con dos hijos uno ya casado y otro soltero ambos viven con ella, el motivo D. la solicitud D. prestamos es por que existe alza D. precios en los productos que comercia por esta razón quiere abastecerse D. víveres específicamente para que a un mediano plazo cuente con mercadería para poder comercializar sin sufrir incremento en sus costos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maria has a neighborhood store in a peri-urban area of the city.  In November she lost her husband who worked in the city of La Paz.  For this reason, she had to travel to that city to take care of all the paperwork.  Her husband's death was a blow for her but she is managing to get ahead.  Maria has a store in her home in which she makes income to support her family.  She has two children, one is already married and the other is single.  They both live with her.  

Maria is requesting this loan because the prices of the products she sells have risen.  For this reason, she would like to stock her store with products so that, in the medium term, she has merchandise to sell without having to suffer an increase in costs.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and macaroni for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Doña Damasia A. C., es casada D. 36 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 4 estan estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, confeccion D. delantales, lleva 8 años D. experiencia, inicio su negocio por iniciativa propia y deseos D. superacion, y cuenta con el apoyo D. sus esposo que se dedica al comercio, quiere ampliar su capital D. trabajo con el fin D. tener mas produccion D. delantales, por lo que reune a 10 compañeras con el fin D. organizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamo a ASDIR, cada una D. las integrantes se dedica a diversas actividades productivas como: Crianza D. animales, Bordado D. Blusas, Confección D. delantales, Venta D. Consumo Diario, Helados, Ropas Típicas, quieren invertir el prestamo para ampiar su capital en la actividad al que se dedica cada una, esperan ver su negocio y tener un local comercial propio.
texts.en:
Damasia A. C. is 36 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 5 children, 4 of whom attend school.

Damasia is in the handicraft business.  She makes aprons and has 8 years experience.  She started in the business on her own initiative and with a desire to improve herself.  She has the support of her husband who is a salesman.

Damasia would like to increase her working capital so that she can produce more aprons.  For this reaS., she gathered together 10 friends to form a group that could request a loan from ASDIR.  Each of the group's members carries out their own business activities such as raising animals, embroidering blouses, making aprons, selling essential food products, selling iced treats and selling traditional clothes.  They would all like to invest their loan money in increasing the working capital of their businesses.  They would like to see their businesses grow and own their own business premises.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah K. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school, six of whom are grown. She also takes care of several grandchildren.    

Hadjah is in the business of selling a locally-brewed alcohol called waragi (bar business). She has been in this business for more than ten years and she works six days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products wholesale. Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bulk quantities of the locally-produced beverage from the villages. She also generates additional income through selling car tires at her husband’s shop.

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to make enough money to pay for school fees for her children and grandchildren and buy a bigger plot of land. Hadjah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of waragi (a locally-brewed alcohol similar to gin) to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine M. is 29 and is married to a technician. She and her husband do not have any children. 

For the past two years, Vestine has run her own video rental shop and employs one person. Her shop is open from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM every day of the week. 

This is Vestine's first loan, and she intends to use it to purchase more videos to rent out. Vestine hopes to see her profits increase, allowing her to reinvest in her business and continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more videos to rent out to customers.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 60 ans, divorcée avec 8 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 20 et 41 ans. En 1980 , elle se lance dans la vente de la layette pour subvenir aux différents charge qui lui incombe pour élever ses enfants.
Avec son premier prêt elle a fait acheter de la marchandise aux commerçantes qui viennent de Kinshasa,Cotonou et de la Chine, elle a fait des ventes de 25000 fr a 60.000frs par jour a beaucoup épargne et a rembourse son prêt sans trop de difficultés.
Vu l'expérience acquise , elle veut persévérer pour l'octroi d'un autre prêt,renforcer son stock et élargir ses étalages de ventes pour que sa fille l'aide pour vendre au marche. 
Tres entreprenante, elle a l'intention d'aller elle même acheter a l'étranger comme font les autres pour qu'elle soit grossiste .
texts.en:
Clémentine N., age 60, is a merchant. She's divorced and has eight children (aged 20 to 41) to support. In 1980, she started selling layettes in order to be able to raise her children. She used her first loan to buy supplies from Kinshasa, Cotonou and China. She sold for XOF 25'000 to 60'000 per day and managed to put away a large sum. She repaid her loan without much difficulty.

Considering the experience she acquired, she wants to seek another loan, to bolster her stock and expand her selling stalls, so that her daughter can help her with the sales at the market. A true entrepreneur, she intends to travel abroad herself to get her supplies and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy diapers, brassieres, blankets, feeding bottles, sheets, drawsheets

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ángel de 37 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Caroline de 7 y Kelly de 1 año, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos días de trabajo que Ana tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la mayor de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que utiliza para eliminar a las plagas, son altamente dañinos para su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una social muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old.  She is a very simple, hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Angel, 37, and their 2 beloved daughters Caroline, 7, and Kelly,1, who are the main reason behind all their efforts.  Ana works arduously on her farm to improve her crops and make her land more productive.  Along with her oldest daughter, she works from very early in the morning planting potatoes and beans.  She will then take her products to sell in the wholesale market in Tarma.   The thing she likes most about her job is planting and watching her crops grow.  She has been doing this for 15 years and she considers fumigating her land the most difficult since the chemicals that she uses to eliminate pests are very harmful to her health.  In time, she hopes to buy more land and increase her production.  

This is her second loan with MFP.  She was very punctual with the payments on her first loan and hopes to do the same again.  She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank for which she is very dear to the rest of the members.  With the one thousand nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] that she is requesting she will purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. lives in the Nabukalu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children. All her children go to school. 

Esther owns a business of selling shoes. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Esther sells her products door-to-door. Esther has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more shoes and add to her business.

The main business challenge for Esther is seasonality. Esther lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es socio propietario en el  sindicato de transportistas  Eduardo Avaroa, también es cubicador de madera. El crédito  lo necesita para el cambio de motor y caja de su vehiculo para seguir trabajando en el transporte de pasajeros. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene el para su familia. Su anhelo a futuro es adquirir una casa propia, para lo cual están ahorrando un poco de dinero cada mes.

Su esposa trabaja como profesora y tienen cuatro hijos. La familia vive en la zona ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto, y pagan un  alquiler mensual. Es primer crédito con Impro y con Kiva.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a shareholding member of the Eduardo Avaroa transportation syndicate, and is also a wood carver. He needs this loan to change the motor and gearbox for his vehicle in order to continue working transporting passengers. This business is his source of income for his family. His wish for the future is to acquire his own home, and he is saving a bit of money every month toward this goal.

His wife works as a teacher and they have four children. The family lives in the Satlelite zone of the city of El Alto, and pay rent every month. This is his first loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: the purchase of an engine and a gearbox for his passenger transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. lives in the Kisasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children and all her children go to school. Jalia is in the business of selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products at the market. 

Jalia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. She also supplements her income through poultry farming  The main business challenge for Jalia is seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to eventually buy her own plot of land to build rental rooms.  Jalia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Las Orgullosas Group

texts.es: EL Banco D. emprendimiento LAS ORGULLOSAS, es un banco nuevo formado por 8 integrantes 7 mujeres y un varon, se dedican a distintas actividades, ellas se dedican a la venta D. productos como: cosméticos ollas en aluminio ,atención en su tienda, venta D. frutas, verduras y otros y la Sra. SUSANA es una D. las socias mas antiguas que anteriormente trabajo con otro banco y ella ocupa el cargo D. presidenta la Sra. se dedica a la venta D. zapatillas en la feria D. Viacha y también hace compra y venta D. arena para la construcción en la urbe paceña  y con el préstamo comprara mercadería en cantidad, zapatos por docenas y también si para el  mantenimiento D. su carro y tiene un hijo, y la Sra. CINTIA ocupa  el cargo D. secretaria y ella se dedica a la venta D. productos cosméticos y es una persona joven con muchos deseo D. salir adelante y con el préstamo comprara mercadería  para  poner en oferta sus productos en variedades, todas las socias están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The entrepreneurs group called "Las Orgullosas" is a new group composed of 8 members, 7 women and one man, who have different businesses, but all work selling products such as: cosmetics, aluminum pots, fruits, vegetables, and other goods. Susana is one of the longest-standing members, who previously worked with another loan group and is now president of this group. She sells shoes in the market at Viacha and also buys and sells sand for construction in the city of La Paz. She will use the loan to buy merchandise in bulk, shoes by the dozen, and also for the maintenance of her car. And she has a son. Cintia is the secretary of the group and she sells cosmetics and is a young person with lots of will to succeed. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to offer for sale. All the members are very grateful to the institution of the support offered to them.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luís trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa; el crédito  lo necesita para comprar el motor y caja de su vehiculo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene el para su familia. 
Jose Luis  desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a un futuro adquirir una movilidad nueva. Está casado y tiene un  hijo;  vive en anticretico en un departamento ubicado en la Ciudad de El Alto. Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Jose Luís is a driver for the Eduardo Avaroa group. He needs a loan to buy an engine and gearbox for his vehicle. This business is the income source for his family.
Jose Luís wants to improve his family's quality of life and in the future to buy another vehicle. He is married and has one son. He lives in an apartment that is rented through a mechanism unique to Bolivia, in a neighborhood in the city of El Alto. This is his first loan from Impro.

loans.use: To buy an engine and gearbox for his  passanger transport business.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr: Innocent  N.  est motard (transporteur de personnes avec taxi moto), en province de l’ouest (rubavu) il est  âgée de 39 ans, il a 7 enfants  entre 16 et 2 ans,  6 de ses enfants    vont  à l’école.  Il est né au Rwanda.  Son niveau d’éducation est primaire,  il a une expérience  de  remboursement des prêts,  le prêt  contracté,  il va l’utiliser pour payer le minerval et les autres frais pour ses enfants.  Sa stratégie  pour  la croissance    de l’affaire c’est éduquer ses enfants  jusqu’au niveau élevé.
texts.en: Innocent  N. is a motorcyclist, he carries people thanks to his moto-taxi in a Western province (Rubavu). He is 39 and has 7 children aged between 2 and 16-years-old. 6 of his children are going to school. Innocent was born in Rwanda and is poorly educated. He reimbursed previous loans and would use the new one to pay for registration fees and other expenses for his children's schooling. His strategy to grow the business is to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To pay for registration fees and other expenses for his children's schooling

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has a small store that sells handbags.  He is 29 and has been selling handbags for five years, employing one other person to help him run the store.  

Emmanuel will increase his handbag stock with this loan.  He would like to use the profits to first increase his business and then save future profits.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children and all her children go to school. Jane is in the business of selling used clothing. She has been in this business for twenty-eight years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop. 

Jane has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She also supplements her income by selling soda and piped water. The main business challenge for Jane is seasonality. Her goal is to eventually build rental houses. She lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes is 26 years old and married with one child. She is dedicated to the buying, fattening and slaughtering of pigs, and is also engaged in the profession of nursing. Her husband helps her with her activities.

She wants to improve her quality of life, and so far has saved a little money with which she is building a house. Her requested loan is to replenish the capital in her business.

She said that she is fulfilling her dreams through her efforts and because of the financial support she receives.

loans.use: Buying pigs to raise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada  y vive junto a su esposo y  sus hijos en el caserío CP ubicado en el distrito de las Lomas, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Cristina se dedica desde hace muchos años a la confección de vestidos y blusas. El confecciona estas prendas para luego vendérselas a un comerciante mayorista que le hace pedidos por temporadas, este negocio es una fuente importante de ingreso a la economía de su familia, Debido a que realiza su trabajo con muy buena calidad su negocio ha ido creciendo y sus pedidos han aumentado considerablemente.

Cristina desea adquirir materiales y equipos para seguir aumentando su producción y poder ofrecer a sus clientes diseños nuevos y de buen acabado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El mayor anhelo de Cristina es sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Cristina, 48, is married living with her husband and children in the CP settlement located in Las Lomas district, a farming zone in Piura province, Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

Cristina has been a dressmaker for many years.  She makes dresses and blouses to sell to a wholesaler who places seasonal orders with her.  This business is an important source of family income.  Because she does high quality work, the business has been growing and her orders have increased considerably.

Cristina wants to acquire equipment and materials to continue increasing production and offer her customers new, nicely finished styles.  Because of this she has deemed it advisable to request a new, 2000 new sol loan, from Edpyme Alternativa.

Cristina’s greatest wish is to support her family and improve their quality of life.  Because of this she exerts the maximum effort in her work.

loans.use: To acquire equipment and materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora Maria Luisa se dedica a la venta D. diferentes productos como ser perfumes, productos D. limpieza para el hogar y es costurera. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá lubricantes para movilidades, pues es un producto que tiene buena acogida entre sus clientes. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro D. la ciudad D. La Paz.  Ella tiene cuatro hijos y es mujer sola, y por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar la mercancía que  necesita para tener más inventario para vender y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
María Luisa sells a variety of products like perfumers and home cleaning products; she’s also a seamstress.  She plans to use the loan to buy vehicle lubricants which are products that are quite popular with her customers.  

She lives in a rented house located in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  She has four children and is a woman alone.  

This is why she’s requesting a loan to buy merchandise she needs in order to have more inventory to sell and have more income.

loans.use: To buy vehicle lubricants to sell as part of her business selling various products.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan de 44 años y sus 4 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Basilia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde la Arveja, habas y maíz que cultiva, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la compra de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, is a very kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Juan, 44, and their four minor children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

By working hard, Basilia has managed to grow her crops.  She rises very early every morning to water and care for her respective crops.  She sells her products in Tarma’s wholesale market where the peas, lima beans and corn she grows are quickly bought.

What she enjoys the most about her work is enjoying the freedom of working in the fields.  She’s been in this occupation for 13 years and considers the most difficult part having to till the soil.  In time she’d like to be able to buy more land to expand production.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She knows that the support will help her quite a bit in the development and progress of her business.  This is why she’s willing to repay all her installments punctually.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very well liked.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.en:
Ms. Miryan is 27 years old, and has been married to Mr. Oscar Lovera for more than five years. They live in their own home in the city of Carapeguá, and have one child in school.

Since an early age she helped her mother make handmade quilts. That is where she learned the trade. She also buys clothes for resale. She sells her products in the area of the capital with the help of her husband. Through this work she has managed to build a modest house and provide good care for her child.

She is applying for a loan to buy bedspreads, blankets and hammocks to resell.

loans.use: Buying bedspreads, blankets and hammocks to resell

loans.name: Marline

texts.fr:
Marline M. est une jeune cliente de HOPE Congo. Cliente de 36 ans, célibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 21 ans.
En 2002 elle se lance dans la vente des tissus.
A l’octroi de son premier prêt elle avait acheté des tissus comme, des rouleaux de popelines pour tenues scolaires,   soies, du coton piqué , des dentelles et des tissus pour homme comme le tergal, super 100 et super 200.
Ayant  rembourse avec succès et réalisé des épargnes énormes, avec ce deuxième prêt elle renforcer le stock de sa marchandise. 
Très entreprenante, elle tient à ouvrir un magasin des tissus.
texts.en:
Marline M. is a young client of Hope Congo. She is 36 years old, unmarried with three children to care for, whose ages range between 3 and 21. In 2002, she began retailing fabric.

As soon as she was granted her first loan she bought batches of poplin in different colors for grade school uniforms, silk, flowered cotton satin, cotton piqué, and fabric for men’s clothing such as tergal, Super 10 and Super 200.

Having fully repaid her loan and made some significant savings, she hopes with this second loan to purchase more stock.

An ambitious woman, she hopes to open a fabric store in the future.

loans.use: Buy clothing fabrics such as poplin in different colors, cotton piqué and cotton satin, taffeta, organza, velours, tergal, silk

loans.name: Flambeau Group

texts.fr:
Louis est le coordinateur de son groupe Flambeau.

Louis habite dans la région Limonade d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Louis a dirigé son commerce de sous-vêtements pendant les dernières 5 années.

Louis voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de vêtements a revendre..

Louis espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à ouvrir un grand shop parce que maintenant il vend ses vêtements dans le marche.

Des autres membres de Flambeau ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits cosmétiques et du charbon.

Louis dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause de chômage.

Louis dit que son rêve est de voyager a Panama pour qu’il achète plus de sous-vêtements moins chers et d’une meilleure qualité.
texts.en:
Louis is the coordinator of his group called "Flambeau" (Torch). He lives in the region of Haiti known as "Limonade" where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He has run his little business selling underwear for the past five years. He would like to use this loan to invest in more underwear for resale. He hopes that this loan will help him to open a big shop since he presently sells his clothing in the marketplace. 

The other members of "Flambeau" need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics and charcoal. 

Louis says his primary challenge is that he lacks repeat customers because people are out of work. His dream is to travel to Panama to buy more underwear at cheaper prices and in better quality.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Ana Valeska

texts.es: Ana Valezka tiene 31 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de un cafetín. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio pues con mucho esmero y sacrificio ha salido adelante. Inicio este medio de vida mediante el alquiler de un local en donde ofrece una variedad de productos, pues sus clientes están conformes con todas las cosas necesarias. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Ana Valezka is 31 years old and runs a small café.  She has owned her business for more than 2 years and, through a lot of care and sacrifice, she has managed to get ahead.  She started out in this line of work by hiring premises where she could offer her customers a variety of products and provide them with everything they need.  She will use this loan to buy candy, bread, cookies, juice and soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 21 et 24 ans.Il y a de cela dix ans pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec la somme de 100.000 frs , elle se lance dans la fabrique et vente des beignets et bouillie de riz et de mais.
Pour faire accroitre son activité elle multiplie les stratégies pour aller vers l'avant.
A l'octroi du premier prêt elle  acheta des sacs de riz, de la farine, du sucre , des bidons d'huile pour faire ses beignets et satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.

A l'avenir elle veut devenir grossiste et avoir des étalages de ventes un peu partout dans les différents quartiers et cela va la permettre de bien rembourser et de faire des épargnes considérables pour atteindre ses objectifs  celle de devenir un grossiste .
texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old, married and mother of two children whose age varies between 21 and 24. Ten years ago, to meet the needs of her family, with 100,000 francs, she started making and selling beignets and boiled rice and corn. 

To grow her business, she developed strategies for moving forward.

With her first loan, she bought bags of rice, flour, sugar, and cans of oil to make beignets and to meet the needs of her customers.

In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler and to have points of sale across different neighborhoods. That will permit her to repay [her loan] and to build substantial savings towards attaining her objective of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, rice, milk, yeast, oil.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, de 42 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. El cultivo de la arveja, papa y maíz es la actividad a la que se dedica Benedicto, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos son muy peligrosos. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más, para aumentar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de arveja, que necesitará para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Benedicto, 42, is an unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house and what he most wants is to work hard to get ahead in life.  Benedicto is a pea, potato and corn farmer.  Every day he rises early to go work his fields with the only end to insure that his crops are of good quality.

What he enjoys most about the work is cultivating the land.  He’s been in this occupation for 20 years and considers the most difficult part fumigating the land because the chemicals are very dangerous.  In time he hopes to plant more to increase production.

This is his 5th loan with MFP.  He knows that he must repay on time if he wants to access future loans.  He is a very responsible, active member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more pea seeds that he will need for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy pea seed.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "SOL NACIENTE  " es un Bancos que se encuentra en su séptimo  ciclo, el cual han  demostrado ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: como Presidenta esta la Sra. Ángela  quien es la líder y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. peluches en  una calle céntrica D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba. Esta casada   y tiene 9 hijos  D. los cuales todos son independientes y tienen sus propios negocios y el crédito que solicitó es para compra D. peluches y así incrementar su  D. Capital D. trabajo,  Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Silvia  quien  esta casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas y tiene como negocio una tienda D. barrio en su domicilio, y solicitó el crédito para compra D. víveres,   es socia antigua y a demostrado ser  una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas, todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The 'Sol Naciente' (Rising Sun) community bank is in its seventh loan cycle.  Its members have shown themselves to be responsible and hard-working people.  The group is represented by the following members:

Ángela is the group's president.  She is the leader and founder of the group and her business is selling teddy bears in a centrally-located street in the city of Cochabamba.  She is married and has 9 children who all live independently and have their own businesses.  She requested her loan to buy teddy bears and thereby increase her working capital.

Silvia is the group's treasurer.  She is married and has two young daughters.  She owns a neighborhood store which is located in her home.  Silvia requested her loan to buy food products.  She is a long-standing member of the group and has shown herself to be a very responsible person who is punctual in making her loan repayments.

All the members of the group are grateful to the institution for the support they have offered them.

loans.use: To buy teddy bears in bulk

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children and all her children go to school. Fatuma operates a  beauty salon.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Fatuma has requested for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, conditioners, braids and weaves. The main business challenge for Fatuma is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations include improving on her standard of living  

She lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, conditioners, braids and weaves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, and all her children go to school. Grace owns and operates a restaurant.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Grace has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, potatoes, beef and rice. The main business challenge for Grace is transportation.  Her goal is to eventually build her own home. Now she lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, rice, cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROGRESO” iniciará el ciclo número cuatro en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la senora Susana.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados:  costura de chamarras, elaboración de papas fritas, venta de carne de cerdo, tienda de barrio, artesania en matas, mantas de hilo, tejido de mantas.
 
La señora Susana, presidenta de la asociacion comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “Progreso”  3 ciclos, aproximadamente  año y medio, su negocio es artesania en manta, el mismo es desarrollado en su domicilio desde hace diez anos aproximadamente, las ventas tambien son realizadas en su domicilio.  Esta actividad le permite trabajar y al mismo tiempo cuidar de su familia.
La asociación tenía muchas espectativas con respecto al crédito, en la fotografía está incluida una señora que estaba pensando solicitar un crédito adicional.
texts.en:
The “PROGRESO” (Progress) communal association is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has nine members and is led by a governing board at the head of which is a President, Susana.

The business which the members of the communal bank run are varied: jacket making, fried potato making, sale of pork, neighborhood store, blanket making, weaving and decorating.

Susana is the President of the communal association.  She indicates that she’s been part of the “Progreso” communal association for three cycles, approximately a year and a half.  Her business is blanket crafts which she has done at home for about ten years now.  Her sales are also home-based.  This activity allows her to work while caring for her family.

The association had great expectations with regard to the loan.  A woman who was thinking about asking for an additional loan is included in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fabric and fringe.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. Leonor, vive en  la zona de pacata alta en la casa de su madre,  Su actividad es la tejer a mano, ella realiza tapetes, manteles de hilo,  tiene muchos pedidos por la calidad de su trabajo, ya entrega a distintos puestos de venta en los mercados, es madre de 4 niños , divorciada, ella es padre y madre para sus hijos ya que ella sola mantiene el hogar con su trabajo, es muy trabajadora dedicada a sus hijos, su préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de material de trabajo, como lanas de distintos colores y texturas, ya que tiene varios pedidos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leonor lives in the Pacata Alta zone in her mother’s house.  She knits by hand.  She makes mats and knitted tablecloths.  She has a lot of pending orders thanks to the quality of her work.  She delivers to several sales points in markets.  She has four children and is divorced.  She is both mother and father to her children since she supports her household by herself through her work.  She is very hard working and dedicated to her children.

She will use the loan to buy working materials, like wool in different colors and textures, because she has several orders pending.

She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy wool to knit tablecloths.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba. Actualmente, Carmen vive en la ciudad del Cusco, provincia de Cusco. Perú.  Ella vende peluches los días sábados en la feria sabatina de “El Baratillo”. Carmen nos cuenta que viaja a su ciudad natal a cosechar café para luego venderlos. Carmen requiere el préstamo para comprar más peluches. 

Carmen se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen, 29, has two children.  She was born in the city of Quillabamba but currently resides in the city of Cusco, Cusco province, Perú.  
She sells stuffed toys every Saturday at the Saturday “El Baratillo” market.  Carmen tells us that she travels to the city of her birth to harvest coffee to sell later.

Carmen needs the loan to buy more stuffed toys.

Carmen is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and at the same time commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more stuffed toys.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
