Sauda N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her mother. Sauda has a business of selling charcoal and snacks.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products at the market. 

Sauda has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal to resell. The main business challenge for Sauda is seasonality. 

Her goals are to lift herself and her family out of poverty and also to start going to the village of Luwero for charcoal. Sauda lives in a home that she owns. She does not have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Katherine Nina

texts.es:
Katherine tiene 22 años de edad, tiene un hijo y nació en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Katherine es una joven madre trabajadora que quiere sacar adelante a su hijo y a su familia, ella después de atender a su pareja y a su hijo se dedica a la venta de artesanía, ella tiene un local alquilado donde vende sus productos y la pueden encontrar desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche de lunes a sábados, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo chompas de lana de alpaca, chulos y otras cosas más. El sueño de Katherine es tener su propia tienda donde puede vender sus productos. 
 
Katherine se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Katherine, 22, has a son.  She was born in Cusco, Perú.  Katherine is a young, hard working mother who wants to support her son and family.  After caring for her spouse and son, she sells crafts.  She has a rented locale where she sells her wares and she can be found there from 9am until 7pm Monday through Saturday.

She needs a loan to buy more merchandise like alpaca wool jackets, chulos (knitted Andean caps), and other items.  Katherine’s dream is to have her own store to sell her products.

Katherine is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like: alpaca wool jackets, knit hats and others.

loans.name: Juana Alcira

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Juana después de hacer sus actividades del hogar  se dedica a confección artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde hace tallado de madera y después vende sus productos en las ferias artesanales. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar madera para el tallado de su artesanía. 

Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, has three children.  She was born in Cusco, Perú.  After doing her household chores, Juana makes crafts.  She has a small workshop in her house where she carves wood.  She then sells her items at artisanal markets.  She’s been in this occupation for 25 years now and does quite well.  Juana needs the loan to buy wood to carve into crafts.

Juana is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and pledges, at the same time, to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood for her crafts.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Sonia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica atender su tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda pequeña en su domicilio donde vende comestibles a sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, leche, pan y muchas cosas más.   

Sonia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sonia, 40, has three children.  She was born in Cusco, Perú.  After doing her household chores she tends to her grocery store.  She has a small store in her house where she sells foodstuffs to her neighbors and friends in the neighborhood.  She’s been in business for three years and does very well.  Sonia needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar, pasta, milk, bread and many other items.

Sonia is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: José Natividad

texts.es:
José tiene 69 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a sus dos hijos en el sector CPM La Clake zona agrícola ubicada en el distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría animales menores como: patos, pavos, pollos, en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. Adicionalmente José se dedica al brindar servicio de guardianía. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le sirven para solventar sus gastos y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

José desea implementar un corral adecuado para poder criar a sus  animales  y de esta manera incrementar su producción ampliando sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José, 69, is married living with his two children in La Clake, a farming zone in Reque district; an area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He raises small farm animals like, ducks, turkeys and chickens, in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants in the area and to the general public.  José also works as a caretaker.  Income from these activities makes it possible for him to pay his expenses and help support his family.

José would like to build a corral that’s adequate for raising his animals so that he can increase production and thus sales.  For this reason he has deemed it convenient to request a 700 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To build an adequate corral to raise his animals in.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores - Chilca Group

texts.es:
Fanny Sànchez V., es socia de la alcancia comunal "Los Triunfadores" del distrito al que pertenece, Chilca. Es madre soltera con 1 hijo de 3 años de edad.
Fanny Sànchez empezò este negocio con un capital que le facilitò su hermana; ya que su hermana cuenta con una ferreterìa grande bièn equipada. 
Fanny es madre y padre para su pequeño hijo; ella tiene muchas expectativas para èl en el futuro, anhela darle una buena educaciòn y crianza.
Fanny le ha puesto todo su entusiasmo a este negocio y espera seguir creciendo.
El prèstamo otorgado serà para la compra de mercaderìa y poder abastecer la ferreterìa, y asì suban sus ventas.
(En la fotografìa la Señora Fanny està de pie, es la tercera empezando por la izquierda y està vestida de chompa color gris)
(*) La persona que no se encuentra en la fotografìa, es la Señora Haydee R. G., quièn estaba de viaje por motivos familiares.
texts.en:
Fanny Sànchez V. is a member of the "Los Triunfadores" (The Winners) community bank which is located in her district of Chilca.  She is a single mother and has one three-year-old child.

Fanny started this business with some capital that her sister gave her since her sister owns a large, well-stocked, hardware store.

Fanny is both mother and father to her young son.  She has a lot of hopes for his future.  She hopes to provide him with a good education and to bring him up well.

Fanny has put all her enthusiasm into this business and she hopes that it will continue to grow.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise and stock her hardware store so that her sales increase.

(In the photo, Fanny is standing up, third from the left, wearing a gray sweater).

(*) The person missing from the photo is Mrs Haydee R. G. who was away for family reasons when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy products for a hardware store

loans.name: Los Emprendedores I Group

texts.es:
Florencio, es casado, tiene 64 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores, vive en la zona D. Enrique Villa Ochoa, distrito D. los Olivos. Hace 11 meses que integra el grupo “Los emprendedores I”, formado por 8 integrantes, quienes le eligieron presidente del grupo.
Comenzó trabajando vendiendo abarrotes, útiles escolares, en su casa, viendo que había muchos ingresos decidió alquilar un local para la venta D. comida, gracias a ello ahora tiene su propio restaurante, tiene estabilidad económica y otro local  donD. venD. toda tipo D. zapatos. El sueño D. Florencio es que su última hija termine su estudio D. contadora y que sea una profesional.
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en la compra D. mercadería (sandalias, zapatos, zapatillas y ropa) para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Florencio, 64, is married and has three adult children.  He lives in the Enrique Villa Ochoa area, Los Olivos district.  He’s been a member of the “Los Emprendedores I” (Entrepreneurs I) group, which has 8 members that elected him group President, for the last 11 months.  

He started out selling groceries and school supplies in his house.  Seeing that income was good he decided to rent a locale to sell food.  Thanks to this he now owns his own restaurant and has economic stability; he has a second locale where he sells all kinds of shoes.  Florencio’s dream is that his youngest daughter finishes her Accounting studies and becomes a professional.

He will use the requested loan to buy merchandise (sandals, shoes, slippers and clothes) so that his business will grow.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Yawovi Mawuko

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yawovi  a 34 ans et est marié.  IL  habite quartier   Baguida et fait élevage de poules pondeuses.  Il  a commencé en  2009 cette activité. Il achète les ingrédients de nourriture des poules au grand marché de Lomé.  Il sollicite un prêt  pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de soja.
texts.en: Mr. Yawovi is 34 years old and is married. He lives in the Baguida district and raises laying hens. He began this activity in 2009. He buys chicken feed at the Great Market in Lomé. He is requesting a loan to buy five bags of corn and three bags of soya beans.

loans.use: buy corn and soya

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is a hairdresser and runs her own salon. She is 31, single, and has two children who are 4 and 8 years old.  She also cares for four dependents.  She manages a clean and well-organized salon which she has had for eight years.  Currently she has six people who work for her.

Joselyne will use this loan to purchase a new hair dryer, new heat tongs, some chairs, hair mesh and other necessary supplies.  She is also interested in employing some new staff.  Any profits she makes will go directly back into expanding and purchasing more goods for her business.

loans.use: to buy new hair tongs, a hair dryer, chairs and hair mesh

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Doña Luz, tiene 39 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 6, 11 y 21 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas,  dicho negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a él, con este negocio doña Luz a logrado mantener a sus hijos y cubrir todos sus gastos.
Ella necesita por el momento comprar mercadería para el negocio (frutas), pero no cuenta con la solvencia económica para disponer de dinero y realizar la compra, por lo que solicita un préstamo. Esta inversión mejorara el negocio, ya que su inventario está lleno de diversas frutas y verduras de los cuales los clientes pueden disponer.
Si proyección es mejorar y aumentar el negocio, las ventas y sus ingresos, por ello trabaja arduamente todos los días sin descuidar el negocio y la familia por quienes también está pendiente de sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Luz is 39 years old and lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel.  She lives with her family.  She has three children who are 21, 11, and 6 years old.  

She has worked selling fruit for 15 years.  Her business is located in the local market and it supports her family and covers her expenses.  

She needs to purchase merchandise for her business, but she lacks the ability to provide money and make the purchase, so she is asking for a loan.  This investment will improve her business, since her inventory is full of a variety of fruits and vegetables that are available to her customers.  

She plans to improve and grow her business, her sales, and her income, so she works very hard every day without neglecting the business and her family, who also rely on her.

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino, de 50 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dominga de 40 años y sus 2 queridas hijas, Noemí de 18 y Raquel de 16 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy joven Celestino se dedicó al cultivo de papa, arveja y maíz, ya que esta es la actividad que se ha realizado por años dentro de su familia. Una vez cosechado, los campesinos y clientes provenientes de otros lugares llegan a sus campos agrícolas para comprarles al por mayor todo lo que ha cosechado, así estos productos son llevados a la ciudad de Lima para su comercialización. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus sembríos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Celestino, 50, is a very kind, hard working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Dominga, 40, and his two beloved daughters, Noemí, 18 and Raquel, 16, who are the motivating force behind all his efforts.

From a very young age Celestino has been a potato, pea and corn farmer because this activity had been in his family for years.  Once harvested, farmers and customers from other areas come to his field to buy everything he’s harvested at wholesale; the products are thus taken to the city of Lima to be sold.

What he enjoys most about his work is cultivating the land, something he does with much dedication.  He’s been in this occupation for 20 years and considers fumigating his crops the most difficult part of it.   In time he wants to buy more land to increase production.

This is his 4th loan with MFP.  He knows that he must repay on time and is willing to do so.  He’s very respectful towards his fellow communal bank members.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jaime Israel

texts.es: Jaime tiene 29 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo de meses de nacido ellos viven en casa de sus padres ubicado en Manzanilla Jaime se dedica al transporte el se inicio trabajando en la mototaxi de su suegro actualmete cuenta con dos mototaxis propia en la cual trabaja y la otra la da en alquiler, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de una refrigeradora y una cocina para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijo, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years old, married, and has a son who was born a few months ago.  They live in his parent's house, located in Manzanilla.  

Jaime works in transportation.  He began working on his father-in-law's mototaxi and currently has two mototaxis of his own.  He works with one and rents out the other.  

This loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator and a stove so that his family can have a better quality of life.  He deserves this loan because he has good references and the will and ability to pay.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator and stove

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 and is happily married with four children, aged 1, 2, 4, and 6. Trained as a hairdresser, Grace works in a salon and employs two others there. She works from 8AM until 11PM every day of the week. 

This is Grace's first loan, and she hopes to use this loan to cover rent costs. With any profits earned after the loan, she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to cover rent costs

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Emilio de 30 años y su querido hijo Yonifer de 8 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. A través de estos años Delfina ha trabajado muy duro para que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad, todas las mañanas con la ayuda de su esposo, trabaja sus tierras, para que sean mas productivas. Los productos, como la papa y arveja que cultiva, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde le ofrecen mejores precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los mercados donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poder sembrar todas sus tierras, para poder incrementar su producción. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Delfina is 30 years old and a very simple and hardworking woman.  She lives in a rented house with her husband Emilio, 30, and their beloved son Yonifer, who is 8.  They want to give him a better quality of life.

Delfina has worked very hard for many years to ensure that her crops are of a good quality.  Every morning her husband heps her work her land so it is more productive.  She sells the crops she grows, such as potatoes and peas, in the market in the city of Tarma, because that is where she can get the best prices.  The part of her work that she likes best is the harvest.  She has done this for 8 years and thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops to the markets where they are sold.  In time she would like to plant all of her fields to increase her production.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she wants to pay her loan back on time so that she can take out more loans that can help improve her business.  She knows that the community bank will support and guide her because she is a well-liked member of the group.  With the 2000 nuevos soles she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer and insecticides to improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Progreso Hacia Adelante 2 Group

texts.es:
Altagracia pertenece al grupo Progreso hacia adelante 2, un grupo formado por 4 mujeres y un hombre, Los cuales son micro empresarios D. L. ciudad D. San Pedro D. Macoris, ciudad del este D. República Dominicana, rodeada D. campos D. caña D. azúcar, y el mar caribe, su comunidad como muchas otras, carece D. servicio D. agua potable, energía eléctrica constante, y un acceso adecuado por medio D. transporte publico.

Altagracia, una señora D. 59 años, L. cual se dedica día a dia, con mucho tesón a su negocio, desD. tempranas horas D. L. mañana, lo cual las dedicas a hacer las compras diarias que su negocio requiere, ya que es un puesto D. comida, específicamente comida rápida, frita, una opción común para cenar en los barrios y comunidades rurales y D. menos recursos, se le llama Fritura, y se venD. todo tipo D. comida, como pollo, carne D. res, plátanos, empanadas (carne, vegetales o queso, cubierto por dos capas D. amasada D. harina y luego freírL.), entre otras comidas, D. especialidad preferiblemente del consumo local. Piensa utilizar este prestamo para L. compra D. los ingredientes o alimentos ya mencionado. Actualmente esta soltera, nos dice que le encanta trabajar y servir a los demás, su gran reto es poder tener un vejez tranquiL. y segura, y que pueda descansar. Le agradece a todos por su apoyo en su nombre y D. su grupo. Gracias.
texts.en:
Altagracia is a member of the “Progreso Hacia Adelante 2” (Progress Forward 2) group which includes four women and one man who are micro entrepreneurs in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, a city in eastern Dominican Republic, surrounded by sugar cane fields and the Caribbean Sea.  Her community, like many others, lacks potable water, reliable electric power and adequate public transportation access.

Altagracia, 59, spends days fiercely dedicated to her business from very early in the morning on when she goes out to make the purchases her business requires because it’s a food stand, specifically fast, fried food, a popular dinner option in the rural low-income neighborhoods and communities.  It’s called Fritura and she sells all kinds of food like, chicken, beef, plantain, turnovers (meat, vegetables or cheese covered by two deep fried dough crusts), among other dishes, especially of local consumption.  She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients or foods already mentioned.  

She is currently single and she tells us that she loves working and serving others.  Her great challenge is to have a tranquil and secure old age so that she can rest.  She expresses her own and her group’s gratituD. to everyone for their support.  Thank you.

loans.use: To buy meat, flour, plantains, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: La Proyección De San José Group

texts.es:
Mily, tiene 24 años D. edad, desD. muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres ya que no contaban con los recursos necesarios para solventar sus gastos, tiene 2 hijos menores. Integra el grupo “L. Proyección D. San José”, como Presidenta
Actualmente su pareja trabaja como taxista, pero el dinero que gana es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas es por ello que Mily  toma L. decisión D. colaborar con los gastos, recordó que su mamá tenía un carrito sanguchero y decidió utilizarlo para vender salchipapas en L. puerta D. su casa. Gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo por las ventas  y el esfuerzo D. ambos pueden cubrir L. pensión escolar D. sus hijos y movilidad. Uno D. los sueños D. Mily es poder tener su propio restaurante para que haya más ingresos y tengan una mejor calidad D. vida. Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en L. compra D. un estándar y mercaderías para L. venta D. útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Mily is 24 years old and since she was very young, she has had to work to support her parents because they didn't have the resources to meet all of their expenses.  She currently lives in the A.H. San José Mz. H Lt. 01 neighborhood in the district of Carabayllo.  She is married and has two young children.  She is a member of the group "L. Proyección D. San José”.  

Her husband works as a taxi driver, but he doesn't earn enough money to meet all of their basic needs, so Mily decided to contribute to their income.  She remembered that her mother had a food cart and she decided to use it to sell sausage and french fries from the door of her house.  Thanks to the income she earned from her sales and both of their effort, they were able to pay the school fees for their children.  

One of Mily's dreams is to have her own restaurant so she will earn more income and have a better quality of life.  With this loan, she wants to buy a standard and merchandise to sell school supplies.

loans.use: Purchase a standard to sell school supplies

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
In the San Blas area of Carapeguá City, some low-income women learned of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program and decided together to receive information on this program. These women are active, hard working and dedicated to embroidery and textiles. 

They were searching for a little more support to promote their credit, increase their household incomes and improve their quality of life. They need this loan transaction to invest in their jobs and thus ensure sustainable growth that will make them succeed as a group and individually.

Mrs. Ramona M. is a well known weaver in her area and wants to buy more fabric, canvas and yarn for increasing her production of textiles, as customers continue to place more orders that sometimes cannot be filled because of the lack of supplies.

loans.use: Buying fabric, thread, needles, yarn, racks, paintings, etc.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Moisés de 41 años y sus dos hijos Gabriela de 12 y Jhon de 10 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que Flor se dedica, es el cultivo de papa, zanahoria, arvejas, entre otros productos. Es así que muy temprano en la mañana trabaja en sus campos, cuida con mucho cuidado sus plantas y evita a toda costa que la plaga de insectos ataquen estas plantaciones. Ella vende sus productos en el mercado central de Tarma, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos la enfermen. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mejores ingresos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, lo invertirá en insecticidas, ya que desea tener unos campos libres de plagas.
texts.en:
Flor, 36, is a very kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Moisés, 41, and their two children, Gabriela, 12 and Jhon, 10, for whom she wants to provide a better future.

Flor is a potato, carrot and pea farmer, among other products.  She starts to tend to her fields very early in the morning caring for her crops very carefully avoiding at all costs that insect infestations attack her plants. She sells her production in Tarma’s central market because that’s where she’s paid the best.  What she most enjoys about the work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruits of long months of labor.  She’s been in this occupation for 12 years and considers fumigating the lands the most difficult part because she always runs the risk of the chemicals making her sick.  In the future she hopes to improve her crops so that income will be better.

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she states that the contribution will be very helpful for her business’ progress.  She is very well liked by her fellow communal bank members because she’s very supportive of them.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy insecticides because she wants her fields to be pest free.

loans.use: She will buy insecticides.

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de San Blas se formó el 19 de diciembre de 2007. Con trabajo duro y dedicación ya están en el décimo ciclo de sesiones, conjunta y solidariamente en el programa. Además de su trabajo independiente, crean fondos para tener algo de capital dentro del grupo y ayudarse para alcanzar sus objetivos, trabajan arduamente para apoyar financieramente a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Juana González. Ella se dedica a traer mercadería a Clorinda. Vive sola y trabaja mucho. Ella es una mujer de escasos recursos, pero gracias al comité de crédito y sus socias cree que es capaz de mejorar considerablemente su negocio y su gestión. Ella dice que este préstamo podría mejorar sus ingresos y quiere usarlo para comprar frutas, verduras, pan y todo tipo de bebidas.
texts.en:
The women of the San Blas Committee formed their group on December 19, 2007. With hard work and dedication they are in their 10th loan cycle with this program. In addition to their independent work, they create funds to have a bit of capital within the group, and to help each other reach their objectives they work very hard to financially support their families. 

A very moving story is that of Sra. Juana Gonzalaez. She works bringing merchandise to Clorinda. She lives alone and works a lot. She is a woman who has scare resources, but thanks to the credit committee and her partners she believes she is capable of considerably improving her business and its manaagement. She tells us that this loan could help improve her income, and she wants to use it to purchase fruits, vegetables, bread, and vatious types of beverages.

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, tea, rice, beverages, starch, corn, flour, etc.

loans.name: Solidario Jireh Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Jireh: Este Grupo Esta Formado por tres señoras muy trabajadoras,La Señora Basti Astrid, se dedica a la venta de alimento y medicina para animales es un negocio que a hasta la fecha le a dejado un poco de ganacias pero solicita este credito para la compra de cocentrado para su veterinaria ya que quiere incrementar sus ventas para poder tener mas ganancias para ir creciendo en su negocio.
La Señora Maria Antonieta, se dedica a la crianza de animales ella nos cuenta que es un negocio que le a gustado porque ella cria los animales pollos,cerdos, desde pequeños y cuando estan grandes los vende su sueño es poder tener una granja mas grande para tener mejores ingresos solicita este credito para la compra de animales como pollos, cerdo para crianza y alimento para los mismos.
La señora Claudia Ester,tiene 40 años es casada tiene 3 hijos  se dedica a la venta de tortillas en los tres tiempos, y venta de productos medicinal
ella tiene ya tiempo de trabajar en este negocio,y se a trazado metas las cuales una de ellas es tener una tortilleria mas grande para poder distribuir en toda su comunidad donde vive,el credito que solicita es para la compra de maiz y contratar persona que le ayude,sus sueños es poder darñes a sus hijos la educacion nesesaria para que puedan ser unos profecionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Jireh Solidarity Group: This group has three, hard working members.  Basti Astrid sells feed and medicines for animals.  It’s a business that to date has produced a bit of profit but she’s asking for this loan to buy feed for her veterinary supply store to increase sales and earn more profits so that the business will grow.

María Antonieta raises animals.  She tells us that this is a business that she’s enjoyed because she raises chicks and piglets and when they are grown she sells them.  Her dream is to have a larger farm so that income will be higher.  She is asking for this loan to buy chick and pigs to raise and to buy feed for them.

Claudia Ester, 40, is married and has three children.  She sells tortillas in three shifts and also sells medical products. She has been in this business for some time now and one of the goals she has set out for herself is to have a larger tortilla shop in order to supply the entire community where she lives.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy corn and to hire a person to help her.  Her dream is to be able to provide her children with necessary education so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed, to buy animals to raise and to buy corn.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Ysabel posee una familia conformada por sus 5 hijos y su esposo, todos juntos comparten sus sueños D. salir adelante y tener un mejor futuro, gracias al trabajo arduo y L. dedicación, Ysabel apoyo a su esposo, generando ingresos extras para el sostén D. L. familia. Sus sueños es poder proveer a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, y darle una buena educación. Desea estar firme para seguir motivandoles a crecer. 

Ysabel opera el negocio D. ventas ambulantes, específicamente D. ropa, calzados e interiores. Este es su tercer prestamo en Esperanza Internacional, desD. que inicio hace casi dos años Ysabel ha podido invertir por medio D. los prestamos en su negocio, y ampliar clientes e inventario; sus planes al invertir este ultimo es D. poder comprar una buena variedad D. ropas, como faldas, pantalones, camisa, y algunos pares  D. calzado. 

ElL. pertenece al Grupo Mujeres Progresando 1 y 2, el cual posee 10 miembros y es coordinado por Ysabel. Viven en L. ciudad D. Samana, ciudad conocida por su turismo emergente, y ser un destino especial por su eco-turismo, D. muchos atractivos naturales, pero a L. ves con muchas necesidades y comunidades con pocos recursos y posibilidades D. sustitir.  Ysabel y su grupo gracias a los prestamos han podido dar un paso para mejorar sus vidas, las D. su familia y su comunidad. Les da las gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ysabel’s family is maD. up of her husband and five children.  They all share together the dream of getting ahead and having a better future.  Thanks to her hard work and dedication, Ysabel helps her husband by generating additional income to support the family.  Her dreams are to proviD. her children with everything they need and to give them a good education.  She wants to stay firm to continue motivating them to grow.

Ysabel is a street peddler especially of clothing, footwear and underwear.  This is her third loan with Esperanza Internacional.  Since she joined almost two years ago Ysabel has been able to invest in her business thanks to the loans expanding both her inventory and her customer base.  Her plans are to invest this latest loan to buy a good assortment of clothes like skirts, pants, shirts and a few pairs of shoes.

She is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando 1 y 2” (Women Progressing 1 & 2) group which has 10 members and is led by Ysabel.  They live in the city of Samana, a city known for its developing tourism and for being a special destination due to eco-tourism with many natural attractions, but which at the same time still has many needs and communities with very few resources and few means of support.  Ysabel and her group, thanks to the loans, have been able to take a step towards improving their own, their families’ and their community’s lives.  She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To buy skirts, jeans, shirts and polo shirts.

loans.name: Ikuá David Group

texts.en:
The Ikua David Group of San Ignacio, Misiones, is engaged in general trade. Mrs. Sonia G., for example, sells perfumes, toys and cleaning supplies, among other things. She is asking for a loan to expand her suite of products to better meet customer needs.

With this loan the group moves to the 2nd level, and they are very encouraged to work as a team. They want to continue working in a responsible and united way to reach higher levels of the program.

loans.use: Buying enamels, toys, school supplies, cleaning supplies, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Duo Sendero De Luz Group

texts.es:
DUO.  SENDERO DE LUZ
Rosa Marina C., de 54 años de edad, es una mujer viuda pero muy trabajadora porque ha salido adelante en su vida juntamente con sus tres hijos; ha logrado superar;  sus hijos tuvieron la educación necesario porque ha sido una madre responsable y ahora aun se esfuerza para sostener su negocio que es  venta de medicina natural el cual ha sido reconocido en el pueblo y todavía se esfuerza para hacerlo crecer; tiene su clientela pero el capital  no le es suficiente para incrementar sus ventas por lo que solicita un segundo crédito para comprar e invertir en la compra de mas producto de medicina natural su experiencia le ha hecho a recetar medicina para diferentes enfermedades y se caracteriza por los resultados y curaciones de sus pacientes su sueño es tener una farmacia y llena de medicina.

Negma  Janeth Coy;  tiene 30 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos pequeños que están estudiando por los que trabaja y persevera en su actividad que es la pintura su propia necesidad la obligo a diseñar bonitos cuadros por ahora sus pinturas son de cuadros pequeños y ha tenido pedido de cuadros grandes ella utiliza su creatividad para sus diseños y necesita de capital para comprar pintura para seguir pintando sus cuadros  por lo que pide a Fape un segundo crédito ella cuenta que con su primer crédito logro realizar dibujos de diferentes paisajes y sus cuadros se vendieron a buen precio lo que desea es comprar más pintura y combinar bien los colores para exhibiciones de sus cuadros y vender al extranjero para que a sus hijos no le falte nada y puedan seguir estudiando y seguir apoyando a su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa Marina C. is 54 years old.  She is widowed, but she is very hard-working, because she has succeeded in life with her three children.  Her children had the necessary education because she has been a responsible mother, and now she is working hard to maintain her natural medicine business.  It is recognized in the community and she still works hard to make it grow.  She has many customers, but she doesn't have enough money to increase her sales, so she is asking for a second loan to purchase more natural medicine products.  Her experience allows her to prescribe medicines for different illnesses.  She is known for her results and cures for her patients.  Her dream is to have a pharmacy full of medicines.

Negma Janeth Coy is 30 years old, married, and has two small children who are in school.  She works hard for them in her work, which is painting.  Her own necessity obligated her to design pretty pictures, but now her paintings are small and she has had orders for large paintings.  She uses her creativity in her designs.  She needs money to purchase paint in order to continue painting, so she has asked FAPE for a second loan.  She used her first loan to make drawings of different landscapes and her paintings sold for good prices.  She wants to purchase more paint and combine the colors well for exhibitions of her paintings and to sell them abroad so that her children have everything they need and they can continue studying and she can continue helping her husband.

loans.use: Purchase natural medicine

loans.name: Rudy Santiago

texts.es: El  Sr Pueto  labora como fontanero es casado tiene  tres persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. Pueto works as a plumber.  He is married and has three people he is in charge of.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and he is grateful for the support provided him by this institution -- the disbursement that will help him purchase construction materials like blocks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, bracket, wire, and labor to build a new room for his home.

loans.use: Home improvement and purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena forma parte del banco comunal “El único” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella compra y vende  calzados a pedido desde hace 2 años, trabajando directamente desde su casa y vende además en su lugar de trabajo dependiente, en un colegio, en donde ocupa un cargo administrativo. 
Cuando comenzó en el rubro del comercio, ella vendía empanadas y ropa, hace 6 años aproximadamente. Sin embargo la venta de calzados le ha brindado más ganancias. 
Con este préstamo comprará calzados, en la ciudad de Pucón, de esta manera tendrá más posibilidades de venta con el fin de obtener más ganancias. 
Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, quienes además le ayudan en su negocio durante la temporada de verano (enero – febrero), ya que tiene un puesto en la ciudad de Pucón, el cual atienden sus hijas de 19 y 12 años. Por su parte su esposo también la ayuda cuando tiene días libres en su trabajo, el se desempeña como chofer de locomoción colectiva.
El sueño de Ximena es tener un puesto en la ciudad de Talcahuano y de esta manera independizarse.
Su motivación para seguir con su negocio es costear los estudios superiores de su hija, ya que ella estudia en un instituto.
Para Ximena la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que se ha sentido acogida, debido al buen trato,  el compañerismo y  responsabilidad por parte de ellos.
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Bíobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en: Ximena is part of "El Unico" community bank in the city of Talcahuano. She has bought and sold footwear for the past two years, working directly out of her home. She also works on location at a school where she holds an administrative role. When she started out in commerce about six years ago, she was selling empanadas and clothing. However, selling shoes has brought in more profits. With the loan, she plans to purchase footwear in the city of Pucón, and in this way she will have more sales possibilities with the end goal of earning more income. Ximena lives with her husband and her two daughters, who help her with the business during the summertime (January and February). She has a sales post in Pucón, which her daughters, ages 19 and 12, tend to. Her husband also helps when he has free days from his work as a public transportation driver. Ximena's dream is to have a sales post in Talcahuano and in this way become more independent. Her motivation to continue with the business is to finance her daughter's higher education since she is studying at an institute. Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza has provided Ximena and her business a lot of support, and she has been touched by her good treatment, the friendship and the responsibility. Talcahuano is a commune and city-port in the region of Bíobío in the south of Chile. It is known as one of the main ports in the country. Its name in Mapuche means "thundering sky." It has a lot of natural beauty thanks to its combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows and mountains coupled with beautiful vegetation. Its economy revolves around its port, its naval base and an important industrial neighborhood with steel, oil refining, petrochemical, cement and gas companies.

loans.use: Footwear

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr Marco  labora como fontanero es casado tiene  tres persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre para hacer anexo  de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marco works as a plumber. He is married and has three dependents. This is his first loan that Kiva partner CEPRODEL has approved, and he is grateful for the support this institution provides. With the loan, he plans to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, supports and wire to make an addition to his home.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies to make an addition to his home

loans.name: Kuña Aty Porâ Group

texts.en:
The Committee "Kuña Aty Porâ" of San Antonio is from San Ignacio, Misiones. The members are engaged in the production and sale of agricultural products (vegetables in general). Besides credit, they are organized to hold fairs where they display their products. As a group, their desire reach the highest levels of the program is stronger.

Mrs. Norma C. sells fruits and vegetables in season. Her production needs more care and attention, since her sales provide the main income of her family. She hopes to prosper with the credit granted by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. She will buy more seeds, fertilizer and irrigation supplies.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer, irrigation supplies, seeds and sprayers.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chu Pop Abaj Group

texts.es: Doña Virginia I. D. 38 años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene cuatro hijos, dos niñas y dos niños, doña Virginia trata D. apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la Vender ropa, para niños y adultos con esa actividad ella  ha podido  mantener a su familia, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 7 años, doña Virginia necesita surtir su venta y tratar D. apoyar a su esposo, y así D. esa manera ella pueD. obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace más D.  ocho años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia, si no que también a las personas D. su aldea. Cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. camisolas y pantalonetas, pants, blusas, venta D. mercería, entre otros. Esperan que por medio del creditos que solicitan mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su condicon D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Virginia I. is 38 years old, married, and has four children – two daughters and two sons. She tries to support her family financially and prepare her children for a better future. Doña Virginia sells clothes for children and adults. She started her business more than seven years ago and it has enabled her to support her family. Doña Virginia needs to restock her business so that she can help her husband. This will enable her to generate more revenue. She has gathered together some friends and neighbors who she has known for more than eight years in order to form a group. Not only will this benefit her family, but it will help the residents of her neighborhood.

Each one of these ladies engages in different business activities such as selling fruit, raising animals, making clothes (shirts, shorts, trousers, and blouses), selling sewing supplies, etc. Through the loans they have requested, they hope to increase their incomes and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional operating capital for selling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build a bathroom

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es:
Oscar , es un joven de 24 años de edad , soltero,nacido en el departamento de Esteli.De oficio mecanico,inicio a la edad de 18 años en el negocio de la mecanico y que lo ha tenido  por tradicion pues su padre es mecanico tambien . El empezo a trabajar de lleno en un taller familiar motivado por buscar el progreso inicio con la ayuda de su  padre a luchar por sacar adelante su taller,asi mismo ha tenido la iniciativa como comerciante ya que tambien se dedica a la compra y venta de motocicletas.Su taller se encuentra ubicado en la parte central de Esteli donde mas afluencia de clientes hay .
El solicita el credito para capital de trabajo ,y que con esto podra mejorara sus ingresos atraves de la ventas de repuestos de motocicleta. Su meta es obtener un negocio propio , especializado en venta de repuestos nuevos de motocicletas ubicado en los puntos centrales de Esteli para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man who is 24 years of age.  He is single and was born in the Department of Esteli.  He is a mechanic by trade and started working in a repair shop at the age of 18.  Oscar follows in the tradition of his father, who also worked as a mechanic.  He began working in the family repair shop and was motivated to find success.  With the help of his father, Oscar was able to press forward to succeed in this trade.  At the same time, he is a merchant who buys and sells motorcycles.  The family repair shop is located in the central part of Esteli where there are many customers.  

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital.  This will help improve his earnings through the sale of motorcycle parts.  Oscar’s goal is to have his own business that specializes in the sales of new motorcycle parts and have it centrally located in Esteli so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: varios de carnes de compra como el pollo, cerdo y carne de vacuno

loans.name: Marisela Jacqueline

texts.es: La Sra Marisela labora como cajero es casada  tiene dos hijo a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le dan con  este  desembolso porque asi va a mejor su vivienda,para compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque ,hierro, cemento, arena, clavo, estribo para un cuarto en la vivienda y solventar deuda pendiente que tiene.
texts.en: Mariela works as a cashier.  She is married and has 2 dependent children.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL, and she is grateful for being given this loan because with it she is going to make improvements to her house.  She will purchase construction materials such as cement blocks, steel, cement, sand, nails and braces to add a room to her home and to pay off some outstanding debt that she has.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: El  Sr G.  labora como secretaria es acompañada tiene  dos persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción zinc, perlines bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para construir un porche en su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs. G. works as a secretary.  She lives with a partner and has 2 dependents.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL, and she is grateful for the opportunity that this institution is providing her.  With the funds from the loan she will buy construction materials such as metal roofing sheets, beams, cement blocks, cement, sand, steel, gravel, braces, wire and labor to add a porch to her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Francisco Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr B.  labora como responsable de bodega es acompañado  tiene dos personas  a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga,  este  desembolso lo necesita para compra de materiales  de construcción perlines, zinc y mano de obra para mejora de su vivienda
texts.en: Mr. B. runs a store.  He has a partner and 2 dependents.  This is the first loan that CEPRODEL has granted him; he needs the funds from this loan to buy construction materials such as beams, sheets of corrugated metal roofing, and labor to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una de nuestras pequenas empresarias, que ha reforzado su negocio con varios prestamos que ha tomado, en la actualidad esta recibiendo su 4 prestamos, despues de haber realizado sus pagos correctamente y haberlos invertido todos en su negocio, el cual inicio con una poca cantidad que puedo ahorrar hace unos 8 años aproximados, y luego decidio tomar su primer prestamo y formar su colmado. Los colmados en Republica Dominicana, son pequenas tiendas de alimentos y comestibles, que se establecen en los barrios o comunidades para que personas puedan comprar su alimentos.

Maria tiene 3 hijos y es una señora casa, pasa su día, atendiendo su negocio y cuidando de su familia. Piensa utilizar este prestamo para la compra de cosmeticos y productos miscelaneos para una mostrador que coloco y asi poder proveer a sus vecinos de estas mercancias.

Sus sueños es poder tener un negocio estable y sostenible. Le agradece a todos por su apoyo en su nombre y de su grupo. Gracias.
texts.en:
Maria is one of our small businesswomen who has strengthened her business through several loans that she has taken out with us.  She is currently receiving her fourth loan, having paid back her previous loans correctly and invested them all in her business.  She started her business with a small amount of money that she had saved up approximately 8 years ago.  She decided to request her first loan to set up her 'colmado'.  In the Dominican Republic, 'colmados' are small neighborhood or community stores that sell food products so that locals can buy their food there.

Maria is married and has 3 children.  She spends her days serving in her business and looking after her family.  She is planning to use this loan to buy cosmetics and miscellaneous products for a counter that she has set up so that she can supply her neighbors with these products too.

Maria's dream is to have a stable and sustainable business.  She would like to thank everybody for their support both on her own behalf and also on behalf of her group.  Thank you.

loans.use: To buy food products and other products

loans.name: Yuri Rolando

texts.es: Yuri Rolando tiene 40 años, su actividad es la de brindar el servicio de triciclo. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio,  inicio este medio de vida por una liquidación que había recibido fue así que empezó este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano pues existe competencia y siempre se preocupa por ofrecer un buen servicio a cada uno de sus clientes. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de asientos, pedales, cadenas, carpas y otras mejoras que quiere realizar. Sueña con comprar otro triciclo y así agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Yuri Rolando, 40, has a business providing cycle rickshaw (3-wheeled bike with attached cart) transportation services.  He has had this business for more than 7 years.  He started out in this line of work with severance pay that he had received, so in this way he was able to start the business.  He works with a lot of effort and dedication; each day he gets up early because there is a lot of competition and he is always concerned about providing good service to every one of his customers.  The reason for this loan is so that he can buy seats, pedals, chains, canopies, and other improvements that he wants to make.  He dreams of buying another cycle rickshaw, and in this way expanding his business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maridilia

texts.es: Maridilia es madre luchadora tiene 3 hijos y son independientes. La señora tiene como actividad una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Por lo que es aquí donde comenzó a vender poco a poco para aumentar su inventario. Ella tiene 5 años con este negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos le ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días.  El mayor  sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea parte de la competencia. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, galletas pan entre otros.
texts.en: Maridilia is a tenacious woman who has 3 children who are independent.  She has a grocery store that is located in her home.  This is where she started out selling, and gradually increased her inventory.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She has always struggled to provide for her children in spite of the difficulties they have faced, so that she can provide them with everything that they need.  She is very happy with the work that she does, because without it she would not have the means to eat every day.  Her main dream is to expand her business so that she can keep up with the competition.  This loan is to buy staple grains, candies, soft drinks, cookies, bread and other grocery items.

loans.use: working capital to buy groceries

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 52 years old and has six children, three of whom are working and three of whom are still school-aged. She has owned a restaurant in Ayacucho for two years now, and will be using her loan to buy supplies for food preparation such as rice and sugar. 

She used to sell grains at local markets and decided to open a restaurant to earn more profits. In the future she would like to improve and expand her restaurant, and perhaps move to a better location. 

Dina has been with FINCA Peru for four years now, and likes the savings, training, and overall business orientation that they proviD. to their members. She has been happy that she has been able to use her savings to help with her children's education.

loans.use: Restaurant supplies including rice and sugar

loans.name: La Union Es La Fuerza Group

texts.es: el grupo se llama "La Union Es La Fuerza", y se ubica en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes. La señora Maria G. L. es una de las integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes que inicio hace siete años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercancía con el cual poder ofrecer una gran variedad de productos un mejor servicio, ella quiere realizar mejor su trabajo y no quedar mal con sus clientes. Tiene 29 años, estudió hasta el 3 año de secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos varones. Sus clientes opinan que tiene un buen servicio pues el lugar es centrico y siempre encuentran lo que buscan. Además de contar con un horario accesible, ya que cierra tarde y las demás tiendas cierran temparno. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a seguir invirtiendo y va a poder ampliar su negocio para cumplir con las espectativas de sus clientes. La señora María espera que su negocio crezca y para seguir apoyando economicamente a su familia. Ella desea que sus hijos sean profesionistas.
texts.en: This group is called "Union is Strength," and it is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico. The group consists of 9 members. Señora Maria G is one of the members of the group. She sells groceries, a business that she began 7 years ago. She is applying for the loan to purchase merchandise, so that she can offer a greater variety of products and better service. She wants to improve her work and not give her customers a bad impression. She is 29 years old. She went to secondary school up to the third year. She is married and has three sons. Her customers feel that she has good service, since her store is centrally located and they always find what they need. In addition, she has an accessible schedule, since she closes late and the other stores close early. At the time of applying for this loan, she felt happy because she was going to continue investing in her business and  would be able to increase it to meet the expectations of her customers. Señora Maria hopes that her business will grow and continue to support her family economically. She wants her sons to have careers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: German Francisco

texts.es: Germán tiene 64 años su negocio es brindar el servicio de taxi. Desde hace mas de 10 años que tiene este negocio, siempre esta ofreciendo un buen servicio, esta no es la primera vez que solicita crédito por lo que con la experiencia que ha obtenido le ha brindado nuevos clientes entre otras cosas. Su trabajo inicia desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues es muy peligroso trabajar a horas más noche la edad y parte de su enfermedad tampoco se lo permiten. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de  llantas, focos entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Germán is 64 years old and has a business providing taxi services. He has been in this line of work for more than ten years and always provides good service. This is not the first time he has requested a loan since his previous credit experiences helped him obtain new customers, among other things.

Germán begins work at 5am and continue to 9pm. It can be dangerous to work at night because his age and illness will not allow him to do so. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tires, headlights, and other necessities.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase tires, headlights, and other necessities

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.en:
The Committee Mujeres Alegres from San Ignacio, Misiones, is dedicated to raising chickens. With this 2nd level loan, they expect to be working together and helping one another to improve their quality of life and their families.

Mrs. Carolina A. is undertaking the business of raising chickens, so credit needs to be available to provide all the necessary supplies, such as food for the chicks and materials to build the corral. She wants to progress and get her family out of poverty.

loans.use: Buying chicks, chicken feed and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Duo Las Iluciones Group

texts.es:
Duo Las Iluciones: Maria Elena:ella tiene 40 años es viuda tiene un hijo de 16 años quien es quien la apoya ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural,tiene 3 años de tener ese negocio y ahora solicita este credito, para poder comprar medicina natural, ya que pues tiene muchos clientes y tiene demaciada demanda de ellos 
La deñora Maria Filomena: ella tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos pequeños solo uno ya esta en epoca escolar ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 3 años ella nececita su credito para poder comprar mas medicina ya que pues en su comunidad ella es muy conocida por su efectividad en los pacientes, entonces quiere surtir mas su venta ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Duo Las Iluciones” (The Illusions Duo)

Maria Elena is a 40 year old widow and has a 16 year old son who she supports through the sale of natural medicines. She has been in this business for three years and is now requesting a loan so that she can buy more natural medicines since she has many customers and significant demand.

Sra. Maria Filomena is 32 years old and married. She has two small children, but only one of them is in school. Maria Filomena has been selling natural medicines for three years and needs a loan to buy more of them. These products are well-known in her community for its effectiveness on patients. She needs more inventory for her business since there is great demand among her customers.

loans.use: Purchase natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.en:
Ms. Stanislaa owns a store in the San Salvador suburb of San Ignacio town. Her store is known for its good service. She is married with grown children, and has worked for years in her business.

She opted for the loan with Fundación Paraguaya to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to provide customers a greater variety of products. She welcomes working with Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support of the development and growth of her business.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy wood

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 56 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos Freddy de 22 y Flor de 12 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Juana ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos de papa, maíz y arveja, gracias a todo su esfuerzo, sus cultivos son de los mejores de su poblado, motivo por el cual cuando los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que el trabajo que realizó meses atrás dio sus frutos. Lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos. En adelante, espera incrementar la cantidad que produce actualmente, para eso desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juana, age 56, is a modest hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her two beloved children, Freddy (age 22) and Flor (age 12), for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Juana works hard so that her crops of potatoes, corn, and peas can thrive. Thanks to all of her efforts, Juana’s crops are the best in her village. This explains why she quickly sells out of her products when she brings them to the city of Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her crops because she sees the fruit of her labor after many months. Going forward, Juana wants to buy more land so that she can increase the quantity that she currently produces.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Juana knows that the support she receives will help advance and develop her business. For this reason, she is willing to submit all of her payments on time. In her Communal Bank, Juana is well-liked because she is a very responsible member. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Les Vaillants De Romeo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Vaillants de Romeo 1, 2 & 3.

Il est marié et il a 7 enfants.

Emmanuel habite dans la ville de Romeo d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Emmanuel a dirigé son boulangerie pendant les dernières 8 années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Emmanuel etait cultivateur.

Emmanuel voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du farine.

Emmanuel espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son boulangerie.

Des autres membres de Les Vaillants ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces coM. vendre du charbon, du riz et du bœufs.

Emmanuel dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant.

Emmanuel dit que son buts principal est l’augmentation du boulangerie. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les materiels coM. farine.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is the coordinator for his group "Les Vaillants de Romeo 1, 2 & 3". He is married and has seven children. He lives in the town of Romeo in Haiti where electricity is rare and drinking water is very limited. 

Emmanuel has run his bakery for the last eight years. Before beginning this business, he was a farmer. He would like to use this loan to invest in purchasing flour. He hopes the loan will help him to expand his bakery. 

Other members of "Les Vaillants" (The Valiant) need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, rice, and cattle. Emmanuel says his greatest challenge is lacking regular buyers. He says his chief goal is expanding his bakery. His dream is to buy a truck to transport materials such as flour.

loans.use: buying wheat flour

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 24 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El taller de mecánica donde trabaja Luis es uno de los más solicitados en la ciudad de La Oroya, ya que los autos salen muy bien reparados después de los rigurosos arreglos que les brinda. Desde muy joven aprendió esta labor, puesto que ha trabajado en muchos talleres anteriormente, lo cual ha hecho que sea muy hábil reparando autos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dejar los carros como nuevos, ya que se esmera mucho en repararlos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados repuestos que tiene que colocar a algunos carros. En adelante, espera abrir su propio taller con el cual pueda mejorar los ingresos que actualmente tiene. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que será responsable en  pagar a tiempo sus cuotas y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más créditos. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos repuestos para arreglar mejor los autos.
texts.en:
Luis, age 24, is a friendly hardworking young man. He lives in a rented house and what he wants most is to succeed in life. The mechanic’s shop where Luis works is one of the busiest in the city of La Oroya because this establishment does a good job of repairing vehicles as a result of the rigorous service provided. Luis learned this line of work from a young age and previously worked at several other shops where he gained plenty of experience fixing cars. He has been working as a mechanic for four years and considers the most difficult part to be lifting the heavy parts that he must install in some cars. Going forward, he wants to open his own repair shop so that he can generate more income.

This is his seventh loan with MFP. Luis says that he will be responsible in submitting his payments on time and without delays because he wants to be eligible to access more loans. With the loan of 3000 PEN that he requested, Luis will buy new auto parts so that he can do a better job making repairs.

loans.use: Purchase new auto parts

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Donald  ,de 31 años de edad,soltero, nacido en la ciudad de Esteli.Con 4 años de experiencia en venta de accesorios de celulares , inicio con 300 dolares por cuenta propia sin el apoyo de nadie.En busca de una vida mejor fue a trabajar a una zona franca en la capital Managua,pero no tuvo suerte y no logro progresar economicamente como el esperaba, tomo la decision de trabajar en un negocio propio e inicio con la venta de celulares antes de iniciar  este negocio se dedicaba a la venta de discos , pero vio que era mejor la venta de accesorios celulares ya que ademas conocia muy bien a los proveedores en el mercado oriental en la ciudad de Managua.
Solicita el prestamo para invertirlo para capital de trabajo ya que por medio de ello podra comprar mas accesorios y lentes , variar su mercaderia asi ofrecer mejores productos e incrementar sus ganancia.
Dentro de sus planes fututos esta instalar un local en la calle central donde puede tenerlo lleno de sus productos y asi atraer mas clientes y poderse mantenerse asi mismo con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Donald J. is 31 years old, single, and was born in the city of Esteli.  He has four years of experience selling mobile phone accessories.  Donald started with 300 dollars of his own money and without the support of anyone else.  In search of a better life, he began working in the free trade zone in the capital of Managua.  He did not have any luck and was not able to achieve the financial progress that he had hoped.  Donald then made the decision to work in his own business.  Prior to selling mobile phones, he started his business by selling records.  However, he discovered that selling mobile phone accessories would be better since he already had good relationships with the distributors at the eastern market in the city of Managua.  

Donald is requesting a loan to be used as operating capital so that he can buy more accessories and lenses.  By varying his merchandise, he will be able to offer better products and increase his earnings.  His future plans include establishing a shop along the central street and stocking it with his products so that he can attract more customers, support himself, and obtain better living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase mobile phone accessories & lenses

loans.name: Duo Vicion De Fe Group

texts.es:
Duo Vision de Fe:Eulalia P.: tiene 33 años tiene 3 hijos pequeños y con el apoyo de su esposo mantiene su negocio ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para veve,como baberos, colchas,camisas pantaloncitos,etc tambien ella destribuye en el mercado de su localidad y a otros lugares sercanos, su credito lo nececita para comprar materia prima.para poder elavorar su productos y asi poder destribuirlos.
Elica Marleni: ella tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos actual mente ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos su credito lo nececita para comprar un poco mas de mas producto en cosmeticos ya que se aserca el dia del cariño y es cuando vende su producto asi incrementar su ganancia para sostenimiento de su familia
texts.en:
Duo Vision de Fe (Vision of Faith Duo)

Eulalia P. is 33 years old and has three small children. She has the support of her husband. Eulalia sells baby clothes such as bibs, blankets, shirts, pants, and other items. She also sells at the local market and other nearby places. Her loan will be used to buy merchandise so that she can increase her inventory for distribution.

Elica Marleni is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She currently sells cosmetics. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetic products since Valentine’s Day is approaching. The sales of her products increase during this time. Her earnings are used to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 56 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dionisia de 56 años y su querido hijo Edgar de 8 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con muchas ganas de trabajar Manuel sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente sembríos de papa, arveja y maíz, productos que son rápidamente comprados en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigarlas, para evitar que la plaga de insectos dañe sus plantaciones, además por que es malo para la salud.  En adelante, espera que su producción mejore, ya que de eso dependen sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan más.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 56, is a friendly hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his wife Dionisia (age 56) and beloved son Edgar (age 8) for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. With great enthusiasm for his work, Manuel goes out every day to cultivate his fields. He grow mainly potatoes, peas, and corn, products that sell quickly at the market in the city of Tarma. His crops are of high quality. What he enjoys most about his work is cultivating the land. Manuel has been farming for 31 years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigation in order to prevent insects from damaging his plants. The chemicals can be bad for his health. Going forward, Manuel hopes to improve his production since he must rely on it for his income.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Manuel is very happy to obtain these funds and willing to submit all of his payments on time. He is well-liked in his Communal Bank. The loan of 1300 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more compost for his fields since he wants to produce more.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 29 años, es una mujer muy amistosa y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eduardo de 35 años y su hija Daisy de 4 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Junto a su esposo, Marleni trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. En adelante esta dispuesta a ahorrar lo necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, lo invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en: Marleni is a friendly 29 year old woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, Eduardo, who is 35 years old, and their 4 year-old daughter, Daisy, who is the main reason for all of their hard work.  Alongside her spouse, Marleni works every day on her cultivations.  With a lot of dedication, she has successfully made her land very productive and now grows numerous plants on it.  Mainly she grows peas, since it sells very well at the market.  What she loves most about her work is taking care of her plants from the pests that can affect them.  She has spent over 10 years in this field and feels that the most difficult aspect of it is transporting her crops to the large Tarma Market.  That is where she sells her products.  In the future, she is hoping to save to be able to have a stand at this market, since she currently just sells on the street.  This is her 8th credit with MFP and she believes that this credit will help her a lot in the development of her business.  She is a member of her communal bank, of which she feels very proud of.  With the 500 soles that she is asking for, she will invest it in improving her cultivations by buying fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.use: Purchase more sacks of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Santiago Bladimir

texts.es: Santiago Bladimir tiene 32 años, su actividad es el servicio de moto. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este medio de vida. Inicio por cuenta propia, siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de su negocio tiene un hijo de solamente un año de edad él se preocupa por proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios. Santiago tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para lograr obtener ganancias necesarias para su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de diferentes repuestos para su unidad.
texts.en: Santiago Bladimir is 32 years old.  His source of income is his moto-taxi service.  He has been earning his living this way for over 9 years.  He began it with his own money, having always been a fighter and enjoying his work.  He has a one year old son, which is why he worries about making enough money.  Santiago wakes up very early every day in order to be able to earn enough money to cover his household's costs.  This loan is for the purchase of different parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: Purchase parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Angel Andres

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
