Don Ángel es socio  fundador del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene  tres hijos, el mayor este año termina el colegio y los otros están en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Se dedica a la compra y  venta de pescado, el se desplaza en su carro todos los días con la ayuda de otra persona a la cual le paga un sueldo semanal, ellos desde la madrugada van a las playas de Salango y Crucita a comprar el pescado para llevarlo a entregar a Santo Domingo, Chone, Portoviejo y otras ciudades. El entrega a comerciantes al por mayor en esas ciudades.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para llevarlas a vender a esas ciudades. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que su negocio mejore dia a dia.
texts.en: In the city of Charapoto, the Communal Bank Virgen de Monserrate meets every fifteen days.  This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being within minutes of two of the best beaches of the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Don Angel is a founding member of this communal bank and likes it because of the low interest rates in comparison to other credit institutions.  He is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  The eldest finishes school this year and the other are still in school.  His wife is a housewife.  He works in the purchase and sale of fish.  He goes every day, with the help of another person who he pays a weekly salary, to Salango and Crucita Beach at day break to purchase fish that he then delivers to Santo Domingo, Chone, Portoviejo, and other cities.  He sells them to wholesale buyers in these cities.  This credit is to be able to purchase more fish to take to these cities.  His dream is to continue working so that his business can improve daily.

loans.use: Purchase fish.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Rosa, de 36 años, es una mujer muy sincera y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Olo de 46 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Yesenia de 13 y Jonatan de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Rosa sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos son: papa, maíz y arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar a sus plantaciones. Para el futuro desea comprar más tierras para sembrar más café. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en: Rosa, of 36 years old, is a very sincere and simple woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, Olo, of 46 years old and their two lovely children, Yesenia of 13 and Jonatan of 5 years old.  They wish to give them a better quality of life.  Every day, Rosa gets up very early in the morning to go work on her fields.  For her, there are no rest days since she needs to work continuously on her plot of land in order to maintain a good cultivation.  Her main crops are: potatoes, corn, and peas, all of which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma.  What she likes most about her job is the liberty that she has on working on her cultivations.  She has been doing this for over 13 years and believes that the most difficult part is keeping pests away from her plants.  For the future, she wishes to purchase more land in order to be able to grow coffee.  This is her 8th credit with MFP and she plans to be very punctual with her payments.  She is greatly liked by the other members of her communal bank because she is a very happy person.  With this loan of 2,500 soles, she will purchase more fertilizer in order to make her plot of land more productive.

loans.use: Purchase more sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria Gloria C.: D. 31 años tiene 4 hijos trabaja todos los dias vendiendo cortes tipicos, joyas, para asi ayudar con sus ganancias a su familia, ya que sus hijos estan en epoca escolar, ella dice que los quiere ver que sean personas D. bien para satisfaccion D. su familia,solicita el credito para compra D. ropa tipica por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias, su sueño es poder tener un lugar o local donD. vender su mercaderia y ya no vender ambulantemente ella D. da Gracias a dios porque tiene mucha clientela y espera ir creciendo mas cada dia.
texts.en: Maria Gloria C., 31 years old, has 4 children.  She works every day selling typical clothing and jewelry in order to help with her family's income now that her children are school-age.  She says that she wants to see them be good people.  For the satisfaction of her family, she asks for a loan to buy traditional clothing in bulk and thereby increase her income.  Her dream is to have a store or other place to sell her merchandise and not have to sell door-to-door anymore.  She gives thanks to God because she has a lot of customers and expects to continue growing more every day.

loans.use: Buy traditional clothing in bulk

loans.name: Karina Aura

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora  Karina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de  15, 7 y 4 años que estudian en colegio, en  escuela y en  jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.

De lunes a viernes trabaja en quehaceres domésticos y los sabados y domingos instala en su casa un pequeño restaurante en el cual prepara deliciosos platos para los clientes que llegan hasta su local, en las mañanas prepara el delicioso encebollado y en las tardes almuerzos y meriendas con una variedad de platos, nos cuenta que solo abre en estos días por que es cuando más personas pasan por el lugar y que esto le deja buenos ingresos extra.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para preparar  sus deliciosos platos. Sus sueños son que sus hijas tengan una buena educación y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Virgen De Monserrate community bank meets every fortnight in the city of Charapoto. This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Karina is a founding member of the community bank and likes the ease with which one can obtain a loan. She is 33 years old, married and has three daughters of 15, 7 and 4 years studying in high school, primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a merchant.

From Monday through Friday she is busy with housework and on Saturday and Sunday she has set up a small restaurant in her home that serves delicious dishes to customers. In the morning she prepares delectable encellobados (a typical Ecuadorian breakfast preparation) and in the evening a variety of snacks and dishes. She tells us that she only opens on weekends because that is when most people pass by and this brings her good additional income.

This loan will be used to buy items to prepare her delicious dishes. Her dream is that her daughters receive a good education and become professionals.

loans.use: Buy general produce

loans.name: Verónica Violeta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Verónica, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 4 y de un año y nueve meses, el mayor estudia en  escuela. El marido es comerciante de pescado.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa  que realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo  el mismo que se  dedica a la compra y  venta de pescado, el se desplaza junto con otras personas todos los días desde la madrugada  a las playas cercanas a comprar sus productos que luego los lleva a otras ciudades a entregar  a comerciantes, el trabaja desde las 4h00 hasta las 12h00 que regresa después de cobrar.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para que su esposo los lleve para  la venta diaria. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace seis ciclos y se  desempeña como fiscal de pagos  del banco, le gusta porque los créditos salen sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener su propio carro para que su esposo realice sus ventas solo y así tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Monserrate communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being located just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

We find Verónica, 25, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has three children who are 9, 4 and a year and nine months of age; the oldest is in school.  Her husband is a fish merchant.

She is a great housewife who is taking out a loan for her husband’s business, which consists in buying and selling fish.  He, along with other people, goes out at dawn every day to nearby beaches to buy the products that he then takes to deliver to merchants in other cities.  He works from 4am until noon and returns after collecting payments.

This loan is to buy fish for her husband’s daily sales.  She’s been in the communal bank since it’s beginning six cycles ago and she acts as the Financial Overseer of the bank’s payments.  She likes it because the loans are approved without so many requirements.  Her dreams are to have her own vehicle so that her husband can carry out his sales alone thus having higher profits.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en: Agripina is 60 years old. She has one son and 9 grandchildren. She sells "chicha" a popular Peruvian drink made from maize, at the Mercado Playa Grau in Ayacucho. She is using her current loan of 1,050 soles to buy the raw ingredients to make chicha - sugar, maize, firewood and plastic bags to serve it in. Agripina has been with FINCA Peru for over 4 years now and enjoys the saving opportunities that they offer. She hopes to one day expand her business and open a stand in the market, selling spices and condiments.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize, firewood and containers

loans.name: Deisi Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a Deisy, tiene 20 años de edad y  es madre soltera de  un niño de 3 años y seis meses, ella y su hijo viven en la casa de sus padres en la cual viven siete personas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y se desempeña como tesorera del mismo  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a personas como ella para obtener los créditos y sacar sus negocios adelante.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogos de las marcas Nivi y Gogos, por la calidad nos cuenta que ella prefiere vender de estas marcas ya que a sus clientes les gusta mucho sus productos, trabaja todos los días por horas, deja a crédito y cobra cada dia domingo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta a través de pedidos los mismos que entrega después de una semana, nos cuenta que lleva en este tipo de negocio por seis meses y que empezó con el crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de catalogo, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, entre otros. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the "Virgen De Monserrate" communal bank meets every 15 days. The city is known for its traditional culture and also for being located just a few minutes from the best beaches in the province, at San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Deisy. She is 20 years of age and is the single mother of a three-and-a-half year old boy. She and her son live in her parents' house: in total seven people live there. She has been part of the communal bank since it started, and acts as its treasurer. She likes it because it helps people like her to access credit and take their businesses forward.

Deisy sells clothes through catalogues, from brands called "Nivi" and "Gogos". She says that these are her preferred brands because of their quality, and her customers like the products very much. She works for hours every day, leaving credit and receiving payments every Sunday. The work involves selling door-to-door, going backk a week later to deliver the orders. She has been doing this type of work for six months, having started it with credit she received from this organisation [the field partner].

This loan is to buy clothes from the catalogue: trousers, t-shirts, and blouses among other things. Her dream is to own a clothing boutique.

loans.use: To buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses etc

loans.name: Dayanara Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Dayanara, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una linda  hija de un año. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una buena ama de casa  que realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo  el mismo que se  dedica a la compra y  venta de palomas caseras, el se desplaza dos veces a la semana hasta Santo Domingo para ir a vender sus animalitos ya que en esa ciudad estos los compran a muy buen precio, incluso a veces lleva por encargo, nos cuenta que a pesar que no es un trabajo muy habitual le deja buenas ganancias que les permiten tener una vida decente.

Este crédito es para comprar palomas para que su esposo las lleve a Santo Domingo para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace seis ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos salen sin tantos papeles y sin inconvenientes. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the "Virgen De Monserrate" communal bank meets every 15 days. The city is known for its traditional culture and also for being located just a few minutes from the best beaches in the province, at San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Señora Dayanara. She is 19 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has a beautiful little girl, who is one year old. Her partner works as a trader. Dayanara is a good housewife, and is seekinng the loan to invest in her partner's business. He buys and sells domestic pigeons, travelling twice a week to sell the birds in Santo Domingo, where he can get a very good price. Sometimes he also couriers things for people there. She says that although it is not a very regular job, it provides them with good earnings that enable a devent standard of living. 

This loan is to buy pigeons for her husband to take to sell in Santo Domingo. She has been part of the communal bank for six loan cycles, and she likes it because the credit comes without much paperwork and inconvenience. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy pigeons

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 30 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abelardo de 32 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Anthony de 9 y Verónica de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los verdes campos del poblado de Cumutay (Distrito de la provincia de Tarma), han sido en la vida de Yolanda, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar arvejas y choclos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 30, is a kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Abelardo, 32, and her two beloved children, Anthony, 9 and Verónica, 11, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

The green fields of the Cumutay settlement (district of Tarma province) have been Luzmila’s life; a very pleasant place to work.  Since very young, her parents taught her this work and now she owns her own fields that she cultivates with much dedication and sacrifice. 

What she most enjoys about the work is cultivating peas and corn.  She’s been in this line of work for 12 years and considers transporting her crops to the Tarma market which is where she sells them to be the most difficult part of it.  In time, she hopes to set up a small stand in the market because she feels that she loses a lot selling at wholesale.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She knows that she has the responsibility to repay on time and is willing to do so.  She is always very aware of all the agreements reached in her communal bank.

She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy pea seeds since this legume is selling very well in the market.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, D. 65 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Julio D. 30 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Zenovia trata D. cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su hijo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en el mercado central D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras D. la plaga D. insectos, lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donD. los venD., ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará sacos D. semillas D. arveja, en lo cual invertirá todo el dinero.
texts.en:
Zenovia, age 65, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home with her beloved son Julio, age 30, for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life. Zenovia works hard every day on her crops so that she can change her current standard of living. Together with her son she grows beans, corn, and gladiolas each season and sells them at the central market in Tarma, where she is able to obtain the best prices. What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from insects. Zenovia has been farming for 45 years and considers the most difficult part to be hauling her crops to the markets where she sells since the sacks are very heavy. Going forward, she hopes to improve her products so that she can obtain better prices.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels this loan will be a benefit to her growth as a farmer. In her Communal Bank, Zenovia is a very active and supportive member. With a loan of 800 PEN, she will buy sacks of seeds for planting peas.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Tatiana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tatiana, ella tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una niña de cinco años de edad la misma que este año empieza su primer año de estudio. Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Lebel y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos, lleva un año que se dedica a esta actividad y dice que le va bien en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa por catalogo. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Communal Bank “Virgen De Monserrate” meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture. In addition, the city is located a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

It is here one can find Sra. Tatiana. She is 23 years old, married, and has a five year old daughter who just started her first year of school. Her husband works as a mason.

Tatiana is a housewife who earns her own income by selling clothes through a catalog. She also sells products made by Lebel and Sayson (brands of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Tatiana works on the weekends, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week. These products are shipped to her home and she acquires clothing at a distribution center. The products she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics. Tatiana has been in this business for one year and says that she has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing by catalog. Tatiana is in her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the fact the payments have been easy to make. Her dreams include having a larger business.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Cuando el esposo D. la Sra. Rogelia quedo sin trabajo ella vio la necesidad D. apoyarlo y la mejor manera D. hacerlo fue empezar a ahorrar para poner un negocio su mama le ofreció un kiosco que tenia ahí empezó con la venta D. ropa  compro varias prendas  que empezó a ofrecer  ala gente que pasaba por el lugar así D. a pocos fue aumentando su capital  ahora es conocida y muchas personas le hacen pedidos  también les da a sus clientes facilidades D. pago D. esa manera gana mas clientes ahora quiere incursionar en
 la venta D. sandalias en esta época D. verano  hay mucha demanda D. ese producto justamente es para eso que usara el préstamo D. EDAPROSPO,  también esta próxima a trasladar su negocio a su propia casa para lo cual esta acondicionando un local apropiado.Como parte del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO”  esta logrando muchas cosas y eso la hace sentir bien y con ganas D. seguir trabajando.

* Rogelia es la primera D. las sentadas con polo naranja.
texts.en:
When her husband lost his job, Sra. Rogelia saw the need to help him. The best way was to begin saving so that she could start a business. Her mother gave her a kiosk where she could start selling clothes. Rogelia bought various garments and began offering them to people who passed by her establishment. Her capital gradually increased and now she is well-known. Many customers place orders with her, and since she offers payment options, she has been able to gain even more customers.

Rogelia now wants to venture into selling sandals for the summer season since there is great demand for these products. It is precisely for this purpose which she will use her loan from EDAPROSPO. In addition, she plans to move her business to her home since it is equipped to house a store. As a member of the group “Mujeres Rumbo al Progreso” (Women Toward Progress), Rogelia has accomplished many things and feels good about being able to continue working.

*Rogelia is the first woman seated wearing an orange polo shirt.

loans.use: Purchase sandals for summer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de llamadas telefónicas locales y nacionales, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio la socia se siente feliz ya que mediante esta actividad ella puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que ella trabaja de forma ambulatoria e independiente, la socia es una persona alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevos equipos de celulares para asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Ana has a business in which people can make local and national phone calls. She is happy to be engaging in this business because it enables her to spend more time with her children. Ana works as an independent street vendor. She is a cheerful person who has tremendous desire to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new mobile phone equipment so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Ana is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: Purchase new mobile phone equipment for her business

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 65 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, ella ofrece todo tipo de productos varios como calzado, ropa, cosméticos y medicina natural. Ella se levanta temprano pues tiene que montarse en varios buses para ofrecer sus medicamentos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra variedad de medicamentos, pues tiene ciertos pedidos. Sueña con incrementar su inventario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 65 years old and sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for more than seven years. Candida offers all types of products such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and natural medicine. She wakes up early so that she can board different buses for delivering medicines.

Candida is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of medicines since she has outstanding orders. Her dream is to increase the inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase natural medicines so that she can fulfill her orders

loans.name: Silvana Carla

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a Silvana, tiene 25 años de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres, en su casa viven tres personas. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres  ciclos,  y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido solventar sus gastos y sus estudios ya que actualmente está estudiando en colegio.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos de Avon y  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el dia y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya que ella visita a sus clientes  para mostrarles  sus productos y las revistas para que ellos decidan que comprar, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes.  Lo que es ropa los compra en Guayaquil y los otros  productos los recibe en su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de ropa,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son graduarse y seguir en sus estudios hasta terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Communal Bank “Virgen De Monserrate” meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture. In addition, the city is located a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

It is here one can find Silvana. She is 25 years old and lives at the home of her parents. There are three people who live at her house. Silvana has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the fact that the loans have helped her cover her expenses and her studies. She currently attends college.

Silvana is a merchant who sells clothing and products made by Avon and Yanbal (brands of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Silvana works almost all day on the weekends. She sells by going door-to-door and visiting her customers in order to demonstrate her products and present them with catalogs so that they can decide what to buy. Her products are offered on credit and she collects payments weekly or every fifteen days depending on how her customers decide to pay. She buys the clothing in Guayaquil and the other products are shipped to her home.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other products. Her dreams include continuing her studies so that she can finish her college degree and graduate.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other products

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raúl; el tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de productos secos como  maíz para luego revenderlo a sus clientes que tiene en el mismo Calca a veces el socio viaja por todo el valle sagrado ofreciendo sus productos pero tiene más clientes en Calca, el socio a la vez trabaja como maestro de construcción en las diferentes obras que se realizan y  requieren sus servicios de esta forma el socio saca  a su familia adelante siendo estas sus dos únicas actividades que realiza por el momento. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos secos para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta III”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Raúl divides his time between his daily activities and his business of buying dry goods such as corn for later resale to his customers in Calca. He travels all over the Sacred Valley to offer his products, but most of his customers are in Calca. Raúl also works as a master builder on different construction jobs that need to be completed and require his services. He engages in these two business activities at the moment so that his family can get ahead. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more dried products for his business.

Raúl is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of his payments.

loans.use: Purchase dried goods

loans.name: Casimera

texts.es: Casimera, es una dulce mujer de 54 años. Enviudo hace 10 años, pero a pesar de ello cuidó de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. Las trabajadoras manos de Casimera, sostienen el pellejo de un cordero, con el cual se pueden hacer tapices, e incluso lo utilizan para sacar lana muy gruesa, que sirve para abrigarse del frío que asota en la zona alta del Perú. Asimismo las 4 vacas que posee, le sirven para poder sacar leche y elaborar queso.  Ella conserva aún el espíritu trabajador, de todo aquel que vive en el campo. Ya tiene 30 años dedicándose a la agricultura, sus cultivos constan de lechuga, papa, maíz y arveja, productos que cuidan con mucho esmero, salvando sus sembríos de la plaga y fertilizándolos constantemente. Sus proyectos en adelante es sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues le agrada su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP,  donde siente el apoyo incondicional de los integrantes de su asociación. Casimera, muy pronto cosechará sus cultivos de maíz o llamado también “choclo”. Por ello con el crédito está pensando invertir en la compra de semillas de lechuga y espinaca, los cuales esparcirá después de esta cosecha.
texts.en:
Casimera is a sweet woman who is 54 years old. Despite becoming a widow ten years ago, she has been able to take care of her six children. Two of her children live in their own homes in the village of Pongo. The hardworking hands of Casimera make rugs out of sheep skins. Even the coarsest wool can be used to protect oneself from the frigid cold that invades the upper area of Peru. Casimera has four cows from which she is able to get milk for making cheese. She maintains a working spirit that is possessed by everyone who lives in the area. Casimera has been farming for thirty years. Her crops consist of lettuce, potatoes, corn, and peas. She looks after her crops with great care, protects them from pests, and fertilizes them constantly. Her plans going forward include increasing her plantings because she enjoys her work.

Casimera is a member of the Communal Bank “Paraíso al Progress” (Paradise to Progress) and receiving her third loan from MFP. She receives unconditional support from the other members of the association. Casimera will soon harvest her crop of corn, a variety called “choclo”. Her loan will be invested in the purchase seeds for growing lettuce and spinach which she will plant after this harvest.

loans.use: Purchase lettuce & spinach seeds

loans.name: Graciela Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores ,ella vende diferentes clases de flores en el mercado de calca también trabaja a pedido cuando le solicitan como arreglos florales para todo tipo de compromisos  como graduaciones, cumpleaños entre otros más la socia realiza esta actividad desde su casa en conjunto con su pareja que a veces le ayuda ,la socia está feliz con este su negocio ya que mediante este ella puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos y su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de flores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta III”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Graciela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling flowers. She sells different types of flowers at the market in Calca. Graciela also works based on orders whenever her customers request floral arrangements for all types of special occasions such as graduations, birthdays, and other events. She performs her work at home along with her partner who helps out occasionally. Graciela is happy with her business since it enables her to spend more time with her children and family. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business of selling flowers.

Graciela is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her floral business

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 33 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otro tipos de productos más su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, la socia a la vez trabaja en un wawawasi (lugar donde se quedan los niños mientras sus papas trabajan guardería) ella trabaja de lunes a viernes por las mañanas y en las tardes se encarga de su tienda de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Grimaldina belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta III”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Grimaldina divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and many other items. She works Monday through Friday in the mornings at a day care center where parents leave their children while at work. In the afternoons, Grimaldina manages her store so that her family can get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for her grocery store so that she can have a wider variety to offer to her customers.

Grimaldina is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and has six children. Four of her children are working and two are still studying. She has one granddaughter. She prepares dishes in her house where she has a small restaurant. She makes Mondongo (a local soup), Puca (an Ayacuchan dish made with beets, potatoes and peanuts) and chica morada (a local drink made from maize). 

She plans to use her loan of 1,500 PEN to buy firewood, maize, and meat for food preparation. Victoria has been with FINCA Peru for 10 years and really appreciates the help they provide her with her business and other training. With FINCA's help she has been able to educate all of her children. Victoria also works as a teaching assistant in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy firewood, maize, and meat for food preparation

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina; ella tiene 37 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia se dedica a la agricultura lleva años en este negocio la socia siembra café en su chacra y cada cierto tiempo empieza  a cosechar sus siembras para luego venderlos a sus clientes, a veces la socia viaja por todo el Valle Sagrado ofreciendo sus productos, esta la única  actividad que realiza por el momento la socia y de esta forma  saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas de café para seguir sembrando en su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LA ÑUSTA III" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs. Agripina.  She is 37 years old, has a live-in partner and five children.  She has been working in agriculture for several years,   growing coffee which she sells to her customers who are located throughout the Valle Sagrado area.  This is her only job and sole means of income for her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy coffee beans so she can continue growing the crop on her land.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy coffee beans for planting

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una linda niña de tres años y seis meses la misma que es su adoración. El marido es comerciante y agricultor.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a  la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos, lleva cuatro meses que se dedica a esta actividad y dice que le va bien en su negocio. Mientras ella se dedica a su negocio el marido también se dedica al comercio  de CD de música y películas.

Este crédito lo a compartir en dos partes una es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos de Yanbal y la otra para el negocio del marido para comprar CD. Este es el quinto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the "Virgen de Monserrate" communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  The location is known for its traditional culture and the fact that it is just a few minutes away from the best beaches in the province, such as those in San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Mrs. Rosa who is 24 years old and lives with her common-law partner and lovely three-year-old daughter who is the apple of her eye.  Her partner is a merchant and farmer.

She is a homemaker who earns her own money selling Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week on a credit basis with her customers who pay her on a weekly basis.  She receives the products in her home and says her best selling products are perfume and cosmetics.  She has been in the business for four months now and says it is going well.  While she dedicates time to her job her partner sells music and movie CD's.

She plans to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other Yanbal products, on the one hand, and CD's for her husband's business, on the other.  This is her fifth year with the communal bank and she is very happy with the easy payment terms.  Her dream is to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and music/movie CD's

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cerafina; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y fruta ella compra para luego venderlo por todo el Valle Sagrado cuando hay ferias  como Urubamba, Calca, Ollantaytambo,la socia también cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de Calca donde trabaja los días que no hay ferias , la socia es una persona bien alegre ,optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia , esta es la única actividad que ella realiza por el momento. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más verduras y frutas para su negocio y así poder abastecer a más clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LA ÑUSTA III" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Cerafina is 52 years old, married and has nine children.  She buys and sells fruit and vegetables throughout Valle Sagrado at trade fairs in Urubamba, Calca and Ollantaytambo.  She has a stall at the Calca market where she works on days when there are no fairs elsewhere.  

She is a very optimistic, happy person who works hard to earn a living for her family.  This is the only activity she is involved in for now.

She plans to use the loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business so she can keep up with customer demand.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for retail sale

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es: Leonides, es una mujer luchadora de 53 años. Su razón de vida, son sus 3 hijas; a las que saco adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ahora ella vive con una de ellas, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. Como madre soltera, se dedicó día y noche a trabajar sin descanso. Sus terrenos agrícolas, desde hace 20 años le brindaron muchas satisfacciones, ya que sus cultivos de papa, maíz, lechuga y arvejas; son cotizados a buen precio en el mercado mayorista de ciudad de Tarma. “No todas las temporadas son buenas, depende mucho del precio de los productos en el mercado”, menciona. Conciente de está dificultad, hace poco compró una vaca que le proporciona buena leche; el cual comercializa a buen precio.  Ahora ella desea obtener más vacas y emprender la elaboración y venta de quesos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “El paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde logró obtener muchos éxitos y satisfacciones. Leonides, muy pronto cosechará maíz del cuzco, un producto muy cotizado en el mercado; por el tamaño del grano. Después de esta cosecha, sembrará arveja y papa, por ello con el crédito comprará, semillas y varios sacos de abono orgánico, para está nueva cosecha.
texts.en:
Leonides is a hard-working 53 year-old woman.  The most important thing in her life are the three daughters she has raised through great effort.  She now lives with one of them in her own home located in Pongo.  As a single mother she has had to work night and day with little rest.  She owns farmland which has given her much satisfaction over the 20 years she has been growing potatoes, corn, lettuce and peas.  

The crops are all sold at good prices at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  "Not all seasons are good, though, it depends more on product prices at the market." she says.  Being aware of this difficulty, not too long ago she bought a dairy cow so she could sell milk at a good price.  Now she wants to buy more cattle so she can make and sell cheese.  

She belongs to the "El paraíso al progreso" communal bank and this is her third loan through MFP, which has helped in her success.  Soon Leonides will be harvesting her Cuzco corn crop which due to its grain size goes for a high price at market.  After this harvest she plans to plant peas and potatoes.  She will use the loan to buy seeds and several bags of organic fertilizer for the new season.

loans.use: To buy potato, pea and corn seeds as well as bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Mabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mary  tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 9 años los mismos que estudian  el mayor en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es albañil.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta además también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja cinco días de la semana en  las tardes y el sábado que es cuando cobra sus productos trabaja todo el dia ya que deja a crédito. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Tosagua y también en Portoviejo porque allá es más barato.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas. Ella  esta en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos pero ya estuvo en otro Banco en Tosagua donde antes vivía. Sus sueños son tener un almacén y seguir creciendo en su negocio dia a dia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the "Virgen de Monserrate" communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This location is well-known for its traditional culture and the fact that it is only minutes away from the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Mrs. Mary who is 34 years old and has a common-law marriage and three children ages 15, 11 and 9 who are all in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She sells all kinds of clothing, based on customer orders, on a door-to-door basis and out of a small area in her home.  She works five days a week in the afternoons.  On Saturdays she goes around and collects payment for the orders she delivers on a credit basis.  She buys her merchandise in Tasagua and Portoviejo because it is less expensive there.

She plans to use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, lingerie and other articles.  She has been in the communal bank for four years and used to be in another one in Tosagua where she lived before.  Her dream is to grow her business and one day have a warehouse of her own.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años. Su familia lo conforma su esposo Porfirio, y sus 4 hijos, que son muy unidos; pero solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. Gracias a su constancia y entrega, está exitosa mujer logró adquirir un camión con el que trasporta naranja de la selva central a la capital del país, pero eso no es el único ingreso económico que tiene. También tiene 4 vacas, que proporcionan leche suficiente para la elaboración de queso, que comercializa a los pobladores de su localidad. Pero el trabajo que más le gusta a ella es “la agricultura”, ahí siembra papa y arveja desde hace 20 años, los cuales manda a Lima, por medio de un intermediario, un mayorista que comercializa productos en la capital. Sus planes son sembrar en mayores cantidades, para poder obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una asidua colaboradora. Guillermina, dentro de algunos meses cosechará papa; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes naturales para que su próxima cosecha sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a hard-working 45 year old woman.  Her family is comprised of her husband, Porfirio, and their four children.  The children are very united, but they only live with three of them.  She lives in her own house, which is located in the rural community of Pongo.  

Thanks to her perseverance and dedication, this successful woman managed to get a truck.  She uses the truck to transport oranges from the central jungle to the capital of the country.  But, this is not the only income that she has.  She also has four cows who give enough milk to make cheese.  She sells the cheese to the people who live in her area.

However, the work that she likes the best is farming.  She has been growing potatoes and peas for 20 years.  She sends these crops to Lima via an intermediary, a wholesaler who sells products in the capital.  Her plans are to grow greater quantities in order to be able to get better earnings.

She belongs to the “Paraíso al Progreso” Communal Bank.  This is her third loan with MFP, where she is a regular collaborator.  

Within a few months, Guillermina will harvest potatoes.  Therefore, she is planning on buying various sacks of natural and chemical fertilizer so that her next harvest is a complete success.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: La señora Mirtha C. de 36 años de edad, es una de las integrantes del grupo comunal Santa Ana, una alcancía formada hace ya 4 años, que tiene como integrantes personas que día a día se esmeran y luchan por  mejorar la economía en sus hogares. Una muestra de ello es la señora Mirtha C. madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 a un son menores de edad, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de verduras en un pequeño mercado cerca a su casa, y comenzó en este negocio a raíz que la economía en su hogar era demasiada baja y necesitaba de mayores ingresos, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido construir su casa y darles educación a sus hijos, en el futuro le gustaría terminar de construir su casa y ampliar mas su puesto de venta de verduras. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de verduras para la venta de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha C., age 36, is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank.  The bank was formed four years ago.  Its members are people who strive day to day to increase their household income.

Mirtha C. is an example of this.  She has four children; three of them are minors.  She sells vegetables every day in a small market that is close to her house.  She started in this business because income in her house was too low, and she needed greater earnings.

Through her work efforts she was able to build her house and give her children an education.  In the future she would like to finish building her house and expand her vegetable stand.  She will use the recent loan to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica, de 46 años,  es una mujer muy dedicada en sobresalir adelante, vive en su casa que es propia. A lo largo de toda su vida está trabajadora mujer, se ha dedicado a diferentes negocios como a la venta de ropa, productos de belleza, lavandería y la elaboración y venta de chocotejas, que las viene realizando de manera intercalada, hasta el día de hoy. De esta manera sus labores le  absorben casi toda su vida, y eso le hace muy feliz, ya que está segura que trabajado así podrá salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello, en sus mínimos horarios libres, no deja de elaborar sus chocotejas, que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, a pesar de la temporada de verano.  De esta manera, pudo ahorrar lo suficiente, ya que lo necesitaba para terminar de construir su casa, y acondicionar un lugar donde poner su lavadora y secadora; así evitará pagar el alquiler del local donde realizaba su negocio de lavandería. Esté es su 17avo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado compromiso y comprensión con los integrantes de su asociación. Verónica, con el crédito que solicita, comprará detergentes, lejía, en frasco al por mayor y pagar la mudanza de sus artefactos hasta su casa.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 46 year old woman who is dedicated to getting ahead.  She lives in her own house.  Throughout her life this hard-working woman has worked at different businesses like selling clothes, selling beauty products, laundry, and making and selling chocolate candy.  She still alternates between these business activities.  This way her work takes up almost all of her life.  This makes her very happy because she is sure that by working this way she will be able to get ahead and improve her quality of live.

That is why she does not stop making her chocolate candy in her few free hours.  Despite the fact that it is summer time, her candy is in much demand by her customers.  This way she was able to save enough because she needed to finish building her house and to set up a place to put her washer and dryer.  That way she will avoid paying rent for the place for her laundry business.

This is her 17th loan with MFP.  She has always demonstrated commitment and understanding with the members of the association.  Verónica will use the requested loan to buy wholesale detergent and bottled bleach.  She will also pay to move her appliances to her house.

loans.use: To buy detergent and bottled bleach and to pay to move her appliances to her house

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Nola Green Transportation, LLC is a full-time food delivery service.  Erica S., owner of Nola Green Transportation, manages food delivery for restaurants that do not have the delivery volume to merit having their own drivers.  By using NGT, restaurants can offer delivery service to their clients without losing the time it takes to deliver.  

Originally a Texas native, Erica moved to New Orleans after high school to attend Tulane University.  Unable to obtain sufficient financial aid for her studies, she went back to working full-time at a restaurant – something she had been doing since she was 14.  She says she first had the idea of NGT when she began noticing the time that was lost when restaurant staff had to take off to deliver an order.

Erica has rolling two-month contracts with restaurants, meaning the contracts automatically renew unless the restaurant decides to opt out.  Some current clients include Mexican, Moroccan, Middle-Eastern, Spanish and Cajun restaurants.  Erica’s drivers pick up the food from the restaurants and deliver it to the customers.  Right now, Erica has two drivers and will soon hire a third.

Erica is using this loan for operating capital, payment of accumulated debts, and for two months of office rent.  She always needs cash on hand because her drivers are sub-contractors (they buy the food from the restaurants and then collect payment from the customers).  At the end of the day, Erica reimburses her drivers for the money they pay the restaurants.  When Erica’s customers pay with credit cards, Erica does not receive payment from the credit card companies for two days.  This loan gives Erica the needed cushion to pay her drivers until she receives payment from the credit card companies.

Right now, Erica consistently works 13- and 14-hour days.  Though these are long hours, she likes owning her own business because of the freedom it provides her.  She recommends other business owners be realistic when setting goals – things take three times longer than you think they should.  With the added hassle of billing through credit card companies, she also recommends dealing in cash whenever possible.

Erica opened Nola Green Transportation, LLC in September, 2010.  She says NGT’s biggest success so far is that it became profitable within the first four months of opening.  Her 5 year plan for the business is to expand to all of New Orleans, which will require opening an additional five offices, each with its own operational setup, throughout the city.  Erica is 22 years old.

loans.use: For operating capital and to pay for accumulated debts and two months rent

loans.name: Las Crisalias Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama crisalias, está ubicado en San Martin Coapaxtongo , dicha comunidad se localiza en Tenancingo en el estado de México. Este grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes, el grupo se llama así por que en la comunidad hay una flor con dicho nombre. La señora Margarita M. A. es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace aproximadamente 19 años, está actividad la inicio con su esposo, su comercio lo realiza en dos comunidades una en morelos y otra en la ciudad de toluca. Quiere este crédito para poder invertir en los insumos y así obtener más ingresos y mayor clientela. Su familia está conformada por un hijo de 20 años y tres hijas de 22, 18, 14, respectivamente, todos aún estudian. El anhelo de la señora Margarita es poder ver que sus hijos puedan ejerser una carrera profesional y con esto tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en: The group called crisalias is located in San Martin Coapaxtongo.  This community is located in Tenancingo in the state of Mexico.  This group this made up of nine members.  The group is called thus because in the community there is a flower with that name.  Señora Margarita M. A. is one of the members of the group.  She has been dedicated to the sale of food for approximately 19 years.  She started this activity with her husband.  She carries out her sales in two communities:  Morelos and  the city of Toluca.  She requests this loan to be able to invest in supplies and thus to obtain more income and a greater clientele.  Her family is composed of a son age 20 years and three daughters ages 22, 18, and 14, respectively, all still in school.   The dream of Señora Margarita is to be able to see her children achieve a professional career, as with this they would have a better future.

loans.use: To invest in supplies for their food businesses

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Inés, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, de 38 años. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su hijo Gian de 6 años de los 3 en total que tiene. Desde hace 3 años Inés se dedica a la producción y venta de comida, en su local del primer ambiente de su casa. En ella, prepara variedad de platos criollos, que son muy solicitados por sus clientes; por su buena sazón. Por ello termina de vender todo lo que prepara y eso le permite acumular  buena utilidades y con esas ganancias mas los créditos anteriores de todos ustedes, hizo que fuera mejorando de a poco la precariedad de su cocina;  la que hoy en día cuenta con un techo. Por ello se siente muy feliz de realizar su negocio y, sabe que trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y empeño podrá ampliar su local, en la que después más adelante pueda vender los fines de semana platos marinos como el Ceviche y, de ese modo captar mayores ganancias, para brindarle una buena educación a su hijo. Es el 17avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Inés, cada fin de semana invierte en mercadería comestibles para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, invertirá  arroz, fideos y aceites al por mayor, y con  la mayor parte comprará maderas, calaminas, sillas y mesas para tener mayor capacita de atención.
texts.en: Inés is a cheerful and hardworking 38 year old woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and her  6 year old son Gian, of the 3 children that she has in total. For three years, she has worked preparing and selling food in a locale she has on the first floor of her house. There she prepares a variety of traditional dishes that are very popular with her customers because of their good flavor.  She sells everything she makes and this allows her to make good profits. With those earnings, plus previous loans from all of you, she has been able to improve her simple kitchen little by little, and now it has a roof.  She is very happy with her business and she knows that with a lot of hard work and effort she will be able to enlarge her locale and sell seafood dishes on weekends such as ceviche. This will bring her more profit and enable her to offer a good education to her son. This is the 17th loan she has taken out with  MFP and she promises to make her payments on time because she doesn't want to disappoint the people who made this contribution possible. This contribution will allow her to keep working and seeking progress. Inés invests in edible merchandise every weekend for her business. That is why, with the loan she is asking for, she will invest in wholesale rice, noodles and oil, and with most of it she will buy wood, corrugated iron, chairs and tables to be able to serve more people.

loans.use: To buy wood, corrugated iron, chairs and tables to better outfit her business.

loans.name: Zhizho (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhizho esta formado por un grupo de 11 mujeres alegres, carismáticas y muy trabajadoras que siempre estan en la lucha y busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten tener sus ingresos propios. Viven en la comunidad de Zhizho que  pertenece a la parroquia  Victoria del Portete, este sector es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad a realizar diferentes trabajos.

La Señora. María Manuela D. es socia del banco comunal Zhizho y vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 2 años y se dedica la ganadería vendiendo la leche que obtiene de ellas, también se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y pollos que los vende y también son para su consumo. 
Doña María Manuela tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos de 30, 27, 25, 21, 19, 17, 13 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, 4 de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan en la economía de su hogar, su hija de 21 años pasa en la casa y le ayuda en los quehaceres, su hija de 13 años estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa. 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo van a invertir en la compra de más pollos para su negocio. Su meta es  crecer más en la cría de animales.

La Señora. María Luzmila Sánchez vive por la comunidad de Zhizho, tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María Luzmila se dedica hace 11 años a la actividad de los bordados lo que aprendió por habilidad y ahora trabaja realizando obras en su hogar, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja  de lunes a viernes.
Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y esta orgullosa de pertenecer a el ya que tiene muy buenas amigas y compañeras,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva maquina de coser para su trabajo. Su sueño es que sus hijos se superen y darles los mejores estudios.
texts.en:
The Zhizho community bank is made up of a group of 11 cheerful, charismatic and very hardworking women who are always striving  and looking for a better future for their families. They work in different activities that allow them to have their own incomes. They live in the community of Zhizho, which belongs to the Victoria del Portete parish. This area has a cold climate and its people work with cattle and in agriculture and many of them go to the city to do different jobs.

María Manuela D. is a member of the Zhizho community bank and lives in the community of the same name. She has been in the community bank for  2 years and she works with cattle, selling the milk she obtains from them. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and chicken and sells them for consumption.  
 
María Manuela is 53 years old, married, and has 8 children aged  30, 27, 25, 21, 19, 17, 13 and 8. Her oldest daughter is married and lives on her own. 4 of her children work and help her with the family budget, and her 21 year old daughter helps with the housework at home. Her 13 year old daughter goes to high school ad her youngest son goes to the elementary school in the area. Her husband is a farmer, and with both their work, they were able to build a home.  The money from the new loan will be invested in more chickens for her business. Her goal is to expand the raising of animals. 


Mrs. María Luzmila Sánchez lives in the community of Zhizho. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 12, 10 and 8. Her oldest son goes to high school and the two youngest are in elementary school in the area. Her husband works as a bricklayer and with both their work, they were able to build their own home.  

For 11 years, Mrs. María Luzmila has done embroidery, which she learned on her own. Now she works at home without a set schedule from Monday through Friday.

This is the eighth loan she has taken out with the community bank and she is proud to belong to it since she has very good friends and companions there. She will invest the money from the loan in buying a new sewing machine for her work. Her dream is for her children to get ahead and to give them a better education.

loans.use: To buy chickens/ a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is a 53-year-old widowed mother of four children who lives in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her older daughter studies in Germany, while a younger son and two daughters study at a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Although she officially retired in 2009, she kept her current job as a cook in a school dormitory to help support her family. In 2010 she bought a public condominium located near her work. Her two daughters who study in Ulaanbaatar have part time jobs in order to support their daily needs. 

Dulamsuren began a baked goods business in addition to her job, since she has to support and pay for her four children's education. She supplies baked goods for lunch to local school children, which is paid for by the government. She also purchases old towels that are used to clean the school dormitory from a wholesale market, and supplies them to the dormitory at a higher price. 

She says, "Paying the tuition fees and providing a living for four children is not easy. Therefore, I do several things in addition to my job, as I have to make more money until my children finish their studies. Two of my daughters will graduate from University next year."

Dulamsuren is a hardworking person. She is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase the ingredients for her baked goods.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her baked goods

loans.name: Arminda Araminta

texts.es:
Arminda de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vende ropa y con esfuerzo para tener ingresos adicionales en la actualidad tiene locales de ropa.
 
Tiene muchas proyecciones para el futuro por eso quiere seguir trabajando para su estilo de vida y la de su familia con ayuda de su esposo. Vende ropa, pantalones, camisas para hombres y mujeres. Las ventas de la mercadería las realiza en la mañana y en el resto del día atiende a su familia y a los locales que tiene por alquiler. 

Para seguir generando dinero para su familia ella quiere comprar con el prestamo ropa. En el futuro tiene pensado tener mas locales de alquiler para tener mas capital para su mercadería.
texts.en:
Arminda is 40 years old and a hard-working woman who sells clothing.  With effort and to have additional income, she currently has clothing stores.

She has many goals for the future so she wants to continue working to maintain her family's lifestyle with help from her husband.  She sells clothing, pants, and shirts for men and women.  She sells merchandise in the morning and spends the rest of the day caring for her family and the stores she has rented.

To continue earning money for her family, she would like to use this loan to purchase clothing.  In the future, she would like to have more stores to have more capital for her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa, 53, is widowed and lives with her two daughters and a niece in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a house that they purchased with a loan from the bank in 2010. Her older daughter works for a company as a microbus driver, and her younger daughter works as a translator for the same company. 

Tsetsegmaa operated a shoe repair service shop between 1998 and 2007 while she was living in Darhan, the second biggest city in Mongolia.  Then she came to Bayanhongor, her hometown, where she currently lives. She started a retail business selling used Korean clothing at a local market.  Her working capital was 1,500,000 MNT when she first started her business, and now it exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. With revenues from her business, she bought a kiosk that she currently uses to operate her thrift shop. 

She wants to expand her business and diversify the types of goods that she sells. Tsetsegmaa is a hardworking person who says, "I want to finish paying off my home loan in the near future." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more old clothing to sell at her thrift shop.

loans.use: To purchase more old clothing

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en: Erdenebaatar, 32, is married and lives with his wife and a newly born child in Tuv province of Mongolia. He worked for a brick factory for seven years in Japan and started a mud brick making business when he came back to Mongolia in 2009. He currently hires one worker for his small factory and operates his business with a 380V brick maker machine. He also owns a truck that is used for his business. Furthermore, he wants to expand his brick making business and operate a bigger brick factory with many workers. He is a modest and hardworking person who says, " I want to finish my factory building – I have done 40% of the construction work so far." Erdenebaatar is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 tugriks (MNT) to buy more cement as the price is much cheaper in the winter time.

loans.use: To buy more cement

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica de 40 años, tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de golosinas y víveres. La especialidad de su tienda son las golosinas y bebidas. 

Comenzó con la tienda para ayudar a su esposo que es albañil con los gastos de la familia, vendiendo con pocos productos y golosinas en su casa ubicada en Duran completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda. Vende caramelos, cachitos, etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano en su tienda. 
Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar golosinas y víveres. En el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Angélica, 40, has a small candy and general store in her house. The speciality of her store is candy and drinks. She started the store to help her husband, who is a bricklayer, with the family expenses by selling a few products and candy in her house located in Duran. She raised the money to put in her small store. She sells candy, small rolls, etc. She starts work in her store very early. To be able to continue with her business, she wants to buy candy and provisions. In the future, she would like to have money for a store in order to give a good life to her children.

loans.use: Candy, oil, sweets

loans.name: Bayarnemeh

texts.en: Bayarnemeh, 38, is divorced and lives with her three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house that they own on the outskirts of the city and all her children attend the local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. She began a shoe sales business in 2006. She sells new and used shoes at a rented stall at the outdoor market. She has been operating her shoe stall continuously and her business has become more stable. Since she has gained enough experience from her business, she is planning to have her own stall or kiosk where she can operate her business. She is an honest and modest person who says, " I would like to expand my business and increase my profit in order to save money for my children's further study." She is requesting a loan of 600,000 tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoes to sell at her stall in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Cliente Tiene 25 años de edad es madre soltera vive junto con su hijo solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio de Vta de Ropa hace un año Vive en la casa de un Tío .Se dedica ala venta de Ropa en el mercado junto con su hermana tiene deseos de superación desea invertir en su negocio para mas adelante poner un puesto propio tiene deseo de superación y salir adelante junto con su hijo.
texts.en: This client is 25 years old and a single mother living with her son. She is requesting this loan to invest in her clothing sales business. For the last year she has been living in an uncle's house. She sells clothes in the market along with her sister and has a drive for personal development and to get ahead with her son. She wants to invest in her business to put up her own stand in the future.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Adriela Ysela

texts.es: Adriela es casada vive con su esposo en casa propia no tiene carga familiar ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y se encuentran casados ella se dedica al comercio aproximadamente diez años cuenta con un puesto en el Centro Comercial Señor de Luren, una bodega ubicada en su domicilio y una pensión por Jubilación, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Adriela is married and lives with her husband in their own home.  She does not have significant household responsibilities since her children are grown-up and married.  Adriela has dedicated herself to her businesses for approximately 10 years.  She has a stand in the Señor de Luren Shopping Center, a general store located in her house, and a retirement home.  The financing she is granted will be used for working capital.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bayarmunh

texts.en:
Bayarmunh, 38, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife works as a salesperson for a company and his older son attends a local school; their younger son stays at home. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

In 2005 he opened a sports club where he works as a trainer. His students have won medals at several local and national competitions. He wants to expand his club in the future. Bayarmunh is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase exercise equipment for his club and to finish his winter house which has almost been completed.

loans.use: To purchase exercise equipment for his sports club

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tag-ube, Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband Alejandro B., who is 41 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 19 and 21 years old. 

Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living.
